Reviews.Title: “Luxury and convenience without the huge price!:)”
Reviews.Author: Rein66
Reviews.Content: LOVED the casita ! A small private pool was just down the stairs, lawn chairs and umbrellas included. There is a waterpark on property as well! The staff was kind and helpful. A must- do : VISIT THE SPA!!! We also loved Ricos restaurant on site. We will be back ASAP!!:)

Reviews.Title: “More than I could ask for!”
Reviews.Author: prissyshay
Reviews.Content: This resort was excellent for me and my family and my group of 10, 5 adults, 1 teen, 2 babies and 2 toddlers. I will start out by saying my arrival into Phoenix was rocky with my 2 day old iphone being stolen...but i put all feelings aside and enjoyed my phone free vacation! Checking in was a breeze, no lines, great service, we received complimentary bottled water as well as our room preferences. The resort is laid out in several buildings that are disconnected and have seperate parking lots but you can definetly walk from one end to another in 5 minutes! We drove around to find our building which has its own grand lobby and beautiful patio and pool area with swim up bar and waiter service. I was in the north pointe building in a 3rd floor room facing the pool, yes it is loud in the evenings when people are at the pool but with the TV on i could not hear a thing! and my balcony faced a quiet courtyard area with the sounds of a calming fountain! The king suite was very spacious with a large seperate living room with pull out couch and a seperate bathroom and sink area, large flat screen tvs with lots of channels, clean bathroom and floors. I inspected it vigorously as i have a crawling baby. The best part was the french doors that seperated all 3 spaces from each other so you could be in the living room without disturbing anyone in bathroom or bedroom. The fridge wasnt cooling properly and my precious milk spoiled, i called up to the lobby at almost 11pm and they sent someone with a new fridge in less than 5 minutes! Same with towels, i requested 6 extra towels and i received it right away! The food at the north pointe pool was much much better than the waterpark, we ordered almost every item off both menus so this is an accurate representation. We ate at Rico's at the breakfast buffett most mornings, no lines, great service, delicious food, the croissants were to die for! One morning i had a spa appointment and grabbed food to go at the "starbucks" cafe and although my muffins were delicious it was ridiculously expensive $30 for 2 muffins, 2 breakfast sandwiches and 2 bottles of juice! You are better off spending $32 for 2 adults to eat in the buffett! By the way kids 3 and under eat free! The waterpark food i hated but they made the mixed drinks very strong and good! We walked to Aunt Chiladas and had great service...i wont comment on the food cause i am from texas and anything besides tex-mex just doesnt taste good to me...i shoulda known better. Waterpark was amazing...its not a waterpark per say just a collection of a large pool with waterfall area, baby pool, large slide pool, medium sized pool with basketball and volleyball and lazy river. There was also mini golf to the side, you pay one time $5 to play or a $2 per day resort fee for unlimited play. All the pools have towels! There is also a playground and if they are not in session they will allow you to bring your kids inside camp coyote and play in a room full of toys, disney movies playing on the large screen, a puppet theater...perfect for the under 4 yr old kids who could not otherwise attend camp and wake up early and get hot in the playground. There is also a public park by Aunt Chiladas you can walk to and play at. The spa was amazing, i had the best massage and wonderful service there as well! The concierge was very helpful in booking spa appointments, tours to sedona and grand canyon, discounts at rawhide for the kids. Location was great, chinese restaurant that delivers quickly across the street as well as a sports bar type restaurant, there is also a bank of america bank and atm across from the lobby down the street minute drive there is a walgreens and fast food restaurants the airport was 9.2 miles away, 15 minute drive Scottsdale was 12 miles away Rawhide was 25 minute drive One day was rainy and cold so we drove about 8 minutes out to Jamba playland an indoor carnival for kids which was also amazing and so fun for them with cheap carnival food for us to keep our mouths busy with. If you force me to have one complaint, it would be...the wifi is terrible...dont bother paying for it cause it did not work...go down to the lobby and wifi is free there or you can use the business center computers. I asked for a refund of my wifi charge and it was given to me no questions asked. I was there for 4 days and i would have stayed for 2 more if the airlines didnt have change fees, it was so much fun, perfect for me and my family, perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Kids”
Reviews.Author: Pixtonian
Reviews.Content: I was in Arizona for school but my family and kids came down and went to the resort. They loved it the water was heated so even though it was a little cool when we were there the kids loved the water and had a blast. We even went to a park close by one night and went scorpion hunting with black lights great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: CheerMom5
Reviews.Content: We just recently arrived home from a wonderful 6 day family vacation at the Squaw Peak Resort. From start to finish our stay was just perfect. The staff at this resort could not have been more accomodating or professional. We stayed in a 1 bedroom/Queen bed suite which fit our family of 5 comfortably. The layout of the rooms allowed enough space for all of us to move around, while still allowing everyone their "personal space." The resort pools were clean and inviting and were open late every evening, which is a nice change from other hotels that I have stayed at. The waterpark was small, but had enough pools/slides to entertain my children (ages 2, 10 and 12) for all the 6 days that we were there. The only problem I found was that there were not enough chairs in the River Ranch to accomodate all of the guests. If you did not wait in line at 8am to save your chairs, then you pretty much were out of luck finding one. One day I decided to go the the park at 8:45am to find some chairs. I found 1 chair at this time with no towels or belongings on it. I asked EVERYONE in the surrounding area if that 1 chair was available. A nice gentleman and his wife said "No ....Nobody has that chair. It is free for you to take." Well, I decided to go back to the room and get my 3 children to come back to the waterpark with me so that we could all share that ONE chair. When we arrived...2 year old in tow....A nasty woman popped up out of her chair and yelled that we "Took her chair." When I tried explaining that nothing was on the chair, she proceeded to tell me that she came at 8am to reserve 5 chairs and that that chair was HERS! I am just grateful to the kind woman from afar who saw what was happening and intervened. This woman tried to comfort me and did state "I know how ugly it can get out here." I did not want my anger to get the best of me, so I decided to be the better person and walk away from the situation. It may have ruined a few hours of my day, but I wasn't going to let it ruin my stay. I called management about it, and they were extremely understanding and supportive. As far as the restaurants available, I felt that there were a variety of choices at the resort. We ate at the cabana and the Hole in the Wall restaurant most days, and were very satisfied with the selection and quality of the food. They also have room service available, and if you wanted a quick breakfast/coffee in the morning there is a Starbucks located in the gift shop. This area opens up at 6am. One morning my 2 year old was crying that he wanted "milk". At 5 am I walked out to the lobby to see if the gift shop was open. It was closed, but a nice gentleman (?maintanance worker) went out of his way to find me a cup of milk. Again, the staff could not have been nicer. On Easter morning, we had a local florist make Easter baskets for our children and the hotel had the Easter bunny come to our door to pass them out to my children. What a great touch! I thank the concierge for the recommendation of the florist and Easter basket idea. Even as we were leaving and several items could not be packed into our luggage, the concierge sent someone from shipping (Brad) to take care of the items and ship them to our home within minutes of our departure. We will again be visiting family in the area next year, and will definitely be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime Resort”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: Things have certainly changed at this place in the last year! This was our return visit to the Hilton Squaw Peak for 2012 Spring Break. Our trip started out with the front desk botching our room selection. Once that was resolved, we parked our car near the South Pointe tower entrance so that we could use a luggage cart, as there were four in our party for a five day stay. We then noticed that the two luggage carts were locked with cables to one of the pillars. Seriously? When asked if we could use one, we were told by a staffer, "No, we don't use use those anymore because guests left them everywhere". I was a little stunned to say the least. Nevertheless, we all got our excercise hoofing our luggage up to the third floor. We chose this method after waiting forever for the aniquated elevator. The second day was met with more disappointment. Both my wife and I have strong family ties to the area, and a few adult members of our family were coming over for a visit. We asked the front desk if they could sit with us poolside while my children were using the pool. They said of course, for a $15 per person fee! I explained they wouldn't be using the pool, and that they were only coming to visit with us, but that didn't seem to matter. The idiot at the front desk actually told me that "they are like Disneyland, and that you pay regardless of whether or not you use the facility". I thought the comparison to Disneyland was absurd and extremely unprofessional, and was completely out of line. Since both my wife and I are from the Phoenix area, we made good use of our time and knew some of the other activities that made the time there tolerable. The waterpark area is great for the kids, but as others have stated in there reviews, lounge chairs and fast service is hard to come by!! As a frequent Hilton guest, I was extremly disappointed with this stay, and hope this was just a bad, one-off experience. A change in management would do this resort very well. Not worthy of the 4-star rating in my eyes and the last time we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: fligster
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (7) and I stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights over Easter weekend. We arrived around 3:30 and check-in was quick. They give you your room information and then you have to see the someone else to provide directions to your room, which is strange. Our room was in the main building on the second floor. The room was a 1 bed room suite and was an ok size. There was a sofa bed, coffee table, chair, tv stand, desk and little counter area in the living room. There was a mini refrigerator and there was a safe in the cabinet under the television. The living room was a little cramped when you had the sofa bed out. The bathroom was split between a room with the sink and another small room with the toilet and tub. These rooms were on either side of the entry to the bedroom. There were 2 sets of doors so you could close the doors between the bedroom and the bathroom or the living room and the bathroom or both. There was a small balcony with 2 small chairs and a little table. We only used this area to spray on sunscreen. The air conditioner was always running but the room never got really cool, and the air never shut off. There are pools at each building area, but also the River Ranch area where they have the larger pools, lazy river, slide, grille etc. This area was nice, but definitely did not have enough chairs or space for the people at the hotel. If you went down after 9:30 in the morning, you couldn't find a chair to sit on. The lazy river is large for a hotel pool, but was too lazy. It didn't seem to move at all. My son did like the pool and slide. One good feature of the hotel was the Coyote Camp, where you could have your kids go for half day or full day camp. There is an extra charge, but my son enjoyed it. They made crafts, went swimming and learned about the desert and the area. All of the staff there were extremely friendly and helpful. One disappointment was the "nature walk" which actually took place in the parking lot. Areas of the hotel are spread out over the property, which is ok except they do not have the property designed well for walking amongst the areas. You have to do a lot of walking through parking lots without sidewalks and walkways. There is a small gift shop with a Starbucks in the lobby. As a HHonors member I had free internet, but the connection was painfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot!”
Reviews.Author: Family V
Reviews.Content: Liked the watermark. Rooms were good. Fun spot with family! Lazy river was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Gold Member and planned a very nice vacation at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort for week with my wife and two children after seeing the pictures on line. The resort looked perfect online for the kids. I went to the desk to check in, the clerk was rude and just walked away. I had to get back in line and then another clerk got me a room. We unpacked and went to what we thought was a great water park. It is dirty. The furniture needs to be replaced, land scaping redone, and the entire area needs to be cleaned. When we got back to the room the sink had over flowed from the rooms upstairs and black stuff came out of it and got all over our bathroom stuff and ruined everything and when I asked the manager to replace the items that we had to repurchase he gave us one nights credit. We had to change rooms because they couldn't fix the sink and apparently this happens all the time per the hotel engineer. The food at the hotel is aweful and if that isn't bad enough we all got food poisening and I won't get into the details because it was as bad as you can imagine. When we told the manager he didn't believe us. Please save yourself, don't waste your money and stay here. The bed drooped in the middle and my back is killing me. What a joke of a hotel, it needs to be torn down and should lose its Hilton branding.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the middle of Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Catzmother
Reviews.Content: The service at the Hilton Squaw Peak is the best I have experienced in a very long time. Plenty of staff willing and HAPPY to help you. Each time I called the front desk, I got a sunny, cheery person who was thrilled to hear from me. The lazy river if fun for the kids. Get to the pool early if you want a chair. Since our society no longer has manners, ever single chair had a towel and one random item although no person appeared for hours. The resturant choices were many - although pricey. The rooms were small but you shouldn't be spending much time in them. The walk in the hills is wonderful but be prepared. The walk to the trails (on the other side of the highway) is at least a mile (through a pretty neighborhood). Overall a nice stay. Recommended - especially for those with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Left a day early... It was that bad”
Reviews.Author: LisaF58
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg of a road trip thru Arizona and the pictures had us really excited. Let's just say after 1 hour we knew we were going to check out early. The "casitas" are more like 1970's era condo with 4 units attached to each other and each Casita is on top of each other so you hear EVERYTHING. The carpet is old and dingy. Generally disappointing. The kids liked the water park, but we were all ready to get in our car and come home. Not worth what they charge in any way.

Reviews.Title: “OK - fun for kids but not typical Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: documenter
Reviews.Content: The waterpark is the only reason to come to this hotel/motel. I was not familiar with the "Pointe" line of Hilton properties, but now know that it is a definite step below traditional Hilton standards. Biggest issue is that the parking lot is central and you are always walking through it to get around the resort. This certainly robbed the property of any resort qualities it may otherwise have had. However the staff and front desk were really great and the rooms were clean and large. We had the pleasure of also spending a few nights at the Fairmont Scottsdale and even though these hotels are in different leagues the Fairmont was a much, much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilites and recreation options”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights during spring break and overall enjoyed the resort. We picked this hotel based on the generally pretty good reviews here, the extensive recreation/pool facilities, a room that accomodated 5 people and a reasonable price. We definitely agree the lazy river is very lazy- though still enjoyable. The mini golf was fun, but pretty basic. It was nice to not be charged extra 'resort' fees, too. We would happily return on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun !”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: Having a toddler and two teenagers, the Squaw Peak Point Hilton kept us all busy...the water park was a great retreat. Although the hotel does show its age, it is clean and well maintained. The restaurant Rico was a bit of a disappointment service was very slow . But the hotel enjoys a great location and offers something for all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for kids, just OK otherwise”
Reviews.Author: AJC66
Reviews.Content: Our party of two adults and two kids (ages 8 and 10) stayed here for two days over spring break. After all the glowing reviews here, I probably had unrealistic expectations about this resort, but came away fairly disappointed, and can't really see coming back. The property is pretty and fairly well maintained, although clearly some of the buildings are older. The rooms were reasonably well updated, and the high-end toiletries were a nice touch. The fitness center was excellent - I am usually disappointed with resort fitness centers and this one is one of the best I have seen. There is some confusing information about whether they charge for it or not - they told us we had free access as Hilton Honors members, but they didn't seem to be charging anyone. The first source of disappointment was the waterpark - the main pool is much smaller than it appears in the photos on the website, and even with the other smaller pools, the pool areas are simply not big enough to accomodate the number of guests during peak periods - and forget about trying to get a chair if you are not waiting at the gates when the waterpark opens. That being said, the kids still enjoyed the pools. A second pool-related issue is that the waterpark closes at 8 PM, but the smaller courtyard pool is open until 11 PM. If you get a room overlooking this pool and do not want to hear people shrieking in the pool until 11 PM, I recommend asking for a different room. I wish we had. The food situation is what put us over the edge of not wanting to return. A resort this size should have more restaurant options with a greater variety of choices than is available. The poolside options are fine - burgers, etc. The service poolside ranged from extremely helpful and attentive to barely acknowledging our presence when we went to the bar for drinks. Sit down restuarants were terrible. Hole in The Wall, which they described as their signature restaurant offered more burgers and such, plus chili and barbeque options, which may have been reasonably tasty if they had been served hot. There is another sit down restaurant on the property which sounded like it might have more high end / healthy options. After wandering around for 20 minutes trying to find it with the confusing signs, we discovered that it was closed on Sunday, leaving the only dinner options on property more burgers and barbeque, which we found unacceptable. Fortunately, the concierge steered us to the nearby Sierra Bonita restaurant, which was excellent. Overall it's an OK place and not a bad choice for families, as long as you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “It's the pool stupid”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Groarke
Reviews.Content: This was a great spot for our spring break with our little 4yo. She absolutely loved the lazy river pool, and we enjoyed having a suite so that she could go off to sleep a bit earlier than we did. Other reviewers a correct to note that the place does seem to be a bit short on staff, but it is also quite a bit cheaper than some other resorts. The challenge of getting a chair by the pool was a downer. There are two restaurants, but they don't keep both open all the time. Sometimes this was a bit of a surprise (e.g. "available all day" room service was not really available all day). We found the Carol and Eric at the concierge desk to be outstanding, and Zakee (manager?) could not have been more welcoming. Manny at the bell station was a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: AHM
Reviews.Content: The Scottsdale resorts were out of our price range. I am also brand loyal to Hilton/Hyatt/Marriott ....so a combination of factors led us here. The positives: suites with extra room for kids including a comfy pull out sofa, a safe, and a mini fridge. Very clean. The Ranch where the main pool and slide and lazy river are: excellent with kids if you can find chairs. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful all around. There is a small coffee and baked goods store inside the lobby which is handy (see below). Parking is free but can be hard to find a spot at night. The negatives: Its location is not ideal i.e. nothing around it. The layout is sprawling with two larger buildings and a bunch of villas/townhouses. To get to the Ranch you have to trek across a parking. So depending on which building you are in, that could be an issue especially with small kids in tow. The appearance of the buildings, from the old depressing yellow color to the exterior corridors: does not feel like a true resort. Maybe a personal preference, but it just did not look like what I would expect from a Hilton resort. The lobby was very plain vanilla and not very inviting. Overall, the place looked like a very upscale Holiday Inn but not a Hilton.. The first night, we asked for extra bath towels which after 90 minutes and three phone calls, we never got and gave up. They charge for internet per device. Not an issue if you have a 3G type phone.. But charge for internet per device?? Really cheap... Morning wake up was with unavoidable noise of other kids running around in the outside halls; gardeners' leaf blower machines; and large trucks (garbage? deliver?) The main restaurant is in a detached building and about 100 yards from the main lobby, requiring walking thru a parking lot again. Not a big deal for us but would have been if the kids were smaller and it was hot or raining outside. Not a proper setup at all. As mentioned, there is nothing around the hotel so you have to either eat there or drive somewhere.. Overall, it was Ok for 2 nights especially with two kids and because of the water activities but really not on par with typical Marriott or HIlton or Hyatt resorts.. Does not deserve the AAA 4 diamond rating..

Reviews.Title: “Clausterphobics be aware....”
Reviews.Author: Chris O
Reviews.Content: ....of the King Studio rooms. The King Studios are a bedroom of the casita that is blocked off when the whole casita is not booked. They do indeed have a king bed. Unfortunately, the bed takes up almost the whole room. You have about 4 feet of space on each side of the bed and at the foot of the bed. And then there is a wall-mounted flat screen TV. However, if it was placed at the end of the bed like they are in most hotel rooms, you would smack into it getting up to use the bathroom in the dark as it protrudes from the wall. Instead, it is on one side of the bed. Great for those times you want to spoon your honey while catching Sportscenter! A major portion of the tiny closet was being used to store an old and out-of-service mini-bar, the carpet was old, worn, and needed to be replaced, and the shower spit out large globs of water that could put your eye out if you are not cautious. I’ll have to say the bathroom was spacious. It also had a great view of the neighbor’s patio. We first discovered this when we first walked into the room and a small boy was peering through to see who his new neighbors were. The next day we peeked out to see grown-ups sunbathing about 15 feet from our commode. What a great way to encourage people to meet and get to know their fellow vacationers! There was also a mystery door in our studio. It appeared to lead onto the above mentioned patio, but it was locked from the other side. It turned out to be an interior stairwell directly into the downstairs of the casita in which another family was occupying. This was confirmed by the noises of children at play traveling up the stairwell, through the door, and into our studio. Despite getting a steal of a deal (with tax over $200 per night), immediately upon arriving to our room we decided we would spend a few extra bucks in order to have room enough to bring our luggage in with us. However, the front desk unsympathetically told us they were sold out, but we could check back on Friday (it was Wednesday when we arrived) to see if something opened up. I refrained from showering and using the bathroom without the shade down (maybe we would be moved to another room at our neighbors request?) and we instead checked out a few days early and went to another resort. When we left early, the front desk rep again was not too concerned about our experience. We requested that we be given some sort of break on our bill, and he reluctantly took off 30% off of one night. Nice, but hardly enough to make up for our disappointment and inconvenience. All in all, the Hilton Resort experience was quite different from our expectations. Chris O, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ken A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Great for families. The water park is really fun and lots of activates water basketball, water volleyball, mini golf, full sized basketball court, lazy river. Yes this hotel is older but in good shape. The concierge was great with a bunch of fun suggestions. We ate one time at the hotel and it was good. The hotel is a good value if you pay under 200 per night. The rooms are two room mini suites (and I do mean mini). The first room has a TV and pull out couch and the bathroom is in the middle area the other room has a King or two twins. The rooms can use some new furniture but it is not terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jsrm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place. The room was spacious. If you have kids, they will love the pool amenities. Every trip to the pool my son joined in on water volleyball. The rooms were quiet. They have a gift shop next to the pool that sold all of your pool needs - including some nice sun hats that I purchased :) There were also snacks/ice cream to purchase at the store.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: msbachman498
Reviews.Content: The HIlton Squaw Peak in Phoenix was everything we were looking for. It was beautiful, clean and very friendly staff. My kids ages 8,15,16,17 had a great time swimming and having lunch by the pool. Our rooms were really nice, lots of room for a family of six. Our rooms were clean and nicely decorated.. Parking was good and easy to access. We also saw Security walk the property and they were very helpful. We would love another visit . Great time thank you.

Reviews.Title: “A Contented Family”
Reviews.Author: Cuff11
Reviews.Content: Hilton Squaw Peak in Phoenix is a great spot for any family looking for a place to relax and refresh. The facility is excellent; the staff were most cooperative; the landscaping beautiful; and the "all in one package" for family enjoyment on their water park. would have allowed the children (ages 11, 15) to simply stay at the park day-to-day. The location is good and relatively easy to locate inthe heart of the city and close to Scottsdale and its many attractions. The caretaking staff were prompt and quite thorough and the space was adequate. The in-house food was quite good and reasonably priced. We would return even though it is quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend at Pointe Hilton, joining my brother and his family. We were satisified with the staff when checking in and our room was nice. The grounds around the facility are beautiful, but at night the area is very dark and signage is difficult to see. The biggest problem is definitely with the restaurants onsite, or lack thereof. For such a large facility, food service is woefully lacking. The evening we arrived we ate at the Hole In the Wall. The menu was very limited and no 'healthy' choices. The next morning for breakfast, we again went to the Hole in the Wall, as it was closest to our room and to the pool area. We asked for a table outside, vs. bench seating outside. The hostess was quite rude, saying we would then have to wait 20 - 30 min., even though there were several tables available. They don't allow customers to put two tables together, but they will do it when they have time. The Hole in the Wall is also the only restaurant near the water features, yet they close at 1:00. Can't get appetizers, or a late lunch, NOTHING. As far as getting a simple cup of coffee in the morning, other than what's available in your room, be prepared for a very long line. It's too bad such a large, beautiful facility cut corners on food service.

Reviews.Title: “Older, beautiful property, awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: Riyad
Reviews.Content: The Squaw Peak property itself and location is wonderful; I've lived in Phoenix most of my life but when 14 family members call you up and tell you they are "coming to visit" you pull your hair out trying to find the right place to stay to keep everyone from senior citizens to 8 year olds happy. Fortunately Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak fit the bill perfectly. First, the location. You are 20 mins from the airport (take the 24th street exit instead of the 44th street exit when you leave), you are tucked back against the beautiful Squaw Peak which provides some awesome views and hiking for any visitors wanting to experience Arizona. You are also in a nice part of town; along the bottom side of Squaw Peak and right side is Paradise Valley and you are only 20-25 mins from Scottsdale / Old-Scottsdale if you want to do a day of window shopping and eating at great places (or head to Fashion Square mall). I can't express the convenience of this location enough; you will need a car, but you have access to everything you came to see (Have kids? Want to go to the Zoo? 20 mins!) within 20-30mins away. Ok, now about the property... The Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak has been at that location for a *long* time, 20+ years. It was built as an oasis into the side of the mountain with a big sprawling property, a giant meandering pool. A lazy river. A mini golf course. Tennis courts. Basketball. A small mock "Old West" town for kids to play in... it is just a huge/fun property that sprawls out in every direction. You have rooms in the main lobby then you have Casitas and larger living arrangements on the outskirts of the property. Everything is easily walkable. While some aspects of the hotel rooms have been upgraded (like the bathrooms and bedding) other aspects of the rooms definitely still feel the same as they were in the 80s. We had a really nice big suite with a huge living/sitting/social area and the table was straight out of an 80s movie with all the wear and tear you would expect for 20 years of sitting in a hotel room. I think Hilton made the decision to incrementally upgrade the property by redoing all the bathrooms (the most important) then the bedding areas and then slowly doing touch-ups on the lesser details in the rooms like the older couches or tables. Honestly though, everything was clean and comfortable so it didn't bother any of us (and I tend to like nicer things). A few of the families got one of the big 2-story casitas on the property so we got to spend time inside those as well; they were comfortable and clean (Again the bathrooms and bedrooms were new; flat screen TVs, new beds, new counters, etc.) and the living room felt a *hair* older but again, not a big deal at all. Everything was clean, there were no issues with feeling the couches were "Gross" or anything like that. The kitchenette was a small/typical kitchenette which worked perfectly for those families; full fridge was a boon for left-overs and microwave was great for the kids for late night popcorn parties. The weather in December (if you haven't been in AZ before) is a gift from the heavens and is why people winter here; warm sun on your face with a nice dry 60-70 degree breeze is heaven; we ate outdoors at the restaurant on the property and were very happy with our food and the ambiance out on the patio was beautiful. TIP: Visiting this property in the off season (December) is awesome. It is like having a small-town theme park to yourself. The help told us that in the summer (the on-season) it gets SO PACKED that you are shoulder-to-shoulder outside at the pool/mini-golf/lazy-river area which honestly sounded so horrible to me I would have checked out and left had we been there in the summer. Keep that in mind; one of the reasons we all had such an awesome time is because we went in the dead of December (2nd week of Dec) and had most of the place to ourselves and our huge family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice water park”
Reviews.Author: CarlaRJ
Reviews.Content: Is a big and nice hotel with beauty desert and mountain landscape. Water park is nice. Front desk and houskeping service is nice, but they could do better with food at Riccos restaurant ( breakfast is good though) If you stay in this área dont miss Enchiladas restaurant which is two blcks away from the hotel, nice mexican food.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Pointe Hilton”
Reviews.Author: scotts93
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this Hilton property due to my first and second choices for accommodations in the Phoenix area being sold out at the time of my visit. However, this ended up being for the better, as the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort exceeded my expectations in many areas. First off, this resort is designed with the "old-school" layout in mind - a sprawling property requiring the use of many a golf cart by hotel staff members. There isn't necessarily anything wrong with this, but if you're expecting to walk in the lobby, hop on an elevator, and walk 50' to your room, you may be slightly disappointed. My suite was located in the "North Pointe" area, which was a considerable distance from the lobby, restaurant, and fitness center. However, this wasn't an issue for me. The suite itself included a living room area in front (with a sofa, chairs, desk, and flatscreen HD TV) and a bedroom area in the rear (with two queen-sized beds, nightstand, walk-in closet with ample space, yet another flatscreen HD TV). The living room and bedroom were separated by the bathroom in the middle. The bathroom was 'split,' with the toilet and shower located separately from the sink/mirror/counter area. The room was very nice, with plenty of space to spread out. The beds were comfortable and clean, and the bathroom was adequate. I did not visit the water park area of the resort, but I did make it to the fitness center. By hotel standards it was quite large, with plenty of treadmills, free weights, and machines. I would definitely recommend this property, not only to families looking for a kid-friendly resort, but to business travelers alike. With accommodations like this, you really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the most comfortable motel I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Whatever31305
Reviews.Content: The bed was really comfortable! I got a great night's sleep. The rooms are set up as mini suites with a sitting room in front, closet and restroom in the middle and bedroom in the rear of the room with a small balcony and a great view. They have several pools (one in each tower) but the main attraction is a fantastic main pool area with a lazy river, water slide, waterfall and great bar and you can get burgers and "pool food." There are cute shops in the pool area too. You can easily spend the whole weekend just there. We never found the motel restaurant. I'm not sure they even have a restaurant for dinner. Thankfully there are many nearby. Try Aunt Chiladas, just up the street. Fabulous Mexican food and really fun bar with live music every Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: j d
Reviews.Content: Wow, a secret in Phoenix. I just took a chance and I'm a hard person to please. Great service, rooms, and grounds. They could probably charge double and I would still stay there. Great location and moderately priced. Ask for South Pointe property...it has good views and quite but just a short walk to the main pools. One of the best Hilton properties I've been to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool by the room, spa and mini golf”
Reviews.Author: passion4people
Reviews.Content: We got a Casita and it was great for our family and my Dad. Enough space for all of us and be comfortable. I got a massage and she was wonderful and knowledgeable. Mini golf was fun for us all and so was the lazy river to keep the kids happy. The kitchen was small and not much really in it so bring your own stuff to serve breakfast cereal. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort - will return!”
Reviews.Author: GSi_Bailey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the years. Initially, while on business but this time for pleasure. My wife & I came down for Spring Training and decided to come back. We were (surprisingly) upgraded to a casita which gave us more than enough space. It included a refrigerator, microwave but not much in the way of dishes or glasses. It also had a patio/deck where we could relax in lounge chairs. The resort itself is very well kept - beautiful flowers, manicured bushes, etc. The pool area is huge (with a Lazy River). Lots of families, lots of kids. And the staff comes by (not often enough) to take drink orders. The bar and restaurant are casual and, depending on the weather, you can drink/dine outside. Mostly BBQ but very good. Though it is somewhat pricey, we will be returning next year to enjoy this resort.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Maryann P
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 year old child and I went to Phoenix for Spring Training and stayed at the Hilton. What a great family hotel! Our suite was on the 4th floor with our balcony over looking one of the pools. The suite was very nice...wish it had a small microwave, but it did have a refrigerator which came in handy. They also charged for internet in the room..which I think should be included. The entire staff was very nice. The first morning I asked house keeping for extra cream and sugar for coffee, and everyday after that they put a few extra in our room without having to ask. The RIVER RANCH is awesome! The waterpark complex is very nice! My son just loved it...so did we. The lazy river was great. We ate at several of their restaurants....really liked the Hole In The Wall. We will for sure stay here again next year! I can't say enough about the place! I am a flight attendant for a major airline and have traveled many places. GREAT family resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelMel1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed at this hotel. Both times we have stayed in a King Suite in the main building. This is a very large resort with many room options including casitas for larger families or groups. It is a bit of a walk to things...restaurants, pool, etc. It's really not much of a problem since the grounds are beautiful and there is something to see around every corner. The room layout was nice. Living area with pullout sofa. Bathroom itself was small but the sink area was separate so that opened things up a bit. There is a door between the bathroom area and the living room area as well as a door between the bedroom and the bathroom area which is nice for privacy and noise reduction. There is a main pool area and then pools by the buildings.The "small" pool in our area was a nice size with jacuzzi. We didn't have time to use the pool but lots of guests did. The pools are all heated. The main pool is amazing and very family friendly. They have "Dive-In" movies by the pool for kids and families on Friday evenings. Nice touch for the kids. There is a wonderful fire pit in the pool area. However it gets very crowded so getting a seat is tough at times. The Hole in the Wall Restaurant is in the pool area. Good, friendly service but food left quite a bit to be desired. Rico's American Grille is open for breakfast. Breakfast buffet was average..service a bit slow. There is also a gift store with a starbucks inside which served breakfast to go. It was always extremely crowded but offered quite a bit of variety if you didn't mind the wait. All that being said, this is a nice resort but there were a few things that were a bit annoying. Wifi...as Hilton Honors Diamond members we receive free Wifi. The Wifi signal was HORRIBLE. Again this was a large property and I'm guessing the demand for wifi was very high. There were times that we couldn't even log onto the wifi or stay connected if we were able to get on. It was faster to just use the 3G on my phone to look things up if I needed internet. If you have to pay the fee for the Wifi there I would definitely think twice about it. It was annoying enough when it was free, I can't imagine how annoying it would be it I had to pay a charge for it per day! Phone service.....I have a Sprint phone. My husband has a Sprint personal phone and a Verizon business phone. Our Sprint phones had very little or no signal the entire time. When I was in the bedroom area...the phone was roaming. Moving to the front living area brought a bar of service. 3G was off and on....mostly off. My husband's Verizon phone had a good signal and he didn't have any issues with the 3G wireless card from Verizon that he has for his laptop. Just something to keep in mind if you have a Sprint phone! Noise level.....as with any hotel that offers suites, it draws families. Add the fact that this particular hotel has a wonderful pool area and it was spring break when we were there and it draws families and large groups. It was just my husband and I on this trip so for us it seemed really loud. The small pool was in the middle of the suites and was always busy. The main pool closes at 8:00 PM and people move to the small pools which are open till 11:00 PM. The sound really carries between the buildings. We were able to close the doors between the bathroom area and the living area and block most of it out but it was noticeable. When we arrived, they were having a birthday party just outside the lobby area and you couldn't even hear to check in. It was a weekend and the noise level went down once Sunday evening came so maybe it was just the weekend, spring break, lots of kids, all of the above that worked together to make it extremely loud. This is a very nice resort option. Rooms are spacious enough. I wouldn't say this is a luxury resort but there are lots of nice touches.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from 8 days at Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak”
Reviews.Author: myrabbitknows
Reviews.Content: Just back from 8 days with my family at Squaw Peak - 3 adults and one 11 year old child. We had a great time. When we first arrived, I admit the buildings and rooms put me off a bit as they looked a bit tired. However, very quickly we settled in very comforably. The beds are Hilton's standard Dream beds so wonderful and luxurious. While the furniture is basic, it's all new and updated. If you can get past the dated exterior, it is a really is a wonderful place for a family holiday. The pool area is beautiful and scenic, and the property is immaculately clean and beautifully kept. Housekeeping and front desk staff were very helpful and polite. No problem with check in. Although the hotel was full as it was spring break, the place is big enough that the pool and common areas didn't seem overcrowded. We were at Atlantis in Bahamas last year, and I think Squaw Peak is more scenic, less crowded, have as much swimming pool variety for kids, and is less expensive. I have travelled extensively on business and believe my standards might be a big higher than the average, and I was very pleased with Squaw Peak, notwithstanding the dated exterior. Had a great time and would recommend it for a family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: eonny
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights. Check in, no problem. Room 1240 in the North Tower, second floor. Had a living room, with sofa bed and a bedroom, separated by a bathroom. Not quite a suite but close. Balcony was nice but it faced the parking lot. What's makes this a family resort is the four acre water park. Pool, water slide, and the lazy river. Inner tubes provided to meander the river. Restaurants on site but didn't try. Poolside food and drink service. A major negative is the wireless was not free, I believe $8.00 a day. Also maybe because it was surrounded by hills, I could not get cell phone reception, a huge minus if you are here on business. It wasn't just my phone (a crappy flip phone, T Mobile) an IPhone also didn't pick up signals. Anyway, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but decor ok”
Reviews.Author: perkinscat
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here and it is a great place for families. We stay in the suite style room. The pool is great, plus there is mini golf, tennis courts and basketball courts for the kids. Make sure your get the "extra" package that includes the golf, gym, etc. It is not expensive and pay for itself if you plan to use the extras. Check when you book. If nothing is mentioned, call hilton or book it and you can reserve it on site. Great little store on site that has breakfast and good coffee. Rico's (restaurant) on site in ok but pricey. Quite area but close everything. We went for baseball spring training. Will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for a family vacation or a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: teresitail
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip and loved the area, resort and service. This place is excellent for both business and family vacation trips. The rooms are quite spacious and if you stay at a villa, you get your own parking. I wil get back here again whether I am in PHX for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Liloa P
Reviews.Content: First of all, the property and lay-out speaks for it's self. Very relaxed and comfortable. BUT, without the service, it wouldn't make a difference. The property's Chief Concierge, David Richardson is the main reason why my wife and I return time after time. He definitely goes out of his way to make his guests feel at home and caters to their every need. His professional yet, relaxed demeanor exemplify the way hotel front-of-house service should be. The room my wife and I had was amazing as it shared a pool and jacuzzi with only a few other rooms and it was huge! like a two-story condo! This hotel is all about pools as it even has a mini-water park on property as well. Fun for family, great for business, fun for all.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: kit-uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at both the start and end of our trip. Our first stay was for 2 nights in a King room. The room was very spacious, with a nice living area with fridge, sofa and TV, a large clean bathroom and good size bedroom – lots of wardrobe space and a very comfy large king bed. Our stay was very comfortable. For our 2nd stay (at the end of our trip) we were moved to a casita. When we arrived (in the evening) there was still a food tray left from the previous guests outside our room which wasn’t very nice but was cleared after a request. The casita however was very spacious and arranged on 2 floors with a kitchenette area and good sized fridge. The space was very comfortable. I think the casita would be good for a group/family rather than a couple - we were quite happy in the room. There was also a loud humming noise (sounded like a motor/generator) that sounded throughout the day and late into the night however which was annoying however as we were only there for 1 night we didn’t ask to be moved. The grounds around the hotel are very nice and the water park (free entry with room) was an added bonus with lots of swimming pools, a lazy river, bar etc. You can get a nice breakfast at Rico’s Grill onsite (amazing pancakes!), where the staff are friendly, and they also offer a happy offer in the afternoon. The location is pretty convenient and is close to the airport and Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Squaw Peak Birthday party”
Reviews.Author: Mudduck2012
Reviews.Content: Great resort experience. Close to airport. Rooms were spacious and the beds and linens were new and comfortable. Hotel staff was accommodating to our needs. The pool hours seemed to be a bit short for our liking, but we were visiting pre-peak season. Although we did not have children, we noted this place is family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fun get-away”
Reviews.Author: MountainKat
Reviews.Content: The suites are well designed with a bedroom and a sitting room separated by the bathroom. Our only complaint was noise. The walls are not well insulated and our original location on the ground floor by the parking lot didn't help. After the first night we moved to a casita for the remainder of our stay and enjoyed it very much. We didn't choose the hotel for the water park, but really enjoyed it, especially floating in the lazy river and reading at a table in the beautifully landscaped grounds. We found the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful, especially Sam at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family of 4!”
Reviews.Author: jaketollman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here February 9-12. The front desk at check-in were very friendly and we were in our room right away. On entering our room, I was surprised that it was actually a bedroom with a living room, too! Bonus over my expectations. The beds were comfortable, and the room was quiet. My kids really enjoyed being able to go for a hike on a mountain right behind the hotel. The only downside, one of the restaurants was closed, likely to slow season, since the hotel didn't seem to be full. I would definitely stay here again, though. Rico's restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ADVENTURE2002
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this property. The staff was excellent and couldn't have been more friendly. Our room was great and very clean and extremely comfortable beds. The pool was relaxing and we loved the lazy river. Great staff and food at the pool bar. Was a great relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved Over Our Last Stay”
Reviews.Author: Italianflowers
Reviews.Content: More accommodating to traveling with a teenager. The grounds, on-site food options and quality have improved, and the rooms seem overall to be very well-kept. We typically stay here when in town for competitions and would gladly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!”
Reviews.Author: Crisjoy1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit & tho' the weather does a number on anything in the desert the updating was lovely! We had a bi-level casita this trip & it was perfect for our family of 5. (2 teens) The extras like the mini-golf & Lazy River make for a retreat/treat for all of us - 10-50!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jetact
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite style room with very comfortable queen beds and a separate living room/pull out couch/TV/mini fridge/and coffee maker. Wonderful waterpark area with slide and lazy river, large jacuzzi, multiple pools including a sports pool. There were also pools with jacuzzis scattered throughout the property. The property was lovely and well kept with beautiful landscaping, courtyards with elegant fountains, plenty of comfortable chaise lounges and shaded tables. Unfortunately Hole-in-the-Wall restaurant was not open but looked great with a large outdoor cooking grille....Bottle of diet coke was over $3 in the lobby store which was rather overpriced. Didn't have much time to truly enjoy all the amenities but would make this a top choice if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: HJM85
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, we decided to stay here, and did not regret it!! The staff were very friendly and always making sure our stay was comfortable. People have complained that the place is dated, but really it isn't. The grounds were nicely kept and our rooms were very clean. We stayed in a 2 room casita and it was perfect. The only downside was the kitchen, as we stayed for 10 days and there was no stove to cook on, only a fridge, microwave and sink. The amenities were great and we used the pools everyday! The hotel is close to everything, and most of our shopping/hiking were within a 10 minute drive. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “No, not really”
Reviews.Author: Johanna D
Reviews.Content: Not very cölean, didn' see much evideence of the renovation. Terible staff. They actually spraypainted the poolside railings while there were kids there and seemed mad when I told them spraypaint should not be inhaled...seriously. Anyways, the hotel is only so so, nothing luxurious about it all

Reviews.Title: “I loved this Resort, hope to return one day!”
Reviews.Author: TINKGlasgow
Reviews.Content: As the title says, I loved it. The lobby is clean, airy and spacious. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Stayed in a 1 Bedroom with 2 beds, and a seperate living area. Very spacious units, everything was clean and tidy. The grounds are lovely and the hotels never feels busy even when at full capacity. The Water Park is wonderful, and only a short walk from most rooms. Lots for kids to do at the Water Park. Lovely gift shop which sells delicious ice-cream. Ate at the Hole In The Wall, not the best meal ever but certainly tasty enough and fast service. Also ate at Rico's for Breakfast, we had the Buffet which was plentiful and delciious. Our Server was very attentive and plates were cleared away regularly. The location of this hotel is fantastic but better for those with a car. The views are amazing. I would love to return to Phoenix and would need to stay here again. Can't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: tymom06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in November and we very pleased. We were upgraded to a large 1 bedroom casita upon arrival being a Hilton Honor member. It was very comfortable for our family of four. The kids spent all day at the waterpark. Since it was November it was very quiet. It was still warm enough to use a few of the pools but the main pool was freezing cold. It didnt seem to bother us that much as we could use the other areas instead. The kitchenette in the casitas are very small so just be aware that all it is, is a fridge, microwave and sink. It was fine for the 2 days we stayed. Also there is no dishwasher so regular utensils/drinkware just a few paper plates and plastic forks, cups. We did enjoy our stay enough that we will be returning in April. The staff upon check-in and check out were very friendly. I had no issues with customer service while staying there.

Reviews.Title: “very clean rooms and great lazy river”
Reviews.Author: CherryBlossom85
Reviews.Content: we booked the hypo-allergenic rooms and were very pleased. the room was a nice size and very clean and comfortable. the hotel is near good hiking spots and you can't beat the lazy river and lovely pools they have around the property.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: march959697
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a casitas. Very nice. We were a little suprised that the coffee maker only made cups one at a time in a room that sleeps 8, and that there weren't any plates, cups, etc. Clean rooms. Comfy furniture, beds and good shower. We enjoyed the spa and pools. The spa "waiting area" needed more comfortable furniturebut the rest of it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “staff preformance”
Reviews.Author: Gerald H
Reviews.Content: We entirely enjoyed our stay the staff was exceptional and the accomindation were very good we could not have had better service. Everyone wasfriendly and cheerful. the room was far above our expectations

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: skylane9
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort is a must go to!!! The suites are very clean and roomy! The shower was fantastic!!! You should pay more, its a deal!!! Great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice upgrade”
Reviews.Author: 808travler
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to one of the casitas in my last stay during a conference. Very nice one bedroom, kitchen area, 1.5 baths, and 2 queen beds. I had a small problem with the drain in the main bathroom and it was fixed within a few hours. Very good room service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NBere
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and love it. We plan on staying again this March. Rooms are very comfortable, plenty of room for kids and adults. But the complex with the waterpark area is awesome for kids. They have a lazy river, a water slide, basketball court, etc. Kids can swim, play with friends, etc while parents hang out with them or lounge by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Winifred N
Reviews.Content: The setting is lovely, but it feels like they are suffering from financial setbacks. Spa appointments had to be moved because of a problem with water. Information in the packet in the rooms was incorrect about room service hours and restaurants. Everyone seemed a little ovewhemed and information was slow in coming. So not nearly as restful as we had hoped. Spa was also kind of small and lacking in amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in a good area”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: This is a well-maintained property, which is what I come to expect from Hilton. Nicely renovated rooms and the complex is great. The staff are very helpful and friendly. This hotel is located next to one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Barbers26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here following a three week tour of the States and it was the perfect end to a perfect holiday. The hotel really had thought of every little details and the adjoining waterpark was superb - would love to go back one day.........

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: wenjor
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, the staff is nice, but I resent paying extra for wifi in addition to the premium room rate. And after I did pay the daily fee, it only worked for one device - my spouse was not able to connect his laptop. The restaurants on site are....average. One was closed, and the other was blah.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort with truly excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: champagnecaviar
Reviews.Content: My total experience on a one night stay was excellent! I was upgraded to a casita which was very spacious and comfortable. I decided to order room servce because I needed to get some work done in my room. The food was delivered promptly and it was excellent! I ordered a rib eye steak which was prepared perfectly and the caeser salad was very good. The front desk personnel were extremely helpful and the concierge was outstanding. I needed to get some documents printed for a meeting and she took care of it for me very quickly and professionally. I will definitely plan to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for bowl game with kids”
Reviews.Author: BandTdad
Reviews.Content: My wife, 4 year old, 8 month old and I had a great time. The bellmen were great and extremely helpful. My 4 year old is still asking to go swimming. The only draw back was the lack of microwave in the room. But we really didn't have much use for one anyway. The food a the resort was quite good. The mexican restaurant about a block away is one of the best. Could not beat the value or the fun for the Fiesta Bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: crews95
Reviews.Content: We booked our room for the New Years package the hotel was offering which advertised a totally family friendly experience. We arrived early but this was not a problem, they were able to get us into our room immediatly. The "water park" was really just multiple pools with various activities in them (waterfall, volleyball net, etc), there was one water slide and a lazy river (which was so lazy the kids wanted out). There was a nice eating area/bar with a ton of variety but very overpriced ($8.75 for a bloody mary in a 12oz plastic cup). The package included dinner at one of the restaurants. They lost our reservation but quickly arranged for us to be seated anyway. To our surprise the dinner was a buffet, which was not mentioned in the advertisement. It wouldn't have been bad execpt there were not a ton of child-friendly options. Me and my husband had the steak (yes, served on a buffet) which was terrible. They had some activities going on in one room of the hotel which was I assume the remainder of what they offered for their New Years celebration but we did not attend, at this point we were happy to go back to our room and watch movies. But when we got back to our room we noticed very loud music coming from behind our room. We couldn't see well enough to know what all the commotion was from but we thought it was part of the festivities that would end at 10 (according to the package deal). At 1:00a.m., when it still hadn't stopped I called the front desk to see if there was anything that could be done about this. They said they would notify security and couldn't even tell me what was going on there. Nothing was done and the music didn't stop until after 2:00a.m.! Turned out we were right next to a ballroom with a New Years party of their own going on. Needless to say, we got the worst night's sleep ever at a hotel. We got up early and left as soon as we could. We chose this place because they advertised a nice, low-key, family oriented New Years special that made it so our family could be together and we weren't out too late. What it became was a negative New Years memory. The hotel should have kept the families together and away from the obnxious parties going on around the hotel. We will not consider this hotel in the future during a holiday weekend, maybe not ever. Rooms were spacious suites with private patios or balconies which would have been wonderful if not for the blaring music. The room was clean but obviously an older hotel. Grounds kept nicely. Beds were comfy but bring your own pillows! The front desk staff, although not helpful at 1a.m. were helpful and apologetic in the morning. They took a percentage off our bill which was a small consolation.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: I stayed five days and enjoyed it immensely. It was like staying at a Spanish hacienda, very charming. The courtyards were filled with colorful flowers and flowing fountains. My suite was clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. I especially enjoyed a soothing massage at the spa. There were several restaurants to choose from, but my favorite was Auntie Chilada's across the street. They had delicious margaritas! Will be back for sure. Cheryl

Reviews.Title: “Great stay once again”
Reviews.Author: BLS12
Reviews.Content: I've been diamond with hh for years. Squaw peak continues to exceed expectations. Stayed here numerous times throughout the years. View is great and service is excellent. The GM deserves a raise. This coming from a real road warrior

Reviews.Title: “Just one night”
Reviews.Author: JGL78
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight on a stopover to Vegas, after checking in and opneing our luggage we found out that the room had not been cleaned in ages, as we opened the sofa bed there was mouse crap on the sheets and yellow stains which we deducted were the same mouse-mice urine. After calling the front desk they apologized and changed us to another room. Service was very good in the breakfast restaurant on front side of the hotel. Hotel has lot of great facilities however it seems updated and lacking basic maintainance such as good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Awful casitas AVOID”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon500
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days whilst visiting friends. Probably the strangest hotel I have ever stayed in. Spread out massively I needed to drive to breakfast. At check in they allocated a casita. It was awful. Ugly decor. They put me next to a casita where they were doing major work. Basically meant you could not stay in room as so loud. I was too jet lagged to complain. But when I got back at night I was welcomed to what one could only describe as a frat party in casita attracted to mine. I guess that is why hotel is cheap. Never again a ghastly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay with kids!”
Reviews.Author: mary t
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a goverment rate of $100/night. With the price of the room all the pools and the water park were included! Included were the multiple water slides, the lazy river, the hot tub, the pools, they water falls, and there is a full bar at the poolside. We only wished we had checked in sooner so we could have spent the day at the water park instead of only 5 hours. The room was the nicest and biggest we stayed in while in AZ. There was a seperate sitting room with doors which made for a nice evening after the kids were in bed--we were not forced to all be in one room. It was clean and there was a gift shop to check out. We will go back! Addtionally, while there, our air conditioning was not working. Within 15 mins it was fixed and we were offered another room if we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort , everything you want.”
Reviews.Author: rmfVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 days. w/ 6 and 9 yr old. Pools were beautifully maintained as was the pool area. Water was nice and warm. Many different areas to lay in the sun in peace or if you wanted to watch the kids in the pools or ride the lazy river. Lots of facilities for both kids and non kids: gym, spa, coffee shop in lobby, restaurants, pool bar, hot tubs, mini golf, ice cream shop. All were very well maintained and well staffed. The staff was amazing. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. We asked a few 'unusual' requests, and they were always ready to help anyway they could. I have stayed in many Hilton properties and I would rate this the best so far. Can't really comment on the restaurants very much as we ate off site mostly. The only con I can think of, is that it would be nice if they offered some 'suites w/ kitchens' for longer stays. Other than that, this is a fantastic place to stay. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice southwest styled property but lacking in some areas”
Reviews.Author: spgISLANDtraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice resort when you pull up albeit typical to most southwestern places - very spread out and a bit confusing to get around at first visit. Staff is very hospitable upon check in and with room service (which was very fast every time). The resort is a nice 3 star property maybe 3.5 but nothing close to a 4 star. The rooms are nicely appointed, but things such as water pressure (which is terrible in the shower) are overlooked. Towels are very old in baths and should be recycled for newer plush towels. They have a small fridge for use, but it was not on so useless. Empty mini bar as well, and the restaurants are so far on other sides of property you don't want to "just run down and grab a drink". Room service menu is not robust enough on american classics such as a BLT, tomato soup, etc - not everyone wants southwestern influenced foods or pizza. Didn't get a chance to go down lazy river due to temps only reaching 60 this time of year, but it looked nice enough, and I could see a lot of children in there in nice weather. Also the place is classic business convention center layout. Large floorplans, separate sitting area in room with couch and chair, overly spread out facility, golf, etc. I would say this is acceptable for business, but not so grand if it was a personal trip or with family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family resort”
Reviews.Author: Doombugy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in a 2 bedroom casita for the national field hockey festival. We had a great time. The kids loved the water park with lazy river, water slide and mini golf. Staff members were friendly. The "Hole In the Wall" restaurant was good. Poolside service was great. Only negative was the over priced Thanksgiving buffet offered to field hockey teams. Total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Family Oriented”
Reviews.Author: Rutat2d2
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property over Thanksgiving in a three room casita. It was one the farthest away from the pool area and very quiet. The staff was excellent and our concerns were handled appropriately. We traveled with two children and found the facilities to be above our expectations. The kids loved the pool area and mini golf as well as the casita pools. The restaurants on site are decent and there are a few within walking distance as well. The only thing negative that i can say about this property is that the casitas have a small kitchen area...but only a microwave and a small refrigerator. There is no way to cook in these so don't plan on pulling off that family dinner. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly, AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: PeakValentine
Reviews.Content: Pro's - Lazy River for a nominal $2.50/family upcharge (waterfalls, side pools, lazy river, waterslide, putt-putt golf, tennis, basketball, western town, toddler pool). -Two-room casitas (with an upgrade), give access to private pools the kids loved swimming in during the evening. - Property is the best, clean,views of Squaw Peak, lush green grass, and a tree canopy that gives a cozy, oasis feel. Although the property is 30+ years old, Hilton has done a good job with updates and maintenance. - Staff was very professional and friendly, from the wait staff at the western Hole-in-the-Wall restaurant, the maids, the river ranch staff, and the front desk staff. Location - easy access to the 51 freeway and 10 miles from anything you want to visit, Tempe, downtown PHX, zoo, Scottsdale, Cardinals stadium. Plus the wonderful hiking in the Squaw Peak mountain park (walking distance). - Food, three restaurants to choose from. Inexpensive by hotel standards, <$10 breakfast). Rico's for dinner/drinks, (local's even frequent) and Hole in the wall for breakfast and lunch. Con's - I wish they would invest in battery operated maintenance carts, the gas powered ones are a bit obnoxious. - The casita now has wireless internet, That is a pro, but the con is it worked only 1/2 the time. I think the whole resort's interent was buggy during my stay. But, then again, we were on vacation, I didnt really need to be online. This was our 10th stay in ten years. The resport gets better each year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service! Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Banshee123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! Rooms are spacious and clean. The service provided by the front desk staff was superb. Very friendly and very helpful. This hotel is great for children, with the water park offering plenty of activities for the family. Would love to stay here forever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: AreWeHavingFunYet
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a long Holiday weekend at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort. The sun did not cooperate much, so we didn't spend leisurely hours by the pool as we had planned. We found the resort pleasant. Our room was nice. It had a living room area with couch, chair, desk, flat screen TV, mini-fridge, and coffee maker. The separate bedroom, also with a flat screen TV, was nicely decorated. The bed was comfortable, the sheets crisp, and the decor very nice. The hotel was pretty empty due to the season, so it was very nice and quiet. We enjoyed the jacuzzi and comfy lounge chairs just steps away from our door. We didn't use the restaurants or children's pools, so we have no review of those. The staff that we met was courteous and pleasant. If we had one negative complaint, it is that a cigarette butt (not ours), was on a chair on our private balcony the entire time. That's it. Otherwise, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “busy but you can get away from it...”
Reviews.Author: JustHangingAround
Reviews.Content: In the middle of Phoenix, yet you get the impression of space and calm, this hotel has bags of south western charm and drive up conveniece. The hotel is split into 'the hotel' and 'not the hotel', the latter of which are a set of family friendly cassitas often with their own pool, split level, underground parking, and lounge and upstairs bedrooms. choose these if you can, its just soooo different from a normal hotel experience. the kitchen could be better (theres only a large refrigerator, but room for a bigger kitchen...Hilton take note). Forget location, as presumably the visitors are there for the winter sun. The pool extravagance is a bit 70's, but the fitness centre is up to standard and for tennis freaks, 4 courts with guaranteed sunshine till the sun dips below the peak (and the 51), makes this an ideal stay for families and especially tennis and fitness enthusiasts. Add that to the proximity of newly developed malls on the 101 makes this hotel an ideal location for families and even business people who want some wholesome fun.

Reviews.Title: “nice; main pool area could have been a little less tacky/crowded”
Reviews.Author: beleagureddaddy
Reviews.Content: was there on business with my wife and kids (9, 7 and 5) over april vacation. can't say enough about the kids activities. the lazy river, mini-golf, water slide, tennis are great. you could spend all day there with the kids and never get tired of it. my wife went to the spa for a simple manicure/pedicure and was pleased. the restaurants on property are also decent (other than the pool side tavern which was just straight up fried food). we stayed in a two bedroom casita - great amenities, clean, maybe not spacious, but sufficient room for a family of five to be comfortable. the hotel had lots of nice little add ons (lemonade in the reception area, we were there over Easter and they dressed up an employee as the easter bunny to wander the grounds and hand out chocolate eggs and jelly beans to the kids). the workout facility was decent and there was a nice lap pool nearby. i would have rated the service a 5, but for the fact that when we flew out the golf cart that was supposed to pick us up at our room and take us to reception was 10-15 mins late. one other thing worth mentioning is the scene at the main pool. it's busy. the hotel offers a staycationers package and i suspect folks from the area bring along their friends. i believe they also sell one day passes the drinking starts early, which is fine but perhaps not the optimal environment for the kids. also, it can get a bit tacky. thankfully, the property does have a number of smaller satellite pools that are much less crowded. there was one about 10 seconds from our casita that we had to ourselves for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “nice, spacious clean and yet boring...”
Reviews.Author: avchamp
Reviews.Content: The property is quite large, with ample parking, rooms are clean and spacious. The main pool is small but the water park attached to the hotel makes up for it. The only problem is water park closes at 6:00 PM and if you are there on business you may not get a chance of using it during regular hours. This is a very quiet place, no music, no live bands or anything. when I was there one resturant was closed. the only open resturant is Rico, the food is not bad but a bit on the expensive side. price is reasonable so all and all I say it's fine. Personaly if I had a choice I would stay in Hyatt in scottsdale which is nicer and much livelier than this place,

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but lacking personality”
Reviews.Author: minkewaleveld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a business/vacation. This was where our conference was taking place. When we first arrived, the hotel was remodeling their front entrance. We drove around for a while trying to find the "temp" main entrance, with no direction as to where it was. Rooms were nice, and clean. We were located in the North Tower. The room that we had was quite big. For a family I could assume it would be comfortable. We just had to MUCH room. Our room was on the top floor. No views. Our patio was overcome by a local tree. Which was fine by us. It kept us from looking at the parking lot. This place has a HUGE parking lot. You can get lost so be aware! The only problem I had with specific service (maids) was he/she would always leave all the lights on after they left. Also, there was no specific service for recycling. I did ask at the front desk about that, and they told me that I could go to their trash area which was behind the hotel on the South side and dump it there. They wouldn't even take it for us! When I found out that the movies on the TV that were provided by the hotel were $15.99 a piece I freaked out. Not very affordable. When I had first arrived I had scheduled a couples massage for my husband and I. When we checked in at the spa they told us that there couples massage was in completely different rooms. To which I replied, "Then it's not a couples massage". The massages actually turned out wonderful. I did mention to them that couldn't advertise a couples massage as such. They didn't really seem to take notice. I also received a mani/pedi in a different area of the salon and much to my dismay there was no one in the salon. No one. Just me and the nail tech. It was kind of lame. There was no art work on the walls, no music playing, no TV in the background. It was strange. The nail tech herself was a delight, but the place was just lacking in personality. The Business Center was a sham. I went in to check some email and print out a boarding pass. You had to pay to print it and you also had to pay to surf the interent. It was outrageous. I think it was like $3.00 a min.
