Not to mention they only had 2 computers and 10 min I was in there they kept asking me to get up and switch to the other computer cause they couldn't get the other computer to print. It was a nightmare. I felt so bad for the guy that was working there. He was trying to help me, had another woman yell at him cause she was upset about the boarding pass, a gentleman asking him why his computer wouldn't print..not to mention 2 phone calls that he had to take cause they were "tech" calls. It was pretty bad. So, last but not least the "Waterpark". They advertise on their website that they have 2 1/2 acres of pools and that is the truth. The pools, in my mind was really the reason to book a stay here. There was a "kiddie" pool, 1 main pool (which was quite large and has a waterfall), a "sports" pool, a water slide and a lazy river. I never entered the kiddie pool, and by the looks of it, neither did anyone else. The main pool was really cool. That was where I spent most of my time. They do have wait staff that are supposed to serve you out around the pool, however no one ever came to me, I had to seek them out and order something. The "sports" pool is a little smaller then the main pool. It's a little more subdued. They also have the "lazy river". Which was so lazy.. that you literally had to walk your inner-tube in the river to actually move. It wasn't really fun. I didn't try out the water slide. I had been told when entering the park that the slide was turned off, but if I decided I wanted to slide all I had to do was ask and they would turn it on. Weird. There was a hottub as well. The fitness area which was connected to the spa/salon also had it's own pool for working out. I went to that pool twice. It was nice because there were no children in it. Now, each section of the hotel the North and South tower had their own pools in the center of the building. Outdoors. My husband reminded me that there were these pools also, if I would like to try them. The one night I decided to try one out, I found between 50-60 people all sitting at tables around the pool having a catered dinner staring at me in my suit. There were no signs saying the pool was closed for an event or messages on our phones from the front desk. That was annoying. So, be aware before you head down to one of those pools for a night swim. By the way, because I had made an appointment at the spa for the massages and mani/pedi, I received phone messages all week from them stating their daily specials. So, beware!! If you are thinking about staying here for the waterpark, DO IT! It was a blast. If you are wanting a romantic/warm place to stay. I don't think this is your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back”
Reviews.Author: mummytravelor
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderfull stay here and will return.No issues at all with the front staff smooth checkin and throughtout the Hotel found all staff really friendly.Great place to come with family and my son fully occupied with the Lazy river / slide etc..The standard room we had was a little old in looks.The shower area was not the best.But the beds were very comfortable.The only issue i had was i made enquires to visit Phoenix Zoo and was told i could organise a car through the Hotel which i did.My mistake on not checkin the price and when we were dropped off 1 adult 2 children we were charged 40 dollars (one-way).On the return we got a cab that was only 20 dollars.My fault for not re-checking this after my return to the hotel so would not book cars through hotel again.Apart from this i and my family had a fun relaxing time though the hotel was at it's quite seaseon and would hate to be here when busy.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: joemcgeever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Squaw Peak for a weekend to go to the Steelers-Cardinals game. Other than the distance from the stadium everything was top notch. All employees were very nice. The place was very clean with neatly manicured grounds. All pools were incredible and not overcrowded at all. I read some of the negative reviews for this place and I urge you not to believe them. I am the Night Manager of a resort hotel myself so trust me, this place is everything it's advertised to be and more. We will be back the next time the Steelers are in town!

Reviews.Title: “relax in the Heart Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: sailorman9
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Point Hilton for one night as it was close to the airport (10 minutes) and easy to find. We were quite surprised to find the hotel was in the heart of Phoenix because it felt as if we were in a resort on a island. We had reserved two king rooms but upon check in we were upgraded to two king suites at no charge. From the check in to check out everything was very nice and easy. The pool areas were clean and depending upon which pool you decided to go they could be quite or fun. Overall I would reccomend this hotel. Its clean, convienent, and a great deal for the cost. Bonus. Try Rico's restuarant on the hotel site. Great food at good prices. I reccomend the Green Pork Stew!!

Reviews.Title: “Resort for all ages”
Reviews.Author: Shoe1
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this resort. Due to the water park being across the parking lot from the main hotel room it was pleasantly quiet in the rooms despite the abundance of children. This makes it an excellent resort for any age. If you are an early bird Rooms 2432-2435 have beautiful AM sun over a mountain view and then afternoon sun in the living room part of the suite. Great room layouts with doors to separate the living room to the bathroom and then the bedroom provides a perfect degree of privacy but also makes the rooms great for entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Spa Experience of my life!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LiileHeidi
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Trip Adviser reviewer. This is the first scathing review I have ever given. I hope I never have to give another. First I should say that I am a local and I have been to this resort several times. I even stayed there in a Casita on my wedding night a year ago and had a great time. The Casitas are dated but nice, the pool area and lazy river is great, and we had a great breakfast buffet in the morning. The resort itself is worth staying at. That being said, I went today with a few girlfriends for a spa day (we do this every few months) and had what was without a doubt the most miserable spa experience I have ever had. The spa itself is exceptionally small and there is nothing luxurious about it. I would consider myself somewhat of an expert regarding the local resort spas, and this one just lacked all the niceties of the others. The room where you wait for your service only has four small chairs for example, while every other spa I've ever been to had a large room with luxurious couches and pillows, etc. I wouldn't have bothered to complain about this in an online forum if it were not for the HORRIBLE massage I received. My massage therapist was really high energy; almost manic like, not calm and pleasant the way a massage therapist should be. I have expensive extensions in my hair and asked her not to massage my scalp. She laughed and told me she was going to touch my scalp anyway. I was totally dumbfounded and did not know how to respond. I spent the massage totally tense, especially when she was working my neck and shoulders in fear she was going to put her oily hands into my scalp and ruin my extensions. (She never did thank goodness, but she did have to ask me to relax my shoulders at one point because I was just so tense.) This woman had the worst "touch" I have ever experienced. She barely put her hands on me, very lightly caressing me but not massaging me at all. I considered asking her to go deeper (she never asked me how I liked the pressure) but she had what felt like warts on the inside of one of her palms that were scratching me as she touched me so I honestly couldn't stand the thought of her touching me any harder. The whole experience was so miserable. If felt awful, I was disgusted by whatever was on her hands and I almost asked her to stop twice because it was just so unpleasant. I managed to endure the whole thing only because of my fear of upsetting her. (I should mention that I did have a great facial a few hours later by a different lady who was awesome.) When I went to pay I was told there was a mandatory 18.00 tip per service. I had managed to not complain up to this point, but the fact that I had to suffer through the hour and pay for it at all was the most I could do, adding a totally undeserved "mandatory" tip was just more than I could manage. I shared my experience with the very young man at the desk who was totally ill-equipped to handle a customer service complaint. "Well it wasn't supposed to be a deep tissue massage" he said, not rudely, but just immaturely. I informed him that I have never had a deep tissue massage but have enjoyed dozens of Swedish type massages and I have never walked out significantly more tense and stressed than when I walked in. Clearly frazzled, he asked me if I would just please pay the required tip and he would have his manager call me. It was apparent that he was totally flustered and not trained to handle a complaint. I didn't want to give the kid a hard time so I just paid it and left. We shall see if I get a call from the spa manager but I don't know what they can do now to resolve the situation after they already charged me and required me to pay a large, very undeserved tip. Basically, this is an older but nice resort with some desirable attributes, but the spa is just absolutely horrible. Do not visit this spa for any reason. There are so many wonderful, pampering, luxurious spa resorts in the valley where you can get a fabulous massage AND fabulous service; there is just no reason to suffer at the Pointe Squaw Peak.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: elledub
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a bit nervous booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews. We had a queen suite in the same building as the check in. We were able to check in and be up to our room that was facing the pool in about 10 minutes. The room was more than I expected. Everything was very clean and the air conditioning worked perfectly which was great because I think it was around 103 degrees F. The beds were very comfortable with lots of big pillows. We ate at all the restaurants on site and enjoyed all of them. We really liked the ambiance at the Hole in the Wall it was quite fun and the food was quite good. We really enjoyed Rico's though, we ate at the restaurant one night and ordered room service from them one night and both dinners were very good. The staff is very helpful and extremely cordial. The concierge was exceptional and very knowledgeable both times we used them. Out only complaint and it is minor was the hours of the lazy river. It was only open from 10-6pm which we didn't fee; was long enough. We also felt that the drink service at the lazy river was quite slow. I did go to the spa and have a treatment and it was very good. The staff really accomodated me to fit me in at the last minute which was wonderful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would absolutely stay there again with no hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “First stay here, won't be my last!”
Reviews.Author: CoronaFallsChurchVA
Reviews.Content: Spacious property, wondefully appointed, rooms renovated and the gym is fantastic! My room had a wonderful view of one of the pools. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. My room was quite large and I loved the sitting room and extra space. It was like an apartment. I don't have kids but this would be ideal for more than 2 people. If I had more time, I would have been able to take advantage of the amazing large pool and waterpark, lazy river. The breakfast I had at Rico's was amazing! It was packed with guests. There was a chef making omelettes to order - mine was incredible. What impressed me: the homemade granola for my yogurt and fresh fruit. This was one of the best granolas i have ever eaten. The manager stopped by everyone's table to ensure everything was going well - how often do you see a manager skulk away from guests? not here - he genuinely wanted to know how everyone's food was. The location is centrally located as well - what a beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL-GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ljstella64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights on business and were very pleased with the service and our room. The grounds around the hotel are beautifully landscaped with a waterpark for the children (and adults) and a great view of the mountain it's named for. We ate at two of the restaurants and found them to be a bit pricey, but the food was good. If you are an out-of-towner you'll be close to a major north-south freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak”
Reviews.Author: Richard195418
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with swimming pools and a water park. Gets very busy in July/August but can be great out of peak season such as April and May. Staff excellent. Have stayed here on at least a dozen occasions and is always reliable and good value. Also good location close by Squaw Peak Freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Roomy Casitas”
Reviews.Author: Nikon200traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was a key to my choice of the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort, which is located on 16th Street just north of East Glendale Avenue in Phoenix, convenient to Route 51, a major north-south artery. I wanted to be centrally located to take advantage of the many attractions in Phoenix and positioned to take day trips to Sedona and Tucson. Most of all, I didn't want to be sequestered in an expensive Scottsdale resort complex, surrounded by overpriced shops and restaurants. I chose a casita -- which almost was as large as a townhouse -- for my family, which featured two bedrooms, three bathrooms and a living area with pull-out bed. It was roomy and comfortable without being ostentatious. The kids loved the freedom to explore the "campus," and they were delighted with the waterpark, just steps from our casita.

Reviews.Title: “Not Just for Fun- This is a Great Hotel for Meetings, too!”
Reviews.Author: Andriegel
Reviews.Content: I represent an international consortium of cell phone manufacturers. One of my responsibilities is to organize events for 80-100 senior technology executives for one week of intensive meetings three times per year. My customers are frequent world travelers, and are quite discerning regarding the food and services they receive while traveling. My opinion and experience is that the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peaks is by far one of the best North American business meeting locations that we have used in the past 10 years. For worry-free meetings and events, I would not hesitate to again put my full faith in the service and quality of the Hilton North Point Squaw Peaks. Pros: *Excellent Sales Staff: My representative was the same person from start to finish- great continuity. *All-Pro Banquet staff: Some of the best in the business, the core Team has low turnover and superb attitudes and skills. *Superior food: The Pointe Hilton Chef and Staff provide food of the highest quality with "Farm to Fork" style whenever possible. Ingredients and selection are top-grade! *Complete refurbishment of the resort is nearly complete. The property upgrade was planned well as to be virtually transparent to the guests. *True HD television: so many hotels provide updated TV's while still feeding those sets with outdated (cheaper) analog signals. Pointe Hilton provides a wide variety of HD channel selections. *The in-house Audio/Visual team will help you pull off a successful meeting without a hitch! Any minor issues were taken care of with the highest priority. *Fast Internet: property has some great bandwidth to the door and they say they are adding even more capability! Cons: *Limited restaurant selections off-property within walking distance. Grocery stores and services are close by, however. (about 1/2 mile) *Slow elevators: luckily, it's only a three-story complex. *Tap water was "murky" smelling and tasting. This is mostly the fault of the local water utility, but I hope Squaw Peaks Hilton would address this issue. Be sure and drink bottled water, IMHO. *Confusing to navigate on-site. It's a large property, and the North building is identical to the South Building. Be sure and get a map! *Luggage carts are locked up, forcing you to call for a bell-captain. Sometimes I just want to do it myself! *Annoying voice mail SPAM advertising: We would arrive back to our sleeping rooms to see the message light lit, just to find out the message was an advertisement for the Spa services! we have never experienced this in any hotel anywhere in the world. In this day and age of SPAM and advertising overload, I hope the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak would reconsider this strategy.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families but needs some TLC to bring it to Hilton par...”
Reviews.Author: niknpatel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last month after being stuck in Phoenix for an extra few days due to Hurricane Irene. Being that it's a Hilton property, and I am a HiltonHonors Gold member, we decided to stay here. I think that it must be a new addition to the Hilton Family of Hotels, as i am sure there will be a PIP that Hilton will require this property to do in order for it to maintain it's Hilton flag. The rooms and decent, and large size, but the property overall just needs some TLC. This is a VERY LARGE resort with a North & South building to it. It has a waterpark attached to it, which was fun to chill there for a little while, but then it got a little dirty,rowdy etc from the locals being there apart from just the guests of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful courtyards”
Reviews.Author: Shrappy
Reviews.Content: It was a bit confusing to get, we hit 16th ave before 16th street. Spent one night there but spent most of the time by the pool. The lazy river/water park was fun, alot of kids running around though. Luckily there was another pool outside our room in the middle of the courtyard we sat by the following day.Much quieter.The chairs to lay out had padding, so was really comfy.The rooms were impressive. Minus not having a micowave. Checking in we were given an upgrade without even asking, That was really nice. We spent most of the first night taking picture around the hotel. Alot to look at. Beautiful building and entryways. I would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not up to Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: Nesser68
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before with our 2 young children. This trip we decided to splurge on the bi-level casita. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS! You pay the extra money only for the larger living space. The "kitchenette" offers nothing extra except for a bunch of empty cabinets and a larger fridge. No plates, silverware, hotplate. There was a one time supply of plastic silverware, somepaper plates and bowls left behind, no refills, no cups or glasses. So I washed it all after we used it. No dishwashing supplies, dishtowels, etc. Living room was still dirty when we checked in, one of the locks on the front door dind't work and the curtain rod was broken. The rest of the casita was about the same size as the regular rooms. The casita does come with a private carport. But if another guest decides to park there, the staff says there is nothing they can do but ask the security people to leave a note on the windshield requesting the guest to move the vehicle! USELESS. Internet is almost $12 per day! Watercoolers at the pool offer lukewarm tab-water which tastes a lot like the pool due to all the chlorine. Waterpark in desperate need of maintenance, edge of pool falling apart. Promised pool entertainment for kids didn't start till after a few days one of the guest pointed out to the pool employees that this was part of their job. Pool at the Casita is tiny and shared by a lot of Casita's. Very shallow so the water gets too hot to cool off in, the jacuzzi is too hot to bear.Our first 2 times we stayed in the regular rooms and they're in need of updating as well, especially the A/C. We will look for alternative lodging next time we go to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: canadiancook
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at Squaw Peak with our two busy boys and found enough to do to wear them out each night! The water park was busy as it was a long weekend, so finding chairs was a bit difficult but we loved the water slide and various pools - families with older kids might not find it as exciting though, as there is only one slide and the lazy river is very slow. Make sure to treat yourself to some yummy ice cream after at the ice cream shop inside Rodeo Drive! When we grew tired of how busy the water park was, we hung out by the pool by our room and enjoyed the swim up bar for a lovely afternoon cocktail. Spent an afternoon at the spa too, where I was beyond spoiled with a hot stone massage & a manicure. The resort is going through renovations but the staff goes above and beyond to make sure guests still feel spoiled. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: BeautyEye
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was excellent starting with the most accommodating staff of any hotel I have ever stayed in, the surrounding restaurants on the grounds also provided excellent service, friendly, welcoming atmosphere the food was remarkable in each establishment. The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. I would recommend this location to everyone .

Reviews.Title: “Staycation”
Reviews.Author: ORSmith
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I stayed for one night in August for a "Staycation". We booked the studio room, but were upgraded to a one bedroom suite at check in. So that was a nice surprise. The front desk/lobby is undergoing renovations so they had check-in at their conference center which was fine. Room was very nice, had been upgraded recently. Our room faced one of the private pools located in between the buildings. Spent most of our 2 days there at the River Ranch sitting by the pool and enjoying the Lazy River. Being a weekend in August it was packed, but we still had a good time. Prices for food and beverage at the pool were quite expensive, but we knew that going in and brought some bottled water, snacks etc. with us. Overall it was a nice getaway and we would go back, but maybe not a weekend in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “A great escape from the heat!”
Reviews.Author: Sidthebeachbum
Reviews.Content: We spent the Labor day weekend (okay, only 1 night) at the water park. It was busy, but they allowed us to "hang-out" at the pools and water park 4 hours before check-in...and even after we checked out too! The room, a 2-story Casita, was clean and efficient. Not outfitted as well as I thought but still very usable....it is not a rental condo. The grounds were nicely kept, and the staff mostly friendly. We had drinks and snacks there and went out to Babbo for diner...good too. The kids had a blast at the water park..my 4 yo enjoyed it and had plenty to do...some of these parks are not great for little kids but this one had a beach-entry pool so she could splash around in the big pool and not be stuck at the kiddie pool. A new stop for our Staycation plans in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Visiting my Brother”
Reviews.Author: Steven T
Reviews.Content: I‘m visiting my brother and decided to take him to the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort in Phoenix AZ. I stayed in one of the two bedroom bi-level casita, with two queen beds in one bedroom and one king bed in the other. Firstly the registration desk was being remodeled. At the temporary registration desk the personnel were not friendly! Maybe because they had to deal with the temporary desk! Secondly the bi-level casita was just a two story unit with beat-up furniture that looked 30 years old. One of the dresser draws in the living room was not working and had to be left open! A dresser in the living room? The stained carpet looked dirty and old! They should fire the gardeners or maybe the management of them. The tile work was old and dirty. The pool area and service were great and friendly! Thanks but I won’t return, even at the great price I recived. Steve Turmala Hilton Honors Diamond Member

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - book a Casita for luxury”
Reviews.Author: kentishmayde
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a two bed/bath casita - and this was well worth every penny, luxurious accommodation in a quiet location with a little swimming pool close by, parking next to accommodation. Main resort pools were fab, the kids loved them, so warm and the whole resort all clean and tidy, staff all very helpful. Only gripe was price of the internet and the connection as couldn't get a signal due to distance from the main building so saved my dollars indirectly. Only stayed one night but could have spent a week here very happily, thoroughly recommend the resort and the casitas.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and loud”
Reviews.Author: kmmoody
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. Our air conditioner was not working in the sitting room. The suite was very outdated and very small. There was lots of loud banging going on and a lot of kids. The place reminded me of a run down apartment building. The elevator was also broken. Don't let the professional hotel photos fool you. The patio was tiny and the view was of the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying here ... Fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lsstucson
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort so much we decided to come back again this year for a weekend. Once again, the service was excellent. Last year we stayed in the casitas and this year we stayed in a standard room. Very clean, comfy, roomy!!! We loved the pool area and ate a delicious breakfast at Rico's. I love this resort and without a doubt we will be back next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: Itsabigworld321
Reviews.Content: We just got done spending 2 nights here. The rooms are clean and about what you would expect from a Hilton. The selling point of this resort is the pool, slides and lazy river. The kids can go for hours without gettting bored! The pool staff is one of the low points for the hotel. They are all young and look the part of a fun group, but they give poor service and have no energy. For example, when you are at the top of the slide, they sit there and will just give you a hand sign to go. No eye contact, smiles, etc. We also had to track down a server although we were ordering food and drinks regularly. My wife had the best one...she ordered a Bloody Mary. She asked the bartender to make it spicier and she handed her the Tobasco and said "Go ahead." For $8.50 I have to do self-serve? The pool staff earned them a lower rating as they were consistently poor.

Reviews.Title: “very large hotel, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rachub
Reviews.Content: stayed for 1 night at this hotel. The room was ok, the only place on our trip we could get a room for 5 of us, but it would have been a struggle if we were staying more than 1 night, it was a bit cramped when we had the sofa bed out in the lounge. had a nice meal in the cowboy ranch, but was a bit pricey, the food was good and plenty of it so can't complain i suppose. Nice touch was that they take a photo of the kids all dressed up in cowboy gear for free, and you get a copy to take with you. Service was very good in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeling - but still some issues for a resort”
Reviews.Author: phxaz54
Reviews.Content: Having lived within minutes of The Pointe Hilton for 30 years, I've never been a guest until this month. A "staycation" so to speak. I have to say I was not impressed. Here are the good "pointes" and the bad: Good - great location. Beautiful views of squaw peak. easy to and from airport. Good dining nearby and on premises. Nice suite. Bad - no cell service - at all. Probably because of the close proximity of the mountains. Pay (a lot) to use internet. This is an issue since there was no cell service! Smell in room furniture (couch and chair) was totally uncomfortable. Given no bar key at check in so no bottled water available Markings and directions around resort are horrible. There are no signs on the buildings indicating what room numbers are in what buildings. The limited property maps are so faded that even with "readers" it was unreadable! Additionally - the service at check in terrible. First they didn't give a map of the property. When asked for one, they marked the wrong building and location of the room. (Which is why I know the property maps on the premise are unreadable since I was totally lost). Upon going back to the lobby they still could not tell me where my room was - even the concierge. Ask for a room above the ground floor. There are patios for the rooms, but who wants to look at the parking lot. On the 2nd floor you get some privacy and a view of the mountains. The hotel is also in a residential neighborhood. Stay away from that side or you'll hear barking dogs everytime somebody walks by. (ask for south pointe building not north) Hotel is pretty old, but rooms are nicely remodeled and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just not There”
Reviews.Author: Vancouvermac
Reviews.Content: The front line staff is friendly and tries hard. Unfortunately they don't make the business decisions. The whole facility just doesn't meet the needs of a business person. The internet access is unreliable and the SLOWEST I have experience anywhere in years. If you're in need of good internet connectivity, don't stay here. They act like a high end resort and charge like a high end resort, but it is a miss. What a shame. Again... no reflection on the front line. That is the only good news in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: somoman7
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is well made. what I mean is. The walls are not thin, you cannot hear your neighbors at all. The floors are well made. You can't hear people walking above you at all. had both stairs and elevator access to your rooms. Free parking, close to your rooms. A couple of restaurants onsite, a nice little water park, and easy access to freeway 51. Prices where great also for the rooms, and AC worked great. Room comes with fridge, seperate bedroom with King bed, and Living room with pull out sofa bed. Hotel staff great. I would stay here again and recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The best water park for families!! Great room. Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: HRSHYLVR
Reviews.Content: This place has it all! We would wake up and play a round of mini-golf, then jump in the Lazy River to cool off. Down the water slide a couple times, then splash around in the pool or behind the cool waterfalls! We played tennis at night after the sun went down -- they provide you with all the equipment right there. The teenagers working the towel station and manning the slides & river were so well-mannered and friendly, always smiling! Thank you!! The rooms are great -- everything you need, and comfy. We stocked our mini fridge with drinks. Housekeeping took very good care of us too. Just an awesome summer-time vacation all around!!

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded with daily use local guests”
Reviews.Author: spagirl104
Reviews.Content: Great rooms- great kid activities. Overcrowded with locals that spend $20 to spend the day. Especially unsupervised teens.

Reviews.Title: “Casitas are great”
Reviews.Author: greygypsy
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hilton Squaw peak off and on since January as a result of a long term work assignment in the Phoenix area. The hotel is a fine resort facility, and concentrates on the family and convention business. The typical suite is over 500 sf with separate living and sleeping quarters. There is an attached water park and miniature golf course which seems to attract the families. - For doing work in the suites, they have good sized desks, ergonomic chairs and decent internet connectivity. The suites have pretty good soundproofing, although it can get pretty noisy in the main South and North Pointe complexes. - I recently go upgraded to one of their King Casitas and these are really special. They have their own private, covered parking, a small kitchen area, a large downstairs living room and a separate huge bedroom and bath upstairs. They are tastefully finished, and it looks like they are in the process of slowly upgrading them. They are very quiet, but within very close walking distance of the water park area. I highly recommend these. - The staff have always been very helpful, and it's great to return and have everyone remember you and your preferences! - In August and September the main lobby area and I guess much of the South Pointe area is being remodeled, so their could be some inconveniences involved. Still, if your travels take you to Phoenix you can't go wrong staying at Squaw Peak.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: ATXLnghrn
Reviews.Content: Don't let the professional pics fool you. The water park isn't all that. We paid $139 a night but I would not pay much more than that to stay here. The rooms were great and comfortable. I would go back but not for much more than what we paid. The only complaint is the prices for food and drink at the pool. $20 for 4 beers of Dos Equis? $6.50 for a 16 oz bud light? Seriously? I guess Paris has some bills to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun,”
Reviews.Author: FreeUpgradeHunter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a holiday weekend which in fairness is the wrong time for an accurate rating for the hotel. This place has a great pool facility, lazy river, play pool, slide and seperate pool for adults and for the Casitas. It was so busy you couldn't get a bed, hard to get a tube for the river and they don't like you going without. Rooms were decent, clean comfortable beds. Breakfast was busy but not at full capacity, however the staff didn't seem able to cope, food ran out on the buffet and took too long to replenish. This is a great place to relax with the kids, avoid holiday weekends, go in the week and try to get a Casita.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Will recommend and return again!”
Reviews.Author: sshade71
Reviews.Content: We attended the 2011 Elks National Convention and Illinois, among other states, was assigned to this hotel. We arrived early and our room was ready at noon. We were driven the short distance to our tower in a golf cart so we didn't have to carry our luggage after a long flight. I was impressed with our suite. There was a spacious living area, separated by double doors from the bathroom area that was also separated by pocket doors from the bedroom with a balcony that overlooked the water park and mountains. We had a mini-refrigerator that was available for our use, coffee and tea service and two flat screen televisions. Our rooms were super-clean upon arrival and were serviced each day by a cheerful staff. We ate at Rico's the first night. My food was good and service was quick. Hole in the Wall for breakfast was good. We ate there for lunch one day and the service was slow and their beer was hot. The State of Illnois Elks had a hospitality room in 1466-1467. This was outstanding! The rooms were connected by an airconditioned hallway to a tree-covered terrace patio overlooking the beautiful pool area and swim up bar. This was very conveniently located and allowed ample space for all of our members and guests. I had a manicure and a therapeutic massage at the Spa located on the grounds of the hotel. The manicure is still holding up over a week later after many hours in the pool and my massage by Mitchell was to die for! Almost makes me wish I lived closer so I could return regularly for another! I loved the fact that the hotel had pools separate from the water park. Since my children did not attend the convention with me, I was really not in the mood to be splished and splashed. There were several families that raved about the water park and enjoyed the time spent there. My only complaint, if I had to give one, would be that the Wi-Fi was not a free service. We were offered a discount through our Elk Convention; however, in many hotels we have stayed, the Wi-Fi is free.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families, but Hotel is aging”
Reviews.Author: 1leftygolfer
Reviews.Content: At one time this hotel was a great hotel. Still has many things to offer for families who want to spend time centered around water park type activities. The hotel appears to have had some facelifts, but it is showing aging. Carpet in the rooms looks like indoor/outdoor purchased from Home Depot. Which is probably okay given the water/kids traffic. Bathrooms had an update sometime ago. Overall, good for the kids, but if you're looking for peaceful place to stay this should not be at the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Broken AC, during the summer! Beware of room 3044!”
Reviews.Author: Dottybug
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights during our two week road trip to the southwest U.S. We were drawn here because of the great pool they have. As Hilton Honors Gold members we were upgraded to a Casita room and at first we were amazed at this room that was more like an apartment. Very quickly our amazement turned to disappointment. When we got to the room it was hot so we looked at the thermostat and saw it was actually on and was set to 72°. We gave them the benefit of the doubt and decided that they didn't turn it on early enough before we got there to cool off this huge room and turned down the thermostat a little more. I also noticed a slight cigarette smell when we walked in but nobody else in my group smelled it. I put it off as coming from the 3 extinguished cigarettes at our front door in the sand. Wasn't this supposed to be a non-smoking room? There was an upstairs bedroom but there was no place to put our huge suitcase. We ended up putting it on the landing at the top of the stairs on the luggage rack. There's a lot of drawers and cabinets to put your clothes in but I wasn't about to unpack our suitcase for a two night stay. No complaints about the upstairs bathroom which was huge, nor the kitchenette which included almost a full sized fridge and a sink. The dining and living areas were also huge, with plenty of room for us to spread out. Upstairs there was a balcony with an umbrella table and chairs and lounge chairs, must be nice when it's cooler but we weren't going to sit out there in 114° temps. Coming in from the balcony I saw a cup by the door and found it was a cup full of smoked cigarettes in water, yuck. Again, wasn't this supposed to be a non-smoking room? Even the pool disappointed my children. They like to swim and frolic along in the lazy river but were told they HAD to be floating along in tubes, which got old for them very quickly. What is the reason for this rule? The lazy river at the Hilton near Disney World doesn't have that requirement, so I know it's not a safety issue. That scratched their fun. That evening, the room just didn't seem to get very cool. Even though we now had the thermostat set to 50°, it still felt like 90. It got a little cooler in the middle of the night while we were sleeping, so we just thought that if left on all day the next day, it would finally get comfortable. No. The next night it was even hotter! Even after a cool shower, nobody could fall asleep until about 3am, when it started cooling down. Even the high speed internet stopped working during peak hours. Is this room in the Twilight Zone? What a terrible stay. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Best outdoor water lazy river”
Reviews.Author: m4ney
Reviews.Content: We visited last year and still talk about the fabulous lazy river. We stayed here just because we needed a hotel for the day. It turned out to be great fun for us and the kids. We loved the waterpark, waterslides and lazy river.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy customer service”
Reviews.Author: 4beamason
Reviews.Content: The staff at the pool was under or untrained, over heated, curt, argumentative. That wasn't just my experience. All of the guests I spoke with had staff issues. Except the concierge! He was so helpful. At check in the person behind the counter, couldn't find a room for me. At least 3 people at the window next to me got a room while I waited and waited for her to figure out if they had a clean room for me. There are lots of other places to stay. I will stay other places for sure

Reviews.Title: “More Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: aznipp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort since I was a child with my parents and this was my first trip with my wife. We got the romance package which was great, a bottle a champagne and some vouchers that we used at Hole in the Wall restaurant the first morning. Are 1 bedroom casita was the only way to go. We were down at the very end 20 steps from a very private pool where we sat at night. The resort was at 100% occupancy yet it didn't feel crowed at all. Very clean. Great Service. In my opinion the best Resort in Phoenix for any type of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!! I lost over $400 in clothes!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CB2Bend
Reviews.Content: This place is outdated but clean. Pools were decent but the bartending staff at the small pools were rude and slow. I had a whole entire drawer of clothes stolen and when I tried to discuss with the staff there was basically a "too bad" attitude. I had just purchased a few pairs of shorts and capris since it was the beginning of summer and they are ALL GONE!! (3 paris of capris and 4 paris of shorts were all STOLEN)!! Horrible place and will never recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: stimey1227
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed at stay, with access to a pool right outside of our room, and the River Ranch, which had the lazy river. Our room was adequate for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We had a room w/2 queen beds and a couch w/sleeper. Nothing bad to say about this Hilton except that you have to pay for internet in your room and in their lobby, which seems a bit ridiculous. My daughter and I visited the Spa/Salon for pedi's/mani's, and I have to say that the employess were great, very personable, but the service itself wasn't as pampering as you would think for the price. I have received a better pedi at local salon's. Overall the Hilton was great and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is perfect - but they do give a 'Perfect Effort’”
Reviews.Author: AZDad1
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have reviewed this resort, but not the first time I have stayed at this resort and looking forward to coming back for a few more “staycation” weekends. I’m surprised to see the number of people responding with negative comments regarding crowded pools….what do you expect? Resorts cater to locals during the summer, especially families. Upon researching, there are many resorts in Phoenix/Scottsdale with great offers…but probably the most ridiculous surcharge found is the mandatory resort service fees, which exceed $30/day at some resorts…for what? Entrance to their waterpark, valet parking and gym access?? No thanks. The Pointe Squaw Peak is the “original” resort waterpark in Phoenix and set the bar high for all newcomers….and, their $2 resort value package is optional!! If you like hanging by the pool or in the lazy river with great service at all times then this is the spot. Bartenders and servers are super friendly and will teach you to make some interesting drinks. My kids enjoyed all the poolside activities, coyote camp and of course, the milkshake extravaganza….AND, kids eat free!! The BBQ at Hole in the Wall was excellent, as was the great big burger at Rico’s. While there’s no need to leave property, the Concierge, David is very knowledgeable and helpful in recommending additional dining options. I was surprised by the number of great restaurants nearby the resort. The entire staff was very hospitable, but the Director of Rooms, Zakee Jones is exceptional and is a true ambassador for the resort. We look forward to returning soon. FYI- Personal coolers by the pool are not allowed so don’t even try…

Reviews.Title: “Back around to Arizona. Had to go to the pointe Squaw peak.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMansClan
Reviews.Content: Kids loved the river ranch and hole in the wall. Too much fun. Great value water park and a room for less than price of admission at other water parks. Don't miss the prime rib dinner on Thursdays at hole in the wall. Ask for Tatum she's a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fun family weekend”
Reviews.Author: 1julieg
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our family weekend here at the resort, especially with the summer fun packages available. The room we stayed in was a two room suite with king-sized bed and pull out couch. It was nice having the shower/toilet separate from the washbowl area. Although the room decor was a bit outdated, it was clean and had everything we needed for overnight accommodations. As far as the hotel, it is old and the exterior has a somewhat dirty feel to it. The rooms face outside courtyard and/or pool areas, which can be a bit noisy at night, depending on which room you stay in. Didn't see much garbage within the hotel grounds itself. Had a really nice massage at the spa. The spa area itself is really nice, clean and updated. If you decide on staying at this resort, check out the daily specials at the spa! Now, onto the Hole In The Wall River Ranch waterslide/lazy river/main pool...I was very disappointed with the lack of cleanliness with this pool area. You could see the dirty "bath-tub ring" on the waterslide, which grossed me out. Most of the chairs were dirty and the pool area itself, was dirty. Our family had fun at the pools, no doubt, but, you just have to look past the filth. We just ran straight to shower after our time with pool area. Have to say, the Lazy River was relaxing and appeared a bit more clean. Next time we stay, I'd really like to check out a casita, which might make the stay a bit more comfortable with less noise. The Hole In The Wall Restaurant was pretty good. It had western BBQ fare and we enjoyed eating there both nights. The kids had fun making Smores for dessert. We will go back, as the family enjoyed the weekend and the price was just right.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible... Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: momof3dolls
Reviews.Content: We cam here for a family Staycation.. the pool was filthy, beer cans, people having chicken fights, too many people intoxicated and smoking while little kids were swimming. We had Roaches in our room and by the breakfast buffet. the service was horrible. We have been there a dozen time to stay... NEVER again.. it took me two days to finally talk to a manager and all they said was SORRY... they let people pay a $10 fee and come in and swim, it is not monitored at all.. there must have been atleast 200 people in the pool. i do NOT recommend this place at all..

Reviews.Title: “Just great for a few days in the sun with the family”
Reviews.Author: photoiq
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with our family just before the holiday weekend. The hotel was busy but we booked a Casita (2 bed detached bungalow) which was on a quiet street beside a virtually private pool. I have stayed here on business in the regular rooms in North or South Pointe and it was noisy until 11pm. Our experience was really great - the place has been updated in places recently, nice planting, plenty of shade, lots of pools that are quiet during the day and our teenage kids loved the river ranch. My wife and I used the fitness center and spa which is excellent. Internet is a ripoff at 11.95 per device per day (one charge for laptop and one for iphone wifi). If you stay in a Casita you will have a brilliant time at Squaw Peak. David the chief concierge was really professional, helpful and generous with his time.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy All Day, Overcrowded Pools”
Reviews.Author: sunbaby39
Reviews.Content: Very noisy hotel with lots of children running the corridors yelling, screaming, playing tag with dogs that bark while chasing them, into the 1:00 am hour, and adults talking loudly outside the room. Also lots of smokers in every outside corridor and on the balconies, constant smell of cigarette smoke. Pools, HAHA, if your not standing in line at 8:00 AM or before you will not get a lounge chair. REALLY? Had to stand in line every time we went to the pool, ugh! Once your at the pool, there are so many children making it impossible to relax. This is not a hotel for anyone except families with young children. ALSO, No pool side order takers for food or drinks? Restaurants are decent but over priced. $65.00 for dinner for 2 people, no alcohol... This is an older hotel that is not well kept, corridors are filthy, outside is in rough shape and not well lit, we did not feel safe outside at night. Rooms are decent and comfortable when your not being kept up by the drunk adults or screaming children until 1:AM. They actually charge for the put put golf course which should be free. Parking is free, but not easy to come by, if you get back late from sightseeing, GOOD LUCK finding one. The resort gift shops are overpriced, even more so than what I would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time, Price was Right. Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diztek
Reviews.Content: Didnt have plans for the 4th of July. Called the Pointe on Saturday, got a room for $79.00. Chilled at the Lazy River for 2 days. Got to the pool at 8:30 am and several loungers available. No rude people either all weekend. Room was a studio, but clean, close to the pool, close to parking & ice machine. Been to the Pointe a few times, and it does show some age, but being nestled in the SQUAW peak mountians is awesome. Service was good too. No complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: “Low quality service.”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy85365
Reviews.Content: The supervisory staff shows a complete lack of interest in your satisfaction and is not committed to excellence. How does the Hilton respond when things go bad? Horrible. My wife and I stayed recently thinking we were buying quality. The facility is pleasant, but it has seen better days. Our air conditioner had seen better days; broke down in the middle of the night. While the techs worked on it, we asked for a fan. It never came and fell asleep in the suite’s living room. Next day there was nobody to take my complaint. Left my info., nobody called. Contacted them (could only get voicemail) twice more, nobody called back. I managed to talk to a supervisor 13 days later and they basically said we are sorry but too bad. They won’t help you when things go bad. Your money is better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: exiledmainer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property with helpful staff. Very good food in the outlets. Ric's is the free standing restaurant in front of the hotel and the food the is very good. Pool/lazy river can get crowded, but I guess that's to be expected at such a cool property. Close to great shopping in Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Great room layout families, kids judge all pools by this hotels now!”
Reviews.Author: latham_10
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived I was not impressed by the general look of the hotel externally but once in the room my mind was changed. The rooms are great for families. You get a large living area with tv, fridge, desk and sofa. Then a bathroom/ vanity area then separate bedroom with two beds and tv. Great for kids to go to bed while we were just next door. Kids loved the pool and really quiet when we were there so penty of sun beds. Dive in movie (watching surfs up in the pool at night) was a holiday highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Travelgurl82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort a year before and enjoyed it, but this time I was disappointed. Everything seemed good until I went to order a drink at the bar by the main pool and the bartender totally ignored me and took some other guys order before me then the next morning, there was not any hot water and their accomadation was for us to take a shower in the spa center so we headed there and when we got there we saw a lady with an employee badge and we explained that we were told to go there by guest services and she looked at us like we did not belong and told us the water there was "tepid" and kept saying it was not going to be different from the room, but when we got to the front desk of the fitness center the staff was much nicer and basically gave us the impression that lady was stupid. I don't know if this was because we are mexican or what? but I really felt out of place.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not up to Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: Nesser68
Reviews.Content: we stayed twice at this hotel. once during the summer and the last time in May. The last time we ended up moving 3 times because the airco wasn't working properly. They tried to fix it but were unable to. Even in the 3rd room it was muggy. Beds are great, porch area dirty and very small. Waterpark is great for the kids. What we did miss comparing it to other Hilton hotels we stayed at: free internet (no where to be found), free water bottles to keep us hydrated, possibility to to a breakfast buffet. Great that the fridge is now usable to keep yor own food & beverages in. Before you had to pay extra for the fridge and microwave. On mother's day the waterpark was very crowded with visitors, there was no room for the regular hotel guests which I don't think is the correct way. Not sure if I'd like to stay here again, am looking into other resorts in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “I think we were in hell”
Reviews.Author: mikeryan07
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the casita that we stayed in was dirty-3153. The carpet had numerous stains and there were still crumbs on the stairs from I'm assuming the previous guests. Our first night there, we had a cockroach the size of texas on our wall. The second day we were there, my wife got stung by a scorpion while i was gone-she was at that time trying to get on the internet, which was giving her numerous problems as well, when the scorpion got her. She called it in to the front desk stating all of the problems we were having and what just happened. They sent someone to the casita to look for the "critter". After about 30 seconds of looking the guy stopped and said he couldnt find it and then was very interested in her not being able to get the internet and asked if she tried this or tried that. She had and after some doing got the internet to work and the guy left-When I checked out i wanted to make sure it was notated that she was stung by a scorpion-It was not and only stated we had a roach problem-The front desk supervisor said he would research it and try and get me a discount on the room we paid $200 a night for. I got a call from the director the next day and he told me that it didnt happen or they would have documented it. I wasn't looking to get anything for free or discounted, just was unhappy with the way the handled the situation-and this director made me even madder-had the balls to say thank you for staying with us, hope we made everything enjoyable for you after basically calling my wife and i liars-Not very good customer service-the pool was fun, but expensive as most hotels are-I would expect more out of a hilton owned company, but appaerantly once they have your money they have no more concerns of any problems-I have been there many times and it seems like each time it has gone downhill-will definatley never stay there again or even recommend it to anyone-if you decide to stay there-i highly suggest you make any complaints you have instantly before you get the run around like i did. Oh and the bed was uncomfortable and the couches felt like you were going to fall to the floor when you sat in them..

Reviews.Title: “will go back to AZ just not this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdc1971
Reviews.Content: We brought a lap top and the connection was super slow. I'm glad we did bring it because our TV wasn't working properly the entire time. Someone from maintenance did come switch it out, but after 5 minutes it would go to blank screen and freeze momentarily(this lasted the 5 days we were there). The weatherproofing under our door was repaired after we requested it. We stuffed towels under the door the first night so no "critters" would come in (yes the gap was that big). It says "no smoking" but it isn't enforced. Believe me. The shower was pathetic (3 water trickles). The "water park" did have enuf pool area, however, there was only 1 slide and I don't believe anyone under 10yrs old should go on it (very fast, no floatation devices allowed). The miniature golf courses were dirty and unkept. I heard some teens were doing a scavenger hunt near the pool area, so when we got back to the room I called the "coyote camp" thinking maybe it had something to do with that area. The woman told me that that was a "river ranch" activity and that you really need to ask about those things when you check into the pool area. And that "most of the time you will have someone who doesn't know what they are doing working in that area, so you need to take it upon yourself to find out the information.". All of the individual things listed are trivial I realize. However, when you add them all up......very dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “We've been here many times and always have a great time.”
Reviews.Author: MissyMew
Reviews.Content: Due to the great summer rates, each summer we try a different resort in the Phoenix area. We have been doing this for years. We have been to the Point Hilton time and time again, as it is one of the best family-friendly resorts around. The weekend activities are always fun, the staff is always pleasant, and the all-suite rooms are perfect. This summer the fridge had been emptied of the usual amenities (good move, Hilton!), so we were able to use it to keep our beverages and snacks cold. For a $75.00 fee you can bring your dog. We take advantage of this as the fee is less than the cost of boarding him. This resort is quite beautiful, and the water park tons of fun. This year our kids spent hours playing water volleyball, as there were always two pools with nets up in the main water park area. Our kids are too old to take advantage of the "Coyote Camp," but when they were younger that was a real plus for us. There are also other pools, if you want to stay away from the kiddy crowd. I would highly recommend this resort to any family with kids looking for a fun place to spend some quality time together. I know we'll go back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every year”
Reviews.Author: NastiaTX
Reviews.Content: My grandparents live in the Terraces retirement community, which is just across the street. The Pointe Hilton is not only conveniently located, it's a wonderful facility. When we visit in the summer the kids love the water park!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mickielw
Reviews.Content: This is my second venture to the Pointe Squaw Peak and I must say it is turning into a family tradition. I absolutely love the River Ranch water park. The first time we stayed was in July over a weekend and while we had a great time it was, as expected, busy. This time we stayed during the week - absolutely fantastic! The service poolside was better and we had no trouble securing lounge chairs. We did not venture off property to eat because the staff at Rico's was so great. We ate during happy hour and the lounge staff was extremely attentive and helpful, especially Nicole and Elle! They really made our week, always welcoming us back and having our drinks ready. I love to be spoiled and I was! The resort is older, but the rooms are modernized, comfortable and big. I know that some hate being near the parking lot, so be advised, you cannot escape it here really. If you must, ask for a room close to the lobby. Also be advised that there are truly great "views" in the "hotel" but this does not bother me, but it might for other travelers, so be aware. A higher floor will be a little better, but it will still be mostly of the parking lot. The hotel pool sits inside the courtyard and the River Ranch sits behind a large wall. The casitas offer better views and locations, some into the River Ranch. The hotel is also in a location that affords you the opportunity to easily get around Phoenix and is in close proximity to the Biltmore district and Scottsdale. If you are looking for a fun getaway, this place fits the bill. Bring sunscreen, they will provide the rest!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family fun”
Reviews.Author: z_family_mich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak during a recent trip to visit friends in Phoenix and it was wonderful. We were very happy with the room, the grounds, and especially the pools. The tables and smaller pool near the North tower rooms were a nice place to eat takeout food, and just relax (away from the actual water park pools). We would definitely stay here again. Only warning I would give is that the food prices in the river ranch are high ($7 for a hotdog and chips) so keep snacks in your room, and look for the water coolers around the pool area if your kids are thirsty.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FAMILY FUN”
Reviews.Author: artdeb
Reviews.Content: We rented a suite which was very comfortable with a separate bedroom. Very clean room, great bed, quiet and the staff was always very helpful. Enjoyed the lazy river at night while a movie was being played in the pool area. Also enjoyed happy hour at Rico's Restaurant on the grounds of the hotel. Free internet in the lobby but not in the rooms - our only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great service.. will reconsider”
Reviews.Author: greenlokito
Reviews.Content: Was booked into hotel for the wrong room.. front desk just kept beating around the bush and could not do anything to correct issue .. rooms were ok .. a bit small .. king size bed is actually a queen.. no free internet... Food was ok .. did not get correct deserts when it came to ordering .. no many amenaties compared to others.. very limited .. POOL service .. towels kept getting removed from chairs and people were taking my spots..which made it frustrating for the family..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly123
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and really have no complaints. The room was clean, the service was good and the beds were super comfy. We got breakfast with our stay and ate every morning at Ricos. We ordered off the menu (didn't eat the buffet) and the food was fantastic. My 2 kids loved the pool area, although I thought the pool was a little too chilly. We liked the central location, and went for a great hike at the park area close to the hotel. The concierge (David) was so helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, nice location, "resort" is a bit of an overstatement”
Reviews.Author: mojave_ben
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on a business trip. Room was nice, with a suite-style layout, views limited to parking lot. Fridge and coffee maker, quiet room, comfortable bed, nice amenities, friendly and efficient staff - all make this just dandy as a good hotel. The hotel is a quick drive (about 10 mins) from Skyharbor, and is in a mostly residential neighborhood. There's a handful of restaurants around, and a good grocery store (Bashars) at the nearby big intersection. For me, the biggest attraction is that you are near Squaw Peak park (it has another longer name now) which is full of trails and desert, though a tad hard to get away from the highway noise. In fact, from you room you can walk into the park by following streets, paths, and an equestrian underpass to get to the other side of the highway, but it's nicer to drive the 10 minutes to get into the main vehicle entry to the park, as it's quieter and you are more surrounded by the local desert. Of course the desert is best in the early morning. The "resort" side of the hotel is limited. The lazy river and water slide are certainly good for a couple of rounds and my work meeting degenerated into a nice game of water volleyball. Of course it would be great with little kids but with older kids or couple looking for a romantic getaway, I'm sure you can do better. Nonetheless, if I had to return to Phoenix for business again, I would be most pleased to stay here. But when I go to AZ for leisure I'm in either Tuscon or Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “I suppose it is a "resort"”
Reviews.Author: cctex823
Reviews.Content: Not resort quality here but a decent hotel but not for the price. Stayed at a King Suite and it was clean and you could tell it had been renovated. Everything just seemed a little dated though. Don't bother with the "Hole in Wall" restaurant, faux Texas food at it worst. The river and pools were very nice with cold drinks available to you during the day. The one thing that stood out among everything else was the Internet (2 Mbps up/1 Mbps down) was $11.95 a DAY! I get cheaper & faster internet in rural. And it went down constantly, i stayed two weeks and made five phone calls to restore service. Hotel staff was extremely helpful with any requests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CupcakesMomma
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I are just back from a 3 day stay at this tired and worn property. The first disappointment was our "mountain view" from our "balcony". The mountains were there, in view, if you could manage to overlook the large and crowded parking lot right there. The balcony was so tiny that I don't think I could have actually bent my knees to sit in the 1 chair provided - it was kind of a closed-in, dark and dusty 1970's Medditerrainian style. Sadly, I never once sat on the balcony. There was a little refrig, but no microwave. The bed had the stability of a hammock. Upon check-in our porter told us we could use the shuttle at any time to take us to the Biltmore shopping plaza, at no charge. When we decided to go (around dinner time), we were now told that there was only a Shopping Shuttle that operated during the day for $10/pp. At 5pm there was no shuttle available to take us anywhere, fee or no fee. So, we ended up spending nearly $40, round trip, to get to this shopping area .... less than a 15 min ride. The worst of it all was out last dining experience here in their casual outdoor restaurant. After finishing my meal and having my plate removed, I noticed there was a big blob of bird poop right below where my dinner plate had been. Eeeeewwwww!! I brought it to the attendtion of the waiter and he told me that was very unusual as the tables (kind of a psuedo-stone-plastic) are washed every two days!!!! As he continued to process my bill, I took this up with the restaurant manager who sincerely apologized and saw to it that we were not charged. I would like to comment that all of the staff (and we interacted with several) were very nice. Sadly, the lack of attention of detail and cleanliness could not be overcome by the good service.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Stay at Squaw Peak”
Reviews.Author: AVPCarp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times for both business and pleasure. The staff is excellent and very attentive to both mine and my family's needs. Everyone from the bellmen, front desk staff, concierge, to the cleanning staff do an excellent job. If there is ever an issue, which there rarely is, the staff gets on it to make this as comfortable as possible. I highly recommend this hotel for either business or especially for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lush, beautiful, tons of activities”
Reviews.Author: MHW_in_MI
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Phoenix Squaw Peak resort for business. Because of my HHonors status, I was upgraded to a Casita (like a private Villa/condo). I was so impressed with the room and resort that I flew my wife in the next day. Upon arrival, she was immediately greeted by Billy, the doorman/concierge. He took her to the casita via golf cart and then offered to take her on a tour of the resort. She thoroughly enjoyed the tour! The resort has many beautifully landscaped pools. The fitness center is well-equipped with high-end equipment. My wife thoroughly enjoyed the spa treatments she received by Bobbi and Holly. Everyone was so friendly throughout the whole resort. We spoke about the friendliness we experienced and determined the employees much really enjoy working there because they are always happy and willing to go the extra mile to help. We ate at Rico's for breakfast, which had a full buffet. Tim was our server, and gave us alot of good advice about Phoenix and the surrounding area. For the evening, we had in-room dining, and the the food was exquisite and delivery was prompt. My wife LOVED the cobb salad. River Ranch is an entertainment area of the resort. It features a large pool with a sports area (volleyball) and waterfall, lazy river, winding water slide, and a more secluded area around the back. Every day there are activities planned. In the morning, there is a stand outside the River Ranch area that features continental breakfast type food and drinks. Outside our casita, we had a really nice lap pool that also includes a whirlpool. There is also a putt putt golf area and nearby hiking. The Squaw Peak has such beautiful landscaping everywhere! There are a couple of small shops as well. Willl be returning to Phoenix for further business, and am looking forward to returning to Sqaw Peak resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Lazy River But Not The Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JetKate
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews about this Hilton Resort, I had some concerns. But, traveling with a small child I felt the available water activities and the 2-room suites would be best. If you are looking for a quiet and relaxing spa or adult weekend, this is not the hotel for you. If you are looking for great poolside service and fancy drinks with umbrellas, find another resort. As a Hilton Diamond Member, I am used to a level of service that this hotel does not offer. In fact, you will not receive anything special for being a loyal Hilton customer. So, Diamond members, do not look for a nice sit-down continental breakfast as it is not offered. Our two choices are to stand in line in the gift shop for dry cereal, and even drier donuts and coffee. Or, the other option is to pay for breakfast at the noisy and unorganized Rico's restaurant on-site. ROOMS: Our two-story king bed casita was very nice. It was clean and comfortable. I liked that we could park in covered parking right at the casita. The bed was comfortable and clean. The kitchenette, fridge, etc. were new and well-kept. Very nice room. Not five-star but nice. SERVICE: Checking in, we were greeted and received well. Quick service to our room. The restaurants and poolside service was terrible. None of the staff seemed interested in helping. Too bad because the hotel misses out on a lot of revenue from bar/alcohol sales. RESTAURANTS: Food was mediocre but prices were okay. Again, service was slow both before and after ordering. THE RIVER RANCH: This, and the other pools, are the hotel's saving grace. Our two-year-old had a blast. She loved the lazy river and the waterfalls. The pools were beautiful. They seemed manicured and the surroundings were also nice. Very nice. One complaint I read was that hotel guests were reserving poolside chairs and not sitting in them. We also noticed this but is something you must deal with at a large resort. Overall the resort is just okay. It depends on what you want out of your stay. I give it a 3 or 3 1/2 stars mostly due to service.

Reviews.Title: “Happy again, 4th stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: Happy again for 4th time at this resort. It is great for younger kids although my husband and I are always happy here too. Enjoyed the pool near the lobby this year compared to other years. They have very comfortable chaise lounges at that one. I would eat elsewhere as the restaurants are mediocre at best. Hole in the wall is consistently just ok food with bad service. We always go to Aunt Chiladas down the street, love sitting outside there. We also liked Sauce(drove) and of course Tommy Bahama in Scottsdale is awesome. We also went to Rawhide for the first time. Just ok. Money maker is all. All staff is sooo friendly. All said hello anytime they were near us. Manny was awesome. Actually ALL at the door were the best customer service I've seen. Made us feel pampered immediately, much better than some very expensive resorts we've been at. Great team. If i were to complain about anything it

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property!”
Reviews.Author: MarcieKahrs
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the family! Lots to do with the kids while staying at the resort. Lazy river and pools were great! Coyote Camp was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Horrid... outdated, worn, moldy smell and not well kept.”
Reviews.Author: CoolBlueSteel
Reviews.Content: Simply horrid. We booked a Casita-type room. The room was worn/old/outdated and smelled like mold... a coat of paint and semi-modern furniture does NOT always make old look new... as in this case. We found two spiders roaming around the upstairs bedroom, which lead to our prompt departure! We didn't last an hour at this place. Found better accommodations elsewhere. The lobby was in similar outdated/old conditions -- as were other rooms they tried to put us in when we spoke to management about the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Much needed, relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: 3Hurleykids
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at Squaw Peak. David, Carol and the rest of the Conceirge staff were fantastic! Billy, David and the other Bell Men were also terrific as were all of the waiters and staff at the River Ranch~ we truly appreciate all of their hospitality and kindness! They all seemed to honestly enjoy their jobs! We have 3 kids ages 10,12 and 13 and had a 1 bedroom suite which was a bit small for us, but fine for the amount of time we spent in the room. We did have a couple of housekeeping issues, but I called Guest Services each time, and our issues were taken care of within 5 minutes- one was even at 9:30pm. My kids loved the burgers at The Hole in The Wall, but my husband and I found the menu to be limited and pricey. The brunch at Rico's was great- especially because we had vouchers, but otherwise the menu also seemed a bit pricey and not very kid friendly. We loved Gallagher's which is a pub, walking distance from the resort- good food, reasonable price and the kids were happy. I heard the Italian Restaurant near by was excellent, but we didn't get to try it. We also got Take-Out a couple of nights to cut down on cost. David gave us menu's from the Conceirge desk. I highly recommend the Arizona Hummer Tour (www.azhummertours.com) Scott was our tour guide and he was fantastic! It was an experience my family will remember forever and well worth the price! I brought a roll of quarters with me in hopes of doing a few loads of laundry quickly, midway thru the trip- unfortunately the facilities near our room consisted of 1 washer and 1 dryer so it took a while to do a few loads, and turned some of our white clothes yellow. I read reviews on Trip Adivsor for months before our trip, and have realized that you can never please everyone. If you are renting a car, definetly call David/Conceriege who can hook you up to a car service in advance that will pick you up and drop you off. Also, if you need any special arrangements (near an elevator, pool, etc) David is a huge help.All in all, our family was very happy at this resort- and if we could go back tomorrow, we would!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!”
Reviews.Author: BcAtHome
Reviews.Content: We loved it! We had a 2 room casita and it was amazing! We have 6 people in our family and it was spacious enough for our extended family to come over and hang out. The water park is fantastic and we spent much of our time there. In addition to the water park, they have several pools that were empty most of the time. Coyote Camp is a camp for kids in which they spend the day playing, doing crafts and learning about the desert and culture. It was fantastic - our kids went twice! The beds were comfortable and the couch is a sleeper sofa. We had a huge balcony that I enjoyed reading on every morning and evening. We did eat at the restaurants and it was pricey but good. I would highly recommend this to anyone and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Old and average - not "resort" quality pools”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBilly
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything truly bad to say about the hotel, but we're not coming back and I wouldn't send anyone I know to this hotel. It's an old hotel in decent condition but completely lacking in style. The ceilings are popcorn, the furniture is a little worn, the "balcony" was concrete block...in fact, the whole place is just heavy concrete painted in bright colors. It feels like a huge motel. Our room was a hike from the lobby and parking lot. Everything is very disjointed. The pools are not anything to rave about and not even anything worth mentioning unless you've never been to another resort in your life. Near our room there was a "sun deck" that consisted of some bare lounge chairs facing a concrete wall on 3 sides. It was the most unappealing sun deck I've ever seen and it became kind of a punch line for the weekend. Again, I don't want my review to be too negative because there is nothing wrong with the hotel per se...it's just old and tired. It lacks any kind of style, vibe or energy. All the staff we encountered were OK. In my opinion, if you're a family from the mid west and you're on a tight budget and want some sun, this is a good option. If you want something new, interesting, "resort-ish", or with energy, either spend a bit more for the big resorts or spend less and just book a budget hotel near a big resort and get a day-pass. I'm really glad we didn't book the rooms with the dining certificate ($50 per night certificate for an extra $20) because we were really happy to get out of the hotel and have meals in town and Scottsdale has a lot of great options for any budget.

Reviews.Title: “Too crowded at the pool. Pool area too small for resort”
Reviews.Author: mattbrooke
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night heading to Sedona the next day. We arrived late at night and the resort is gorgeous. Our two bedroom casita was beautiful and clean. We checked in at 11:30pm due to flight problems. We are hilton honors and when we requested a late check-out till 2pm they only gave us 30 min till 12:30pm. So we packed up everything and put it in our van and headed to their main pool. What a disappointment. By 10am every chair was taken. Huge resort with a very tiny pool area. We have stayed at other hilton resorts in Phx and would highly recommend them over this. We had two 13 year old girls with us and had no chairs around the pool. Too crowded if you like sitting by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: fweeb
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Phoenix for a wedding that was being held at this resort, and so booked a casita. The casita was incredible, upstairs-downstairs, great balconies, and kitchen. There was so much room, and traveling with teenagers, that worked really well. The staff is friendly and room service was fast!
