The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that the hotel is just beginning to show signs of wear, and we were right by a pool, so it was a little noisy. However, that wouldn't stop me from staying at the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming stay”
Reviews.Author: chimp29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton mid March for 6 nights and had a fantastic time - although we didn't get to use the Pools and facilities ( 1 week isn't enough to explore Arizona - we will have to come back!) our room ( 1 bed studio) was clean and comfortable - all the staff were accommodating ( Lyle on Reception and David the Concierge, special mention - thankyou both for all your help). Look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: gordiesmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed in a two bedroom casita and had a wonderful time at the resort. The casita was very spacious and clean. There was so much for the kids to do in the pool area, that we had no trouble spending the entire day on the property. We did leave a couple of days for some great adventures that the concierge, David, recommended. He was a great resource. We did a Hummer tour of the dessert and a great horseback riding adventure at Canyon Creek. Both were outstanding. The dining at Hole in Wall, was very slow in service, especially for the kids, but the food was pretty good. The service in the pool area was outstanding by all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Dining12
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hilton for three nights with family (kids 10,12,17) and enjoyed our stay. The hotel is dated but has been well maintained and nice plantings on the grounds. I would call it quite nice - not fabulous - but nice. We enjoyed relaxing by the pool - the only annoying part was people putting out their towels to save their chairs by 7am and not showing up until late morning - but I guess that is resort mentality. The hotel has a pool for each of their two larger buildings which is nice because it was small enough to feel quaint, yet large enough to not feel too crowded. The "water park" is more of a water play area and has a nice lazy river, one slide, and a pool area - we felt it was geared for smaller kids so only used the lazy river and then headed back to our building's pool. With all the younger kids at the water play area, it kept the pool area quieter. As a runner, I found the hotel had two nice options for anywhere from a 3-6 mile run. About 1/2 mile from the hotel is a trail that runs along a canal and there are other runners and bikers so you don't feel alone. The other option I found was also 1/2 mile away, the Dreaming Downs park area with a nice path or even trail running. It is nice to find a place where you are not stuck running on the sidewalk beside traffic! The rooms were spacious and quiet. I liked having the toilet/shower separate from the sink area. You can also close off the bedroom and living room areas from the sink which is nice if there is an early riser. Overall we enjoyed our stay, the only negatives for our family was the crowded feeling by the pool area and people "claiming" their spots - but I imagine this might not be a issue if you stay during a non-peak time - and the other is the hotel not providing recycling containers by the poolside or in the rooms - you just throw everything away. If we ever get back to Phoenix, I would consider staying here again but I'd also shop around.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: dstheta4
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Phoenix but definitely not my last. My peer and I had to plan an event for an area that we knew nothing about. We spent hours on the internet trying to find the perfect event that was in our budget. After speaking with David at the Concierge's desk of the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort we had the best activities imaginable planned in less than 10 minutes. He took care of EVERYTHING, transportation, food, and fun. I was excited before I arrived, but once I reached my room (king suite) I was blown away! This was the nicest room I had ever had the pleasure of staying in, and I have stayed in a lot. It had the feel of a mini apartment. I even had a dining area that seated 6 people, a bath and a half, plus a wet bar. It was fantastic! I hated to leave my room, but there was so much to do at the resort, swimming in the pool or the water park, tennis, shopping, dinning, and working out in the gym. It was spring break when I visited and the kids seemed to love it as well. Since I was traveling for work, I always try to schedule our stays near a great golf course to keep the boss happy. Believe it or not, he said that the course he played Stone Mountain (also set up by my friends at the resort concierge desk), was one of the best he has ever played on. The event that was scheduled for our group was a visit to a ranch in Black Canyon City. It was absolutely beautiful! Everyone that attended said they had the best time and really enjoyed the food. Overall, this has been the best trip I have had and I contribute that to the friendliness, cleanliness, and overall attitude of the entire staff at the resort. Everyone was always willing to help, the bellman, the front counter staff, the manager, and especially my hero, David and his Concierge team that had all of the answers.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off by a hotel resting on it's name”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were told hotel was overbooked and our King Suite could be replaced with a regular King plus $50 per day hotel credit to use on the property. We refused since we wanted the suite. glad we did since we would not have used the credit on any of their lousy food and it was too cold to use the water park. I was livid to learn that paying a premium rate for a room for 5 nights, Hilton has the guts to try and charge $12 per day to use wireless internet in your room. Had to go to the lobby to use my computer--a raging insult. Every other place we stayed on this road trip gave free internet service, Food at Ricos first night was nearly inedible-classic hotel food. Caters to families with kids and business travelers, all at great cost.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably disappointing-esp for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: starname
Reviews.Content: We were planning a stay for 4 nights, but left after the first night. Upon arrival, our room was dirty-unclean bathroom and very unclean hide a bed. We switched rooms only to find our second room was smoke permeated and the hide a bed was extremely unclean. During the room switch, we were taking our young child out for dinner. We asked the staff if they could just transition our bags from one room to the next and for new sheets for the sleeper sofa. The front desk staff seemed befuddled that we would need help with our bags; but ultimately, they did transition the bags. However, the housekeeping staff tossed the new sheets on top of the dirty hide a bed. Had it not been so late for our child, we would have checked out that night. However, we decided to give it another chance in the light of day. The next day, upon inspecting the property, we noted the pool was dirty (visible dirt, debris, and trash) and after a night in a noisy, smoky room, we decided to check out. The positives: Manny from the bell staff was unbelievably gracious and helpful. Ricos was a good restaurant with very friendly staff. Checking out was seamless--the desk staff was apologetic for our issues. We have stayed in dozens of Hiltons, from Hampton Inns to Wadorf Properties and have always been satisfied with the cleanliness of the hotels as well as the helpfulness of the staff. This property lacked in both.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is Excellant at Pointe Hilton at Sqaw Peak!”
Reviews.Author: Rineebear
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable! The hotel staff was the friendliest and always available to answer our questions. Our favorite activites were the Lazy River, and the putting course. The Spa was spectacular! It was very clean, relaxing, full of amenities and the staff was so nice. We truly felt pampered! Also, we loved the restaurant, Rico's. The food was phenomenal! We would definately recommend Sqauw Peak at Pointe Hilton to everyone and have planned on making it a yearly stop!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: goldieL33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a family friend who lives in the Phoenix area. We stayed in this hotel in June 2009 and returned in June 2010. We did consider trying another hotel in the area but as we had such a good time in 09 it really was easy to decide to return to this hotel. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable and it looked like they had recently been redecorated - if not they were certainly well maintained. We used the gym daily - really good equipment and facilities. If you intend to do this make sure your add on the resort amenity pack to your room bill, it works out far cheaper and it is only a few dollars. There are a couple of smaller pools, one in each wing, North and South. These were usually quieter than the water park which we liked as we were there to relax, but the water park is also a lot of fun, even if you don't have children. We ate in Hole in the Wall in 09 as the food was really good. It was closed in June 2010 which was disappointing but certainly did not affect our stay. The staff are friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. There was always plenty of places to park and laundry facilities if you need them. Overall - if you are considering this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever for Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: atinamarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 3rd time last year and love this hotel. I have two children 10 & 13, my 13 year old is special needs & he was totally comfortable here . The staff was awesome our Casita was perfect we had enough room to spread out & relax. The kitchen made it possible for us to cook & the patio was perfect for BBQ's. The hotel workers were extremely helpful & anything we asked for was responded to promptly. The rooms were spotless & the pools were clean and fun. I was exspecially impressed with the pool area which was constantly being monitered while we were there. I felt very comfy with my special needs child in the pool because I felt like the lifeguards and staff were paying attention at all times. We are planning our vacation for this year and we will definitely be staying here again>

Reviews.Title: “A very rocky start, but then a really nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: kristint724
Reviews.Content: I booked this in advance and paid in advance. On the day of arrival, I called to let them know that we would be arriving late. The woman I talked to on the phone, said no problem. When we finally arrived at 11:30 pm, I was told that no rooms were available, that the hotel was overbooked. Needless to say I was livid and so was the man in front of me that got the same story. We both had confirmed our reservations and let them know that we would be late arriving. They put us at their sister property, Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs, and promised us that we would have two queens for the night and then we could move back to Squaw Peak the next day. When we arrived at Tapatio Cliffs, all that was available was one king and a pull-out sofa. So we spent the night and the next day, we were able to go back to Squaw Peak and go ahead and check in early. It was just very inconvenient and frustrating to not get what we paid for. I had to spend at least 30 minutes of my vacation convincing them that they needed to refund my money for the first night since I was not given the room I paid for. After finally settling in, we did have a wonderful time. The suite was really nice and roomy. The River Ranch was great. My kids, 12 and 8, really enjoyed it. It was crowded, but big enough so that it wasn't a big issue. We had dinner at the Hole in the Wall. It was not great at all for the price we paid. The atmosphere was really wonderful, but the food was average at best. The food at the pool was pretty good. All in all, besides our first fiasco, it is a really nice hotel. I would stay again. If you go, you better arrive early or your room might be gone!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Tyson0928
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid-March 2011. I am sure rates were higher than what others have written about summer rates due to spring break. We stayed in a casita and ours was very outdated. Furniture, carpet, wallpaper, curtains from the 1970's! Stucco on the inside made it feel dark and clausterphobic. There was NOT a kitchen as we were told-just a 3/4 fridge and bar sink-no stove/oven/disposal/dishwasher and no dishes or utensils. Room was small, beds were doubles not queens, sewage/drainage was terrible (slow & stinky), fans made tons of loud noise, and A/C unit only downstairs not upstairs. Room was not clean-we found old food and hair in it. The "waterpark" was crowded. The major pluses were location & comfortable beds! Very disappointed-we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with the Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: UDbill
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hilton for six days starting February 12. I have two teenage boys and my oldest had requested this resort. It was a great stay. We had a two bedroom Casita with plenty of room for the family. The boys enjoyed the pools, the lazy river, the tennis and basketball, the mini golf and the water slide. Both boys are now into fitness and used the gym everyday. The gym had all new equipment in it and the was up to par. We have stayed here before and each time it looks more updated and even nicer than before. Our Friends were vacationing in ARizona and visited us and thought the place was amazing with so much to do. If you have active kids or lazy parents this is a great place to stay. I have taken the family to many resorts and this is one of our family favorites.

Reviews.Title: “A true resort experience at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: philatraveler4
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a clean, decent family hotel near the natural beauty of the Sonoran desert close to scottsdale where my husband was attending a conference. What we got was a gorgeous resort with the amenities, and service I associate with a more expensive price tag. We were able to do some incredible things (jeep tour, trip to sedona and grand canyon) because we weren't broke from the hotel cost. The physical site is aesthetically pleasing and well maintained with courtyards, fountains, tasteful art and decor with a sense of place. You can see beautiful squaw peak from the river ranch!!! Don't miss the lazy river at sunset--wow! The pictures don't do it justice! One caveat is that although I believe the whole resort is wheel-chair accessible, bare in mind that the various facilities ( river ranch, spa, camp, restaurants) are quite spread out from the suites and casitas. My family was fine with it, but I could imagine that anyone unable to walk a few city blocks would need to ask the staff for particular rooms or golf cart transportation to facilities. I'm sure they would be helpful! The service was outstanding. We got prompt service every time we needed anything: ketchup, extra towels, etc. Of note: Dave, the concierge, was upbeat and extremely helpful with all of our sight-seeing. He even upgraded us at no charge to a "pure room" when he heard that one of our children had allergies. The room was a two room suite with 2 queens and a pull out sofa with a balcony. The beds were delicious and the air did feel very fresh--not sure if it was the "pure" room, the dry desert air or both. The river-ranch was a blast and my kids really enjoyed a morning at cayote camp. Jane, the director is professional, loving and creative. In just 3 hours my kids brought home fired-clay bowties, decorated cowboy bandanas and excitement about what they learned about the desert flora and fauna. I wish they could have gone more--they got so much out of it. I had the good fortune of receiving a phenomenal deep-tissue massage at the Tocosierra Spa on site. I considered going to one of the fancy local spas, but decided to go here for convenience. I was so glad I did because the massage therapist, June, ranked with some of the best I've experienced both in skill and care. I recommend a reservation here without reservation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Let's go back next year!”
Reviews.Author: WingsFan3
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was fantastic! We stayed 4 nights and 5 days, and we would definitely go back again. :) Everything at the hotel was kept clean and the grounds were beautiful. Our room was very clean and had a lot of space. Having a separate sink and mirror from the shower was very convenient. We spent a lot of time at the pool because the lounge chairs were so comfortable and it was very relaxing. The other pool area was also a good option for being more active (water slide, basketball hoop, and volleyball net). Everyone was very helpful and anything we needed was taken care of from the concierge, they were always available to help! We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: mtvcfv
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great, I loved the layout. The food at the restaurant was excellent and the time spent at the bar was relaxing and the service was spot on. All in all in was a great experience and I have already suggested to my wife that it would be a wonderful place to vacation this year. I would not change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay at a Luxurious resort”
Reviews.Author: MSchankweiler
Reviews.Content: Enjoy the entire resort. Great place to come back to after a day of meetings, golf or sight seeing. It has everything you need for yourself and your family to relax and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but older Hilton Resort with good staff”
Reviews.Author: AbbyAngelsCamp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pointe Hilton Squaw Creek for a Spring Training weekend, The hotel was packed with baseball fans from around the country. This is an older hotel and not near other hotels, but the area seemed fine. It took us about 15 minutes to get to downtown Scottsdale. We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom Casitas, which was clean, nice and big. The Hole in the Wall resturant is a good choice for breakfast and dinner. There are several pools, but the large pool and lazy river area was very nice and friendly, as was the poolside bar service. The hotel is kind of spread out over several acres so you have to walk a ways to get anywhere on the property. Rooms service was fast and the food was good. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the free wi-fi?”
Reviews.Author: DocVentura
Reviews.Content: I couldn't wait to find a McDonald's with free internet to write my review. The hotel has a pleasant setting near Piestewa Peak with beautiful swimming pools and suites with two large screen TVs. What is missing? Free wireless connections in your room. A charge is made for the wire connection in the room. That is so 20th Century, when I can get free wi-fi at McDs, or a the Sleep Inn on Scottsdale Road with a much lower room rate. The other item missing is a free breakfast as provided at Embassy Suites or at the Sleep Inn, or Best Westerns. The Rico Grill on the premises has good steaks and garlic mashed potatoes.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel for our Group”
Reviews.Author: soccerteam93
Reviews.Content: Our team stayed at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort during a recent tournament at Reach 11 in Phoenix. Soccer fields were about 13 miles away, not a bad drive.. It was totally crappy weather, we''d traveled a long long way for a disappointing event. But the team (older teenagers) had a fantastic time at the resort. Lots of putt-putt, swimming, water basketball, hot tubbing. Hotel had movie night, too. Fabulous restaurants nearby - kids loved affordable 5 & Diner, Aunt Chiladas. Players all had suites - 2 Queen beds w/sleeper sofas. Comfortable, Plenty of room for players, gear & family. Nice balconies, beautiful views. Very quiet rooms, even with 20 soccer teams at hotel. I was disappointed I didn't get requested upgrade to Casita, but Queen suite was nice, clean, quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Top resort.....”
Reviews.Author: Hoteladvisor2011
Reviews.Content: everyting is perfect. they even have a Private house you can rent for the Night.WOW!!!! we staed in the Casitas and it was like our own condo...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kkdoug
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights...had a wonderful time...the pool areas are wonderful, the staff is very accommodating, the grounds are exceptional, our room was perfect, comfortable bed, great food....all in all it's been our best trip to the Pheonix area and we've been the last 4 yrs. This was our first stay at this resort. My ONLY complaint is the cell phone service....hard to get reception in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Short stop over in an Oasis”
Reviews.Author: laurae
Reviews.Content: This was a quick weekend trip to Phoenix for a weekend event that just just a few miles away. The Hilton was a very convenient location for the event. Check in was quick and they offered us a choice of floor. We were in the South Pointe "Building" I call it a building with Quotes, because I was expecting everything to be enclosed like most Hiltons, but when we went to the rooms, they all have exterior doors that face a courtyard or pool. As we got there, my daughter commented that this looked nothing like other Phoenix hotels and she felt like she was in an Oasis in California (Ha). It was very well landscaped and appointed. Our room was a 2 room suite and very nice. King Bed in the bedroom and queen sofa sleeper in the living room. Each room had a large (37inch) flatscreen LG TV. Bathroom was inbetween the 2 rooms, with a tub/shower and toilet in one room and the Sink in another. There was a patio on the back of the bedroom with 2 chairs. Unfortunately we did not have time to use the facilities, such as the pool, fitness center, coyote camp or water park, but will try it on another visit. We had breakfast at Rico's cafe which is on property and we had HHonors vouchers that payed for the $15/person buffet. It was okay, but nothing special. They offer menu items or buffet with egg station. We had dinner at Tutti Santi Italian restaurant which next to the property. Very good meal and would go back. There seemed to be a lot of soccer families on the property and at 10pm at night they were running around. since every door faced the outside, we heard them running around as you were sitting in the living room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMansClan
Reviews.Content: This place was beautiful. Staff was so helpful and nice. Lots of activities something for our whole family to do. Kids really liked the Hole in the Wall restaurant. They even made it on the "wanted poster" wall.

Reviews.Title: “A family-friendly Hilton resort”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: Although I was going there as a follow traveller, I was primarily impressed as to how "family-friendly" the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort is - with activities and services for everyone. The hotel itself is divided into two main buildings (South Pointe and North Pointe) and a separate "casita" section featuring townhome style accomodation. The back of the resort features all the water actitivities (lazy river, water slide, pools), as well as a "Western" village. Camp Coyote features activities for the younger kids and sending the kids to camp (registration recommended as space is limited) means that the adults can enjoy some free time on their own. There are a couple of reasonably priced, relatively casual restaurants scattered throughout the resort. Hotel also has a spa/massage/gym complex. There is a small shopping mall nearby with a few additional dining and fast-food options. This hotel is located North of the downtown area (NorthWest of the airport). Driving to/from the property is recommended but a taxi to/from the airport is also an affordable option if you only intend to stay at the resort and not venture out! Location is also good if you intend to do a day tour north of the city (such as Grand Canyon or Sedona desert with a tour company) as you are most likely to be amongst the last ones to be picked-up and first ones to return. As I was there during the extremely low season, I had the pleasure to be upgraded to one of the casitas - an oasis of peace! Bedroom upstairs, with a full kitchen and living room area downstair. Definitely enough space for a family. Bed was extremely comfortable and everything was in working order. Staff is extremely friendly. There are a couple of walking trails nearby (Squaw Peak/Dreamy Trail, ask map at frontdesk). For Gold and Diamond HHonors member, the complementary breakfast consist of 3 items of your choice at Starbucks. I highly recommend to "upgrade" to the full breakfast ($7) at Rico's American Grill

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Squaw Peak is nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: alexoooo
Reviews.Content: We just wanted a quick weekend get away and saw a great deal for this hotel, read the reviews and was happy by what I saw. The hotel is a little off the beaten path if you are looking to take in shopping in Scottsdale, etc. But if you are looking for just a quiet place to relax and not be bothered, this is the place to be. There's a great italian restaurant across the street that makes everything from scratch so it's a must go to if staying here. The pool area is nice, bartenders very friendly and make amazing fruity drinks. Close to golf courses and other things if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “With all my travels throughout the world the concierge service provided by Carol has been the most outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ZIM71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated to travel to and see the sites in Phoenix and the environment around. While the accommodations are dated, the rooms are very well kept and clean and beds are comfortable. The rooms for the conference I attended were very good. However what makes this hotel really different is the friendly and professional service provided by staff. In particular the concierge service was outstanding. Carol went to extraordinary lengths to identify our touring and siteseeing needs, personal interests and tailored to our timelines and budget. This level of service was better than most higher end hotels I have stayed with and resulted in an exceptional trip!

Reviews.Title: “Started great--finished bad--some comeback”
Reviews.Author: murphykds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Squaw Peak while attending the BCS National Championships. The hotel is not in the main resort area around Scottsdale. It is a large property in West Phoenix. The property is well kept--great large pool area and smaller pool areas around the property. The property borders on a nice neighborhood and just a few blocks away are easy hiking trails. The front desk staff overall was great as was the male concierge (the female concierge was not as helpful--didn't appear to know much) We stayed in a Casita--a one bedroom bi-level with a efficiency kitchen and a small living room/dining room. The furniture was fine if slightly dated. The kitchen, however, had nothing. No utensils, no glasses (except two water glasses you would find in a hotel room) and a couple of styrofoam plates and plastic silverware. There wasn't even a bottle opener and it took forever to get one. So unless you were driving to the resort or willing to go out and buy kitchen supplies, other than having a refrigerator there was no advantage to having the kitchen. Both restaurants were mediocore to poor. Breakfast was particularly bad. There are a lot better choices close by including for breakfast. The bad news was the last day. We had not checked out--only left the room--and came back to find that almost everything had been taken out of the kitchen. It was very clear we hadn't left. An angry call to the front desk and housekeeping eventually led to the removed items being located, but by then we were late to the airport. To top it off, because of the volume of checkouts we were told that receipts weren't printing. After a relaxing three days it was a hurried, stressful departure. We were promised by the front desk manager that we would get it by e-mail by the end of the day. We also understood there would be some adjustment to the bill. Five days later I contacted the front desk manager because we still had not received a receipt. When it finally arrived there was no adjustment. A further contact to the front desk manager went unanswered. I finally wrote to the general manager and had a quick response; apology, and more than adequate adjustment to the bill. Had we not had the final day experience I would easily have given this hotel a "4." Assuming that what happened to us was a fluke I would still recommend the hotel--particularly if you have kids. The prices are cheaper than equivalent hotels in Scottsdale and its just a 15 minute drive into downtown Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort for a stay in Phoenix.”
Reviews.Author: bobomejor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights while in town for the BCS National Championship. Sadly, our beloved Oregon Ducks lost to Auburn by a field goal... but you can't win everything, I suppose. We stayed in a two-room king bed suite, which was great, as it had two large 40-ish inch flat-screen TVs (one in the bedroom, and one in the living room area). I had brought my laptop and an HDMI cable, and I was able to watch videos directly from my laptop. There's a fee for Internet use, though, so I didn't stream Netflix or anything. We ran into one snag with check in. I had booked the Winter Escapes package that was being offered by Hilton, which includes breakfast vouchers each morning and a $50 resort credit. In full disclosure, I booked it at pre-paid rate on Hotels.com, but I checked my confirmation email to make sure that was indeed what I was to receive. After I checked in and got back to the room, I realized that I had not received the breakfast vouchers. I called the front desk and the woman who answered didn't seem to know what I was talking about. I told her that I had booked the Winter Escapes package and that my confirmation from Hotels.com clearly stated that it included the above perks. I even checked on Hilton's Web site before we left Oregon to make sure the package was legit... sure enough, I found it (with this hotel listed) here: http://www.hilton.com/en/hi/promotions/hi_winter/index.jhtml?cid=OM,HH,WinterEscape,Specials The employee said, "I'll go ahead and do it,' which was nice... but, I'd rather have heard, "Oh, yes, you're right... we have it right here." Same outcome... but I don't like the idea that I booked something, had a confirmation of it... only to be told, "Well, we'll go ahead and do it" as though I was being done a favor. I did appreciate that I didn't have to press the issue, but I would have preferred that it was just done right in the hotel's system in the first place. Oh well. It all ended well. And the breakfast at Rico's Grill (which was still listed by it's old name -- Lantana Grill -- on the breakfast voucher AND a wall map in the lobby, causing some confusion on our part... please fix this, Pointe Hilton!) was quite good. The voucher was good for the breakfast buffet or $16.95 from the regular menu. We tried the buffet the first day, and it was quite good, and included a made-to-order omelet station, pastries, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, etc. The next day, we ordered off the menu, and again... the food was really good. The temperature was around 65 F when we were there, but nice and sunny. This is pretty balmy in January when you're from the Pacific NW and used to rain and overcast skies in the winter. So, we headed over to the River Ranch water park for some fun in the lazy river. This particular lazy river is rather *LAZY*... in that there is not a lot of water pressure (at least not when we were there). But, we still had a fun time because we had the park *almost* to ourselves, as this was definitely an off-season for the hotel. There are several pools, a hot tub, a mini-golf course (which we didn't try), and lots of fun things. I'd love to see it in the summer time. The hotel itself also has a few pools and hot tubs, which would be great for those who don't want to walk over to the River Ranch. Parking was free and easy. We were able to park less than a minute's walk from our room each time without hassle. Wi-fi is free in the lobby, but not accessible from most (if any) rooms. Since wired Internet access was like $12 a day, I just used my phone while we were there, except for once when I brought my laptop into the lobby to access a company server for work. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel. It was in a nice area, close to Piestewa Peak for a lovely hike... there's a 24-hour Wal-Greens down the street next to a grocery store... and lots of great restaurants in the Phoenix area (My advice: head to North Phoenix for some Chino Bandido. Chinese-Mexican fusion FTW!!). I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2B1301
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at Squaw Peak. Room was adequate but not the "awesome" place other reviews indicated. There was no wireless internet avaialbe in the rooms and wired internet was pricy - totally absurd for 2011! There was also a charge to use the business center. The room was nice but not worth the price. Dust was on everything in the room. The balcony was a joke and barely large enough for the 2 chairs and small table - not enough room to comfortably sit. Use of the on-site fitness center was an additional charge ($12/visit). Staff at Rico's restaurant on site was rude and non-accomodating. Glad I was not paying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and resort... very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: davie17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went with our 21 year old daughter and her friend for the BCS championship final. This resort has everything for young and old. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The concierge, we dealt with Carol, organized all our transport and a day trip to the Grand Canyon. including helicopter ride. She's the best concierge I have worked with. We stayed in a 2 bedroom Casita which was spacious but the decor and carpets are dated. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: traineebiggles
Reviews.Content: Just spent a great 2 day stay in a lovely spacious Cassita - all the staff from check-in, conceige, computer technician to Lobby Shop were kind, thoughtful and helpful - great level of service! Will book this hotel again when next in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: macderbs
Reviews.Content: We just returned for a 6 night stay over christmas, and can't say enough wonderful things about the hotel. We were in a bi-level casita with our two children and it perfectly fit our needs (other than the lack of dishes/glasses/flatware which was quickly fixed with a call to room service). The beds were super comfortable, and even though our neighbors warned us they would be throwing a party next door, we couldn't hear a thing! The restaurants (including Christmas morning room service) were delicious. Service was not speedy, but it didn't matter. We loved using the heated pools and hot tubs, and I used the gym everyday. The concierge set us up with a fantastic jeep tour of the desert, and great restaurant recommendations. And you can't beat the price for such large accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we didn't have to leave.”
Reviews.Author: ChloesMomBetsey
Reviews.Content: The three of us stayed in a pure allergen free room, which was guaranteed to be pet/smoke free and included an air purifier. The two room suite was very good; the bathroom large. Occupancy felt low over this Christmas break. Although we had guests on both sides of us, it very extremely quiet. The walls must be thick as you could barely hear the shower outside the bathroom. Several pools including a complex sure to delight kids, including sport pools, a long slide and a lazy river . We stuck to the "boring" pool outside our room. It was perfect. Three pools of varying temps. Loved it. "Resort pass " is offered for $3 for fitness, putting and other amenities. I'm not sure I would call this a resort; it was more like a deluxe hotel. Would DEFINITELY stay again. Reasonable rates let you take in desert attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: tiffany000
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in December during off season while I was in town for a meeting. The resort was a little quiet and it wasn't quite hot enough to lay out at the pool, but I had a nice stay. If you don't have a car, the location is not the greatest. There isnt anywhere nearby that you can walk to. If you have a car, its a great spot. Right in the middle of Phoenix and easy access to anywhere you want to go. I woke up early one morning and did the hiking trail that was nearby by myself. The concierge gave me a map, however the map was not very easy to follow. I walked thru a residential area and "guessed" a lot to get to the tunnel that goes under the freeway and up the mountain. I eventually found my way by asking a nearby apartment manager where I was suppose to go. The trail was nice and pretty easy, passed a few people walking their dogs. Great views of downtown Phoenix, but otherwise it was non eventful. My room was nice and a great deal for $99 per night (off season and prepaid rate). I had a king bed suite and it had a seperate living room and large bathroom area. I would definetely stay here again, during the summer I'm sure its a happening place.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jess3646
Reviews.Content: As far as a resort goes, the hotel was quiet and relaxing. Much of that could be attributed to us visiting in the off season but all the same the hotel was a nice retreat from the rest of Phoenix. The spa was slightly outdated but the pool area was lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Great Front Desk Agent (Sam)”
Reviews.Author: rgarret1
Reviews.Content: The wife and I are heading to Phoenix next week for a conference. The Tripadvisor reviews were great, so we decided to stay 1-day at Squaw Peak and the remaining three days at the "official" hotel chosen by the conference organizers. Well, not anymore. After a great conversation with the front desk agent, Sam, I booked our entire 4-day stay with Squaw Peak. I'll be sure to update everyone on the outcome of our visit. I have high hopes!

Reviews.Title: “BEST CONCIERGES EVER! Pristine resort. Extremely accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Linda travels
Reviews.Content: We have a family of 5 with 3 older children. We also have two people with special needs. One has autism and one is on a gluten free diet. They made every accommodation possible to make our stay perfect. Of course they couldn't make it warmer so we didn't get to use the wonderful pool area they have. The lazy river, pools, and recreational facilities, tennis and basketball and exercise room, looked great. But it was too cold to go in the water, even though it was heated. I have never met anyone at any hotel as accommodating as Carol. David and Eric, the concierges. They felt like family. Never felt like I was putting them out with all our special requests. Only con is that everything besides the rooms is fairly expensive. The restaurants, bars, gift shops, coffee, etc was pricey but there are a lot of fun places to eat in the area so you don't have to eat there. "The Hole in the Wall" restaurant manager, Tammy, did assure us there would be gluten free options for Thanksgiving which was very nice. We went to the spa at the Intercontinental Hotel nearby, I think it is called Joy Spa. I have been to many spas and nothing tops this. After your massage there is a "whisper room" you can go to and lay in the most comfortable beds and relax without any noise and drink tea or sleep, etc. It is great to be able to relax after a massage and not have to get up and go back to real life. You pay more for the services there but it includes the spa which has dry and wet saunas, terrace pool, etc. Treat yourself to this place. It is coed too so the guys can go. Also, the Ranger tours with AZ Hummer were very fun. You get to drive the Ranger and the guides.owners again were very accommodating to our needs. So if you ever take a trip to Phoenix stay here and tell them we say HELLO>

Reviews.Title: “Pointe Squaw Peak is the best its ever been - the best in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: PeakValentine
Reviews.Content: This is our ninth stay at the Hilton Pointe Squaw Peak and the property is the best its ever been. Altough its been consitently wonderful, the management has recently raised the bar. The resort has mastered the delicate balance between a world class resort, highlighting all the expected ammenities seasoned travler would expect from a five star resort providing a respite from the grind of frequent travel and the reward of treating my children and wife to the luxury of a destination resort offering service and fun. The Pointe Squaw Peak highlights all the postive attributes of the Valley of the Sun. Nestled on the western slope of Squaw Peak, the afternoon sun showcases the meticulus native landscape with palms and catus, , the faux western town, the waterfall and fountains of cascading water put us in another world. It was as if we were on a moive set of showcasing the absolute best of the west. Outside our room was a semi-private pool and jacuzzi so my kids were able to enjoy the relaxing water in the evening hours. The Hole in the Wall resturant served 1st class food and western service. The staff at the River Ranch provided activities such as a water slide race and hula hoop contests, as well as a movie shown at dusk on a big scren brought in for the event. The tennis courts were in great shape, and the minuture golf was fun as always. The tempurature during our stay was chilly – (even for us cold hardened Coloradians), so we really appreciated the management kicking up the heat on the pools. There is no better value to treat a family with children of all ages or a couple looking for a get away. Some families plan their vacation with a hotel as a base and make side trips to attractions. For the price of a hotel room, the Pointe Squaw Peak gives you the total package – large comfortable rooms and plenty for the adults and kids to do on property. Highly recommend this resort hotel. PS – I recommend the hike up Squaw Peak. It’s a relativly sturdy hike, 1.3 miles up (45 min hike) and only 2 miles from the property. This was our ninth consecutive stay at the Squaw Peak Hilton during the Thanksgiving holiday. I grew up in Tempe and my family has since moved to Gilbert. We celebrate Thanksgiving at my brother’s house – quite a party with 30+ family members! My wife and kids so enjoy the hybrid of vacation at the resort and family time in the east valley. This trip, I noticed a different attitude on property. The Hole in the Wall menu and staff was better; the River Ranch was better, the property looked sharp. Ricco’s was an improvement over Lantana Grill. The room was clean and the hospitality staff very attentive and courteous. Something has changed at the Squaw Peak Hilton – and it changed for the better. Good job to the management and the whole staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: volleyball1313
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort for a couples vacation. We stayed in the Casitas and were very happy with the amenities and cleanliness. It was just awesome to have the roof top deck and a pool right outside our door.The cushioned chairs at our pool were the most comfortable deck chairs we'd sat in!!! We also enjoyed the water park and mini golf. We ate at the Hole in the Wall (good food but our server was really put out on having to serve us!) and Ricos (great bar and food). I'd also recommend walking over to Aunt Chiladas. The hiking was right out the back of the hotel and was very challenging. Overall, we'd recommend this hotel and would love to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “A+ Resort and Spa - Service and Accomodations Consistently Wondferful”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaMan
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting the Squaw Peak Hilton for 15+ years. The service and accommodations consistently exceed expectations. Facilities were recently updated and reflect Hilton’s quality. This resort provides the greatest value: comfortable, clean, and spacious rooms; a perfect spa and fitness center; and multiple pools. This is the perfect family or adult getaway. Enjoy the pancakes at The Hole in the Wall restaurant. David, the conceierge, arranged many enjoyable dinners and giudance.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Shabby!!”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend getaway on the Stay 3 Nights and get the third night free. This in itself was a great deal, and sold the hotel for us. We brought our dog along because it was dog friendly, and the website promised welcome amenities for the dog when we got there, we never got anything. This wasn't a huge deal, and our dog didn't care so that was ok. The pools were awesome with a relazing lazy river. Unfortunately, there was a nerd convention in town, and there was a bunch of teenage geeks running around in costumes making a lot of noise. This almost ruined the whole weekend. But when you look at things that the hotel can control, they didn't really do any wrong. There was no above and beyond service, but it wasnt bad by any means. We liked the spacious rooms and the pools, and was in a nice location We will probably be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place”
Reviews.Author: goofy11362
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Spring Break. There were lots of kids but the only day you really felt it was on Easter Sunday. Otherwise there are so many pools and activities that everyone is happy. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place”
Reviews.Author: TereM1970
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the grounds of the resort. There are plenty of pools to choose from, great restaurants on the property and close by, and we really enjoyed the water park area. Although we thought the hotel was beautiful, our room itself was not that great. The room was not as cleaned as it should be. We found a dead roach in the door frames, I had to clean the toilet seat prior to first use (thankfully we had our clorox wipes handy), and it was dusty in many places. The couch in the living area was also in need of replacement. As bad as this sounds, the grounds itself makes up for the room itself. We stayed outdoors as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with ultimate service”
Reviews.Author: juliroze
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. The landscaping is really amazing, and all the outdoor areas are clean and well-kept. The lobbies and other public areas are all clean, with a feeling of openness and glamour. The decorating is done with a delightful southwest flavor, while maintaining home-like comfort. The beds were the most comfortable I've slept on in any hotel ever. Any time I called the front desk for assistance, they went above and beyond, meeting every need with excellence. I especially appreciated Jay at the front desk for his attention to every detail in making my stay perfect. Staying at this hotel is the ultimate experience!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jave19
Reviews.Content: this was one of the most value for money hotels we have ever had the pleasure to stay in We have travelled the states for 12 years and this is our favourite place so far.everyone was so friendly and the pina coladas by the pool were to die for.If you want a lesson in hospitality please visit this place it was heaven,thankyou everyone at squaw peak we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families with lots to do and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jathoms
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. The resort is big -- lots of pools, a really nice spa and fitness room, and the River Ranch is awesome! It has a great lazy river, 2 big pools with volleyball nets, a good waterslide, hot tubs, waterfalls, tennis courts, basketball courts, and mini golf nearby. We stayed in one of the 2 main buildings and had a room on the 4th (top) floor. Room 2402 It was a suite (upgrade b/c of Hilton Gold) and the room was HUGE. It had a small fridge and a big conference table, sofa bed, 1 and 1/2 baths, etc. The place was quiet. I would definitely recommend Aunt Chilada's about 100 yards up the road. You can charge your meal to your room -- it's good southwestern fare. Not a lot else going on near the hotel though, so you'll need a rental car if you're going out. We didn't try the on-site restaurant, but did eat lunch the the River Ranch one day. It was good.

Reviews.Title: “Pool was fun but overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: NeedMoPTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Squaw Peak for a "staycation". The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. We chose the hotel because of the "water park". The waterpark is a little smaller than we expected... a few pools, a slide, and a lazy river. It was very crowded. It took us quite a while to find chairs to put our stuff. We were a little dissapointed. We will probably look elsewhere for our next summer staycation.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable beds poor front desk service”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworldinc
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in. However the front desk personnel were extremely rude and had poor customer service training. I was hounded by the front desk clerk over a $3.00 error charge and our room key was deceived 4 times as a result of that. This was extremely inconvenient and annoying for an expensive hotel like this one. I also felt nickel and dimmed to use the pool area and activities. They charged $2.50 per day for the use and I thought this should be part of the hotel without the extra charge. Why bother the guest for a minimal amount like that?

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and enjoyable thanks mostly to excellent concierge assistance from Carol”
Reviews.Author: SGMG51
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly loved the privacy of the pools in the courtyards in the North and South Towers. Last year we were in the South tower, and this year we equally enjoyed the North tower. They have an excellent happy hour, and the staff is very friendly - delicious Bloody Maria's. For the 2nd year in a row, Carol (concierge) has gone out of her way to make our stay perfect. She has been very informative and helpful. She has excellent taste and has guided us in the right direction on many excursions. We hope to return to Squaw Peak in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “avoid weekends”
Reviews.Author: lawees
Reviews.Content: when we went to this hote it was a saturday and all 400 rooms were occupied with teenagers at a convention for japanees cartoon characters it was hell we had been travelling alot staying at different hotels this was to be 5 days of relaxation we could have cryed but on sunday they all checked out and peace was restored. the pool looked bigger on the net but it was ok . The pool didn,t open till 10am every morning which wasn,t good and closed at 6pm. Not what you expect from a hilton hotel.The fridge in the room was tiny

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Phoenix for a weekend trip and found the Hilton Squaw Peak to be an excellent escape. Being a Hilton gold member, upon check in we were upgraded on the spot from the most basic accomodation to a "Casita", which, in other words is a 1200 sq ft townhouse complete with two floors, a garage, and a semi-private pool and hot tub. In one word this accomodation was awesome. This resort had a large swimming pool, lazy river and mini golf course which we tended to avoid due to a large number of children running around which didn't match up with our definition of relaxing. Nonetheless the "Casita" pool served the purpose of relaxation very well. The location of this resort was very convenient to the Mountain Preserve for some great hiking as well which we took advantage of as well prior to getting massages at the resort spa which was also quite nice. I would also recommend visiting a restaurant close by called "The Rokery" which was absolutely fantastic. We would definitely return to this resort in the future, although we will probably try out the other Pointe Hilton nearby first just to see how the two compare.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Concierge Staff/Eric Sofield is the best”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan60763
Reviews.Content: I've been to many Hilton hotels around the world and the staff - including the amazing concierge staff at Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort - was some of the nicest, warm and best people I have ever meet in my life. Concierge David is a miestro of everthing going on in that property and helping me with room choices too. Concierge Eric knows everything about not only the fab property but can he pick the best places in town to eat - wow went to Donovans steakhouse on one of his recomendations - what a great place. Thank you for all your help with everything else too Eric - you made an out of towner feel like it was home - can't wait to come back to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TTMN
Reviews.Content: We truly had a great time at this hotel during our family vacation in 2010. Overall the service was terrific, the rooms were spacious and clean, the outdoor activities were fun and safe. One of our highlights was the dining experiences that were recommended by Eric (Squaw Peak Resort Concierge). Everyone of his recommendations were truly a great dining experience. I would strongly recommend to anyone who is looking for a great family vacation to check out this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: lsstucson
Reviews.Content: We heard the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort in Phoenix was a fabulous resort, so we decided to check it out. We checked in on a Friday and checked out Sunday. My husband and I went with 4 other people. All together, we had 3 rooms. When we got there, the staff at the front desk were very welcoming and friendly. They upgraded our rooms to the casitas. The casitas we had were 2 stories. The bottom floor had a dining room, living room, powder room and a kitchenette with a fridge, microwave and sink. There is covered parking just outside the kitchen door. The top floor had the bedroom and bathroom along with a beautiful patio. The guys went golfing that Saturday at the golf course of the sister hotel, Pointe Hilton Tapatio. Beautiful course. My friend and I decided to have a spa day at Squaw Peak. The spa was amazing. We were pampered and treated like princesses! The grounds are well kept and quite nice to walk around. We ate at a couple of the restaurants and the staff at the restaurants were very friendly and the food was very great. Our experience was nothing short of perfect. Checkout was a breeze. I highly recommend this beautiful resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decide what you need - relaxation, or fun”
Reviews.Author: KevandJan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights as the first part of a West US road trip. We had a really nice Casita with it's own pool and jacuzzi, but we arrived on labor day weekend. The pool was party central until 3.00am in the morning (not what you neeed after a 11 hour flight from the UK. However, after the weekend it was like a ghost town, seemed like we had the whole resort to ourselves. Moral of the story - this is a great place for families or if you're looking for fun in the water park, but probably not the best place if you are looking to chill out (especially at weekends).

Reviews.Title: “Decent and Clean but just okay overall”
Reviews.Author: Fortune112
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a casita with teenage son. We both thought the water park/main pool area was overrated - too shallow and too crowded to do much other than satnd/sit in the water. The very small pool by the casita was better, but it was taken over repeatedly by families with many kids. Casita itself was spacious and clean, but internet access was extra and kitchen had no appliances (just a two-cup coffee maker). When we book suites when travelling, as we like to do, we expect (and usually find) free internet access and fullsize coffee pot and a toaster, at a minimum. The Pointe doesn't even match up to basic Hiltons such as Hampden Inns (which we find uniformly good places to stay). Restaurant on site had inoperable AC, which is ridiculous in Phoenix during summer. Staff kept parking in my assigned covered parking spot during day, and was impolite and slow to respond when I asked them to move.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with 1 night stay for business”
Reviews.Author: Misha22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on business with colleagues and this review is for business travelers who might consider the Hilton Squaw Peak vs. families or vacationers as we did not use the pool. The hotel was at least 1/2 empty being a Monday night in Phoenix in the summer after the kids have returned to school. We arrived to only one person working the front desk who was assisting a guest without a reservation. We had to wait for some time while the front desk clerk explained all the rooms, rates, etc. and then spent considerable more time offering various upgrades. No apology was offered for the wait once it was our turn to check-in. We were also offered an "upgrade" to a king suite. What a disappointment! The rooms have balconies and the view from our rooms faced the laundry facility, which not only was an eyesore but loud with the machines running around the clock. For a half-empty "resort" and an "upgrade" for a Hilton Diamond member, this was extraordinarily disappointing. One would think the hotel would like to earn return business and take the opportunity to offer rooms to its loyal Hilton customers that at least had a "resort" type view. Even a room with a view of the parking lot would have been better. This was a boneheaded move on Hilton's part. The room itself was fine. The bathroom had been updated with nice granite counters and tilework. Flat screen TVs in both the sitting area and bedroom were nice. Bed was comfortable. The hotel offers a continental breakfast in the gift shop, which is as odd as it sounds. It's not really a continental breakfast but a coffee shop with overpriced pastries and nowhere to sit. When checking out the next morning, we commented on the terrible location of our "upgraded" rooms and were again offered no apology by the front desk personnel. Will not return in the future and would not recommend to other business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and an incredible deal for off-season!”
Reviews.Author: debordju
Reviews.Content: Went last weekend to Phoenix and booked a stay at Squaw Peak based on a recommendation from a co-worker. Wow - we had a great stay! Booked the stay 2 nights and get Sunday free and paid $119 night off my Hilton Honors account. Was pleased when we got there that as a Gold Hilton member, I was upgraded to a Casita with 1 and 1/2 baths, upstairs with 2 queen beds and a living room and small kitchen downstairs. Room was very clean and the staff did a great job while we were there. Covered parking was great for the car since it was 105 most of our stay. Also got my Gold member free certificates for breakfast at the coffee shop (1 coffee or tea, one juice, soda or water and 1 baked good) that was a great deal, but you could also use them for the Lantina Grill breakfast buffet for additional $8. We went there and were shocked when it was kids eat free for summer, so ended up paying $16 for all four of us. Lantina Grill breakfast was great and had some form of tortilla and egg thing that was great. It gets better! Got a certificate for 6 to the Luau buffet at the pool on Sunday night for being a Gold member. Line was super long and we got there a little late, but the show and the food was really good (and we lived in Hawaii for 3 years). What a deal! (that is why I am loyal to Hilton!) It was hot, but we did pool in the morning and took a break in the afternoon and then back for night swimming. They have a nice putt putt that is part of the extra $2.25 package per day. Worth it. Lazy river was good and...well...really lazy. Sometimes it took some time to make it all the way around. Boys loved the slide and they had kids games at pool, a water slide race, etc. Poolside drinks were expensive I thought, but where aren't they. Staff was great for what interaction we had. My wife brought her own blowdryer and popped the breaker. Called the front desk since we had no lights and expected to sit there for an hour, but the maintenance guy was there in less than 5 minutes. If you are staying here, try out Jeff and Mike at AZ Hummer Tours. It was the highlight of our trip and they are great guys and a wonderful company. Casitas were recently done and had nice granite tops and a 4 top table, desk, 2 leather couches and flat screen TVs. Lots of pillows and we slept well. Wife got a pedicure treatment special at the spa for $50 and got manicure and margarita special for $15 on 1st night. She liked the spa and commented that the manicure lasted an entire week with no issue (don't know that that comment means, but she was happy). Great place and we will be going back next summer. Can imagine the place gets crowded during the winter season, but we really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very relaxing and awesome kid's club.”
Reviews.Author: EvilLion
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older but the resort is very relaxing and a great place overall. The regular pool has a swim up bar and cushion beach chairs. The water park is not as big as the Arizona Grand but its always not as crowed. The restaurants and bars usually run some kind of special. Happy hour and late night happy hours at a hotel bar is usually unheard off. Dinning and drinks here are a great value compare to other resort. They have special rates during the summer for kid’s camp. My daughter really enjoys the camp. I enjoy this hotel more than the Arizona Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: judiuu
Reviews.Content: My family an I went on a much needed vacation to Az. We first drove to Sedona Az and it was wonderful! In Sedona we stayed at La Quinta with no problems. Then we drove to the Grand Canyon and stayed at a Holiday Inn Express. Again it was a good hotel choice. We thought we were saving the best hotel for last. After staying at the Grand Canyon we drove to Phoenix for our last 3 days of vacation. We choose the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort as a treat to end our trip. WHAT A MISTAKE! My daughter woke up our 1st morning there, she took a shower, grabbed her towel and thank god she did not dry herself off! In her towel was human feces! This is in not a joke! Believe it our not it went downhill from here. The housekeeping spvsr. offered us the room next door and comped 1 night. The drain was clogged in our new room and the desk spvsr. offered an engineer to fix it!! I wanted to leave after the first discusting issue but my kids were having fun and we did not want this hotel to ruin our trip. Long story short, the drain was never fixed, nobody followed up with us regarding any issue. I decided to stick it out only because my kids did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and resort. Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: StaffordshireKnot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort and a three week camping road and camping trip and was just what we needed after such a hectic trip. The resort was superb value for money and very relaxing. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the resort was very clean and well look after. There were plenty of pools throughout the various parts of the hotel as well as a waterpark with lazy river which was exactly what was needed in the heat. The only negatives were the hotel gets very busy from Friday to Sunday and it only has free WIFI in public lobbies. I recommend the hotel to singles couples of families and would just say to any visitors from the UK be prepared to tip the bar staff and waitressess etc as is expected all across the USA. We will definately return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel077
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after driving from Las Vegas, NV, and visiting the Hoover Dam. Thankfully we'd already made a reservation before hand as some people next to us hadn't and were told there were no rooms available. The lobby was lovely, and our room was fantastic! - really roomy, nicely decorated and we had a great view from our balcony! The restaurant at the Hole-in-the-Wall River Ranch was great and so was the service. The next day, the River Ranch was really, really busy and it took us ages to find somewhere to sit (granted, it was Independence Day). The lazy river was very enjoyable and it keeps you cool! Overall, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place for the entire family!”
Reviews.Author: mkariker
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable, friendly and the resort is gorgeous. The entire family enjoyed the water park as well as food and beverage options. Would go back for a family or friend trip anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for families”
Reviews.Author: danno719
Reviews.Content: This is a family resort. Don’t assume that because it is a Hilton that it will be a classy crowd staying there. If kids having fun bother you then this may not be the place for you. My wife and I went here, just the two of us and we had a great time. The water park isn’t that large, but the lazy river and the main pool were nice. It was 115 degrees while we were there so the lazy river and the hotel pools were really warm, but the main pool at the River Ranch was cooled. Like some other reviews said, the water park was seriously lacking when it came to daily upkeep. Cups and towels left all over weren’t picked up until the end of the day, some not even then. Rules weren’t enforced as far as, “No swimming in the lazy river. Stay in your tube”. If you wanted to float around in your tube, you were constantly being blocked or pushed out of the way by people not in tubes, but just playing around in the river. Nothing was ever said to anyone about it, and it was slightly annoying at first, but seeing how they didn’t enforce that rule, I didn’t feel bad breaking the rule about bringing in your own food and drinks. Food and drinks at the poolside restaurants and bar were way too pricey. The rest of the hotel was fine, clean rooms and nice staff. The refrigerator froze everything and we couldn’t find an adjustment to lower the temp., and didn’t bother to ask anyone how to do it. We never ate at any of the hotel restaurants. There are tons of places to eat close by. If you like sushi, try Moto Sushi about a mile up the road. During the week get there between 3 and 5 for happy hour. The only down side of Moto’s was loud angry music. There is a McDonald’s up the road for a cheap breakfast, and a grocery store to stock up on stuff for your stay. The WIFI is $12 per day, but we were able to find a signal and hook up without having to pay for subscribing. It was a weak signal and was hit and miss, but we used it to find some restaurants that we wanted to try. If you absolutely need to have internet, you may want to pay, but try it first and see what kind of signal you get. All in all, not a bad place to stay in Phoenix especially if you have kids. Maybe Hilton will work on maintaining the water park a little better. While we were there it looked like it was all kids working in there and they didn’t really care enough to work hard. After school starts an older group may come in and things may improve.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort w/ a small room”
Reviews.Author: cinder8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 'studio' room (the other half of a lock-off suite), and it was very small. We had a king bed with very little room for anything else in the bedroom, and a bathroom area (no mini fridge or microwave, but they will bring you a microwave for free if you call and a fridge for $15). The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The best part of the resort is the waterpark - it has a lazy river, sports pool, pool volleyball, mini golf course (not the best one - very basic), waterslide, and pools for each area of the resort. If you go here, it might be worth it to upgrade to the larger room (a suite). Otherwise, prepare for a small living space, but adequate for sleeping for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “It was so fun.”
Reviews.Author: angelicattravis
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay , we were at the hotel most of our 4 day stay and we never were bored . Drinks by the pool , games and snow cones for the kids , no complaints .

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more - only reason to stay is the pool area”
Reviews.Author: WVE
Reviews.Content: Concrete buildings not welcoming you, dirty elevator, dark corridors, room was not clean (e.g. empty beer bottle under TV cabinet). We had an Ambassador suite, which was sure very large but not very logically constructed. It did not appeal to us, a shame of the extra money. The resort is quite extended and at first you sure get lost. There should be more guidance and support for new guests. The recreation and pool area is great, however it can get very crowded. The Hole in the Wall restaurant offered a good dinner, the breakfast however was double zero.

Reviews.Title: “A very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: some_honest_guy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights with our 2 year old son and we were not disappointed. We used Hilton Hhonors points for the stay and since we are Gold members, we were upgraded to an Ambassador Suite in the North Pointe building at check-in. They also gave me the code for free wireless internet, was was nice after seeing that they charge $12. The room was quite large and had 2 bathrooms and a small deck. The water park was why we selected this hotel, and it was great, but was a solid five minute walk from our room. The North Pointe building has it's own private pool which was convenient for a quick dip close to home. Lantana Grill room service was very good, but the buffet breakfast was lackluster and overpriced at $15. This was a fun getaway in a good location close to the 51 freeway, I would recommend it for families that will use the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Arizona getaway!”
Reviews.Author: wllsmichelle
Reviews.Content: As a quick getaway from the heat, I traveled across the valley to the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak with my two girls, ages 21 and 16, my sister and her two girls, ages 8 and 10. We stayed in a Casita which was perfect! There was so much room. We especially enjoyed sitting out on the patio deck late and night. It was so much fun to have our own little house. We also enjoyed spending time at the pool area-especially the lazy river. We made great memories spending time together at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: very5678
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visit our son and daughter-in-law in Phoenix, we always stay one or two nights at the Pointe-Squaw Peek and totally enjoy our visit. The rooms are nice and the price is reasonable. The lazy river water ride is the most relaxing time we get and then there are many pools jsut to swim. The staff is very friendly go out of their way to make our stay problem free.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge of the year”
Reviews.Author: pcc7651
Reviews.Content: The pools were great, the rooms were wonderful, we had a great time.Every staff member we encouthered was friendly and the concierge (his name was Eric, we didn't catch his last name) is one of the best we have ever encountered. It was a pleasure staying at the hotel and we will visit again next year, sooner if we can.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this Hotel to Anyone...Awesome time.”
Reviews.Author: atinamarie
Reviews.Content: What a great time! We went to the resort over spring break and from the moment we arrived we had fun. We rented a Casita and it was great I loved the fact that the living area was downstairs and the bedrooms were upstairs. Upon our arrival the staff greeted us and took us to our rooms, the kids loved the fact that there was a tv downstairs and in every room. After unpacking we went to the pools and were amazed at the choices we had. There was a general pool that was huge which branched off to a water slide where life guards were in attendance at the top and bottom. From there there was a kiddie area that I had a hard time keeping my 9 and 11 year out of, Next we found the lazy river which was perfect for my husband and son and of course me. When we were looking for activity they had a sports pool & miniature golf. If we were hungry or thirsty the pool bar had everything you could want ( I totally recommend the homemade salsa.) If we wanted something more relaxing the Lantana Grill offered salads and sandwiches & they also went out of there way to please my picky kids. My favorite pool is the one that was framed by our room where the kids could play & we could watch them from the convenience of our deck. Can it get better? They also offer coyote camp where the kids learned about the desert made crafts & just had fun. They also had a spa where my 10 yr old got an ice cream pedicure. All in all this was our best vacation ever, the staff was outstanding the concierge was extremely helpful and the maid service was great bringing us extra towels and shampoo. Also loved the available washer & dryer. I have recommended this place to all my friends & we will be spending many more vacations there

Reviews.Title: “perfect time!”
Reviews.Author: naturalmom
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a staycation for our 7th anniversary. We have 3 small children and wanted somewhere to go with the whole family! We had a great time and it was fun for all ages! It was easy to check in and out and we loved the pool area!! Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “Poor management and organization”
Reviews.Author: JCE0721
Reviews.Content: I signed up specifically to review this hotel. I have been staying at the Pointe hotels since I was a child. My mother had her wedding reception dinner here nearly 30 years ago. It's not the nicest resort in town, but it's usually a good value and always fun for all. That being said, 7/8/2010 will be the last stay for any of my family at either of the Pointe resorts. First of all, I booked a two bedroom casita in March and prepaid for it so it would be a reduced rate. It ended up being $20 less then the actual rate but oh well! At least I had the security of knowing I had the room. Living in Arizona, summer birthdays are not always easy- it's so hot. It has been our tradition to celebrate my birthday and now my daughters birthday at the Pointe Resorts. The staff has always been accomodating to guests and making us feel special. Yesterday was Cassidys 2nd birthday. We booked the casita specifically so we would have room for both grandmas to stay and a little room for some family and friends to enjoy Cassidys birthday. When we arrived- my pre-booked casita was not available. They told me I had only booked the queen one. I found the confirmation and they realized they were in err. "Ok, that's indeed what you booked, but We don't have one available right now. They are cleaning the downstairs portion of the casita but you may enter thru the king entrance and we will let you know when it's ready." Well, at least I have the room right? So we decide to do this. When we unloaded all of our belongings and entered the open portion of the casita, it was cramped to say the least. But at least it was cool. But there were 6 of us with some other family on the way. I asked the maid to put my cake in the fridge downstairs. I got a glimpse of the downstairs portion and was in shock. Someone had a major party on there the night before- like furniture overturned, bottles everywhere, sticky floors- an absolute disaster. No way would these two poor maids get this cleaned up by 5. I vaguely remember the front desk guy saying the guests who were there had a late checkout. Yea, I see why;) We call the desk and to my surprise, we were moved- to a 2-bedroom casita right across the way! But why not in the first place? Before we'd unloaded our things, etc. But the front desk did say they would help up carry our things across the car port. And that we were closer to the pool! Wow! Super nice bell boy came and helped us out. We were settled by 5:30- but that hour and a half of unsettlement for my daughter was not good. If you have or have had a two year old you know what I mean;) When my husband called the desk this AM- we wanted a late checkout and maybe just an apology,he was given the run around by a very rude manager. They didn't do late checkouts(HMMMM) Did we want to stay another night in a suite room for $69? LOL at that(they had a coupon for next stay in a suite room for $79.) The guys acting like we want the whole thing comped which at the time I didn't .I did. I got on the phone and told him the same story I've just told and he laughed at me several times and mocked me when I said I am a service manager at a large corporation and I usually don't complain. He mocked me about having children. His tone of voice was sarcastic. He was absolutely awful. He said that the GM was too busy to help us and wouldn't be available to talk. They also charged us for phone calls when we had paid for the value pack. Including the long distance one when I asked him for the corporate #. And do they not have a 1-800#? I didn't expect much, but I don't expect to be laughed at. I don't expect for everyone to go above and beyond the way I would in a case like this, but rudeness is unacceptable I see in reviews on here and Yelp that they have service/maintenence issues. The water park was dirty and unattended to. Service/Food in park. -so so. I used to love this place and I'm sorry that a tradition is over. Oh well, I'll go to the AZ Grand next year. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Managers Need Retraining"”
Reviews.Author: Endorph206
Reviews.Content: After incurring problem after problem with securing our reserved room, the staff was inhospitable and unwilling to make any allowances for their mistakes and were actually rude upon checkout! The property is well maintained in the casita area, but rooms are nothing special and the carpet needed a DEEP cleaning. Barefoot on the carpet meant you picked up all kinds of gunk! We plan several more "short vacations" thruout the summer, but certainly won't be staying at this place! Nicer places close by with better trained staff! Hilton should be ashamed!

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak”
Reviews.Author: BaseballFan5
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, my husband, and two boys - ages 11 &9) thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak. We stayed for 2 nights - July 6 & July 7.
