The staff couldn't have been more helpful - our first room had a smoky smell, the second room had an extremely loud humming/buzzing noise from the air conditioning unit, so they moved us to a third, which was fine. Through it all, the staff was friendly and accommodating. More towels were brought up within minutes of us calling for them. We booked the hotel for $127/night, which included a full breakfast buffet at Lantana Grill - which was a nice little bonus. Now on to the River Ranch - this waterpark area made my 11 year old son declare "This is my favorite hotel ever!!" We were there during the week - so not too crowded or too crazy. The pool was clean, and they loved the waterslide and poolside games for the kids. For $2.25 total (not per person) our family played unlimited mini golf - it also included use of the tennis courts & fitness center, but we didn't use those. That was a great deal. The mini golf course wasn't super fancy, but clean and well kept. One more thing that was great - on our way out, we stopped to take a picture of us by the fountain behind the lobby in South Pointe. I accidently left my purse on a lounge chair. I realized it 5 minutes after we drove away. In a panic, I called the front desk, and one of the employees ran right out for me and found it still sitting there. He brought it to the front desk & we drove back quickly to get it. Little things like that really made me happy about the resort. My only suggestions would be - the rooms are a little dark. They're not outdated, but just a little dark. The smaller pool within the South Pointe area was filled with left over towels from the night before the next morning. Nothing had been cleaned up. My kids would have loved it if the River Ranch was open later than 8pm. We also noticed large groups of older teens wandering around without adults present. We didn't have any kind of problems at all or feel threatened, but were reluctant to send our kids out anywhere by themselves - even just to get ice. Overall, we loved the hotel and found the little things that we would change not bothersome enough to complain about them. I have stayed at the Phoenician with my husband's work (won't pay for it myself :), and the Pointe HIlton is not that type of place. If you're expecting superb luxury, this is not the place. However, it's clean, fun & a great place for kids to be kids.

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed for the last time”
Reviews.Author: deerae69
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel since I was a teenager, Now an adult with my own children, I want them to have the same lovely memories of this place I had. We have been going for the past three years about four times a year. This last visit was our last. I have been noticing a decline in cleanliness and service with each visit, but this last trip was borderline disgusting. Our room was the quality of a Motel 6, no cleaner and no fancier. I asked for a nicer room and I was told there wouldn't be any. We then head to the pool to enjoy the day there and were grossed out by all the empty cups and trash laying everywhere you looked. Dirty cups were just floating in the already cloudy and dirty pool water. Children even made poolside games all the cups floating around. With all the money this hotel rakes in you would think they could employ a buss boy. When your feet touched the bottom of the pool there was more sand down there than would be on a beach. The "Lazy" river was a joke. Annoying kids WITHOUT tubes run past you pushing your tube into the wall. Lifeguards are present but pay no attention. The food at the pool was gross and overpriced. Not to mention the major unfriendly staff that serves it. Very disappointed with every aspect of my stay. So much so we left and checked into the Arizona Grande. WOW...what a difference. Lovely rooms, friendly staff, and GORGEOUS grounds and water park. Can't wait to go back...and I will never again even consider the Point Hilton at Sqauw Peak.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: 75hulk
Reviews.Content: Checked in on July 1st for the 4th of july weekend and had a terrible time. Room had Roaches in it, ice machine didnt work and it was 104 degrees. and airconditionorinor did not work, roches were in the room. place is run down and dirty. Manegment was bad, staff was confused. I derected the mainteance people and maids my self as to what was wrong. They agreed that they were over worked and they had no cummunication from manegment. Maintenace Man said airconditionor had not been serviced in months.Swimming Pools were dirty and run down. Not what you excpect from a hilton and i am a Hilton Honors member. When i spoke to a maneger about the problems they did nothing about it. Staff siad they didn"t realy care they had worked so much over time any way. stay at marriot or a hyatt. Don't waste your hard earned $ at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst reort I have ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: chriscre
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom Casita for 2 nights 2 weeks in advance, were told it would sleep 6. When we arrived we were told they only had a 1 bedroom that sleeps 4 but would give us another room for $49.00. A THIS POINT WE HAD NO CHOICE SO WE TOOK IT. The second night we were told that they room was not avalible. We were going to try to fit into the 1 bedroom but decided just to leave, which was actually a good thing because the place was terrible. The water park was filthy, dishes, food and cups were all over the place. Dirty towels on the ground and they made no attempt to clean it up. Food all over the ground. It was just nasty. The staff was a disaster, very unprofessional, sloppy looking. Cars lined both sides of the roads to the casitas. If an emergency vehicle had to get back to them there was no way it could. We barely got our small car between the cars. The place was a zoo. We saw peole drive in, use the pools and than get in their cars and leave. They had no control over the place at all. It had to be the most horrible experience with a so called luxury resort we had ever had. I had planned on spending some time at their spa but decided against it. IF it was anything like the rest of the place there was no way I was spending my money there. The only plus was that the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Machaveli1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while she was at a conference downtown. It took about 15 minutes to get from this property to the convention center, so I stayed around the hotel a lot. The pictures of the property make it look nice than it is, but I still would recommend it. The rooms feel a little cramped, dark, and it's exterior room access. I want to give this property 3.5 stars for the rooms. Our room was clean and comfortable, but they are due for an update in the next 2-3 years. The pool was great. The lazy river is fantastic to float around with a drink and the water slide was fast and fun. Wear your shoes around the pool. The concrete is scalding. Everyone was hopping from shade to shade to wet spot. The pool is nice. Make sure to go up to the lazy river. There are a lot of umbrellas and the lounge chairs have pads. We had great experiences at the restaurants. The food was good. It's not Top Chef, but it's good hotel restaurant food. No complaints here. As long as your expectations are in line, you will like this hotel. It's 3.5 out of 5 stars. If you are expecting 4 or 4.5, then you're going to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bokk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package through British Airways and thought it very good value. It is well located for the airport but in a quiet part of the city. Our room was a standard - but in the US this means greater value than UK hotels. We had a "living room" with television, fridge and coffee maker, bathroom area with toilet and shower separate to the sink area, bedroom with television and a balcony which overlooked a car parking area but we were not at all bothered by noise. The bed was a king size and was extremely comfortable with excellent pillows. The air conditioning was extremely efficient and despite this being June with outside temperates of around 110 degrees F the room was always comfortable. Our stay was during the US school holidays and the hotel was quite busy, particularly over the weekend but we did not find this a problem. Being visitors from the UK and particularly on our first few days before our "time clock" had adjusted, we were getting up quite early so sometimes had the pool in our block to ourselves. The lazy river and pool complex located at the back of the hotel were at times busy but on our last evening we had the lazy river to ourselves as families had presumably gone off to have dinner and it was very peaceful and relaxing. However, it has to be said that at times the pool areas were very busy and noisy so you need to choose your time to go and early mornings or late evenings were the times, if you wished to have a peaceful dip. As part of our deal we had breakfast vouchers and used these in the hotel restaurant (Lantina Grille) for the buffet breakfast which was adequate. There is a supermarket a couple of blocks down from the hotel and we bought water and soft drinks there which we kept in the fridge of our room so we always had a cool drink and I had taken tea bags so we used the coffee maker to heat the water and brewed tea this way. How English of us - but it was great to have a cup of tea in the mornings. The hotel was in a good spot for getting to restaurants and shopping areas and it only took around 20 - 25 mins (depending on traffic) to get to Scottsdale shopping and restaurants. Equally easy was getting to the main highways for our trips out of town. We had visited Phoenix twice before and stayed in different hotels but thought this hotel was very good and we would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Lazy River!”
Reviews.Author: SWGoodSam
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to Squaw Peak specifically to cool our heels on the Lazy River. In Mid-June we found the pool and 'river' to be crowded with kids and groups who banded together and made it much less restful than our previous visit in August. The staff who police these areas are very young and pretty much anything goes. We still enjoyed our trip, but will search for a less popular time slot in the future. The rooms are lovely and clean, refridg, but no microwave. Coffee Maker worked fine tho. With the Suite, we had a livingroom, bedroom and balcony all of which we enjoyed. *bathing suits dry much faster outside. We were allowed 4 water park passes per day and our 22 yr old daughter and a friend were able to join us at no extra charge. My husband was insulted to find there was a charge to look up a local business on the internet. However, all in all we enjoyed our stay and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kunfushuss
Reviews.Content: Given the photos online, we thought this was going to be an excellent stay. However, it was crowded, the wait at the front desk was long, the rooms were smaller than they look online, the room window had two windows, both with views of opposing buildings' walls, there was no microwave, etc. etc. There was also the hole in the wall restaurant, which was a hokey restaurant with average food, but pretty pricey. The worst things was that almost nothing was complementary. The internet, for example, cost $12/day, or you can go to the business suite and use their computers for 59c/min. The spa, although it looked nice, had services almost exclusively $100 and over. A 12-oz soda in the vending machine was $2, and a bottle in the gift shop was $2.50. It must have been making up for the relatively inexpensive room. It wasn't the worst place I've ever stayed, it just looked so great online and turned out to be a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A lazy river is the perfect antidote for the heat!”
Reviews.Author: Angelaa408
Reviews.Content: When we got into the room it was clean and well decorated, a perfect size. It was a two-story casita that had a medium-sized refrigerator and microwave in the kitchenette. The bed was very comfortable, I kept sleeping later than I wanted to! There was a pool right next to our casita, and I was concerned about noise. But we never heard any outside noise at all, really. The lazy river and main pool were a lot of fun, and my favorite was the water slide. All of the amenities at the hotel were satisfying. The Lentana Grill was great for buffet breakfast and the dinner we ate there was also delicious. Last but not least, Eric the terrific concierge took care of our every need, he really made the experience at this hotel absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort In Phoenix Area”
Reviews.Author: mominokc
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Phoenix to visit my husband's grandmother. The Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak was wonderful! It is the perfect hotel for families. Our suite was great, I have no complaints. Every staff member we came in contact with was wonderful. The staff at the concierge desk was extremely helpful. The food at the Hole In The Wall restaurant was a little pricey but very good. My children enjoyed the water park and the pool outside our hotel room. We had a great experience at this hotel. We would definitely stay here in the future. The location is close to all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO HERE.”
Reviews.Author: llsheely
Reviews.Content: Old, overpriced, rude staff at the pools and dining.Had a terrible experience here over the weekend. The 2 bed casita had bugs, the pools are not like it shows online, don't be fooled please read this and look at another place to stay. Waited forever to get waited on at slim pickins, no one ever came, they stood around talking , I even went and got my own menus and told the staff where I was sitting and that we would like to eat...they still never came. We finally got up and left to go to hole in the wall to eat, and as I dropped my towels off out front and told the staff there that we would be back for the towels, and that no one would wait on us at slim pickins so we would be going to try hole in the wall to see if we could get some service there they made a smart comment as we walked away "woooo scary" they said. I was floored, and when I called the front desk to speak with a manager about this right when it happened, they said there was no manager around and then he took my cell number to have one contact me within the hour, that call never came. I have stayed at many many hiltons before and I just can't believe that they are aloud to call themselves a hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssenit
Reviews.Content: Just back form this hotel and it was really good value and in a good location for my second visit to Scottsdale. (Previously in Fairmont so used to a good one) The hotel only cost us around £60 per night with a Trailfinders reservation and we were delighted with it - we even had breakfast vouchers. The apartment is good with a living room, fridge, coffee maker, but no safe and on old box TV which will be replaced soon they said. The bedroom is a good size but bathroom is tight. Plenty of onsite close parking. There are pools for each block as well as the water park which is great. Only annoying thing is the tendency to close off part of the best area at weekends for private parties and at weekends the numerous kids who run riot as their parents allow it. The grounds are great and all is nice and clean so no complaints. As experienced Hilton users, we tend to ignore their restaurants but I have the best tip ever here. Across the road is a pub restaurant called Gallachers where you can feel right at home. The extensive menu is great, food quality is brilliant, and the costs are reasonable. The service here is great with all the girls doing a great friendly job and in particular I compliment the manager Ben Lira who wants to know you and treats all his customers really well. This is often the Scottsdale way where people have a great sense of customer relations. You would hardly know Gallachers is there because it looks like an office but is is the best kept secret which needs a flashing sign. Another good one is the Olive Garden on Cactus Road Anyway, back to the Hilton where we decided to stay on for an extra couple of days at a room rate of $109. The hotel is very worthy of a visit particularly for families and for couples, weekdays are best. If you need to use the internet, they charge in the room but just go to the business centre where you can use the computers for free. Scottsdale is the best of America largely undiscovered by Brits so far but give yourself a treat and visit it. The Hilton Pointe is great value and well located with very froendly staff there to serve you well.

Reviews.Title: “Not the way it looks”
Reviews.Author: olewinel
Reviews.Content: Great pictures on internet site. Suite wihtout microwave. One bed blocked half of the doorway (fire hazard?) Tiny bathroom, hard to close door. Little info on where things are located. Best thing was a big cockroach that crawled out one evening. Not many freebies, everything additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Always turns a business trip into a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: lsalrin
Reviews.Content: The grounds are always well maintained. Even though it is a great family hotel, you can always find a quieter pool if you want peace.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithkids010
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience at the Hilton Pointe Squaw Peak Resort. Rooms were great. The entire family loved the pools. Staff was wonderful and very helpful with all requests. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been Better!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToVacationAZ
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Squaw Peak was terrific!! We were visiting some friends in the area and the location was perfect. We booked a condo unit which gave us plenty of room, it was spacious, clean and the beds were so comfortable. The property was clean, well maintained and truly had a resort feel. The pool area and lazy river were ideal for a relaxing get away. There were more than enough sun chairs with umbrellas to relax in if the sun got too hot (which it did) The service staff were wonderful and helpful. We will make Squaw Peak our Hotel of choice every time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great time”
Reviews.Author: cotravel79
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights (Thur-Sun) at the resort with my 10 year old son. All in all, a very nice property with good value for the money. Obviously, being June in Phoenix with the average temperature over 100 degrees, not high season, although it seemed like there were a fair amount of people staying there. The rooms were nice, we had a basic suite with a living area and separate bedroom. The bedroom was a bit small but room enough with the LR area for us to spread out. Clean and pretty quiet. We paid $149/night which included $50/day in resort dining certificates. I looked at other options in Phx/Scottsdale for the same time and the Hilton was the best price for what we wanted to do. From an activity standpoint, the water park is pretty comprehensive. There are 2 decent size pools, each with a volleyball net. One pool has a waterfall which was kind of cool. The other was designated the "Sports Pool" and also had a basketball hoop. The lazy river was just fine as it was a perfect current for just lazing in a tube and floating along, I don't think it was designed with high speed rafting in mind. It did get somewhat crowded and there were always kids going by but that's who the resort caters to. The water slide left a lot to be desired, not very long and certainly not very steep (the first half of your ride you were just trying to get going). The putt-putt course was pretty boring if you compare it to miniature golf only properties but fun nonetheless and we weren't charged extra. Food was good. Lantana Grill was the only full service restaurant open while we were there (Hole in the Wall was closed for renovation which we didn't discover until we walked up to the door - no mention on the website which would have been nice). We ate all 3 meals there during our stay and all were excellent. We ordered lunch one day by the pool and it was OK - prices seemed high for what we got, especially the drinks but we did have our coupons. We played golf twice at the Tapatio Cliffs property (sister Hilton resort 10 minutes away) and it was a nice course, not too crowded and inexpensive (June in Phoenix). I saw on other reviews that the internet charge was out of line. I didn't have a laptop but agree that free internet seems to be the norm today. I did look into the business center when I wanted to go online to find out about a local attraction and they wanted something like $3/minute for internet access which was ridiculous. You can print boarding passes for free there though. Other than that, I think the resort is a great family getaway at a reasonable price. There are probably nicer places with upgraded amenities in the area, but you'll pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: golferperry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights after spending two nights in Sedona. They upgraded us to a two story "casita" with a bedroom upstairs, two bathrooms, a sun deck, covered parking, and a full kitchen. It was like staying in a condo. There was a peculiar smell when we checked into the room, but it went away. We think it may have been shampoo or some other type of cleaning solution on the carpet. The casita was huge and gave us room to spread out and relax. There is also a water park on the premises that my 10 year old really enjoyed. They had two large pools, a huge water slide, a "lazy river" where you could just float around on inner tubes, and a miniature golf course. The hotel was only a 2 or 3 mile drive to an area with lots of restaurants and shopping, and it was only about a 15 minute drive to the airport. We enjoyed our relaxing stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: xgoldie125x
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Squaw Peak over spring break. Everything about our entire stay was terrific. The pools are large with a lot of diversity of seating. The putt putt course was recently updated and fun for all. There are plenty of tennis courts and they were in fine shape. The work out facilities are first class and the price to use it and all other amenities was very reasonable ($2/day). We stayed in a Casita with 2 levels. The rooms were nicely appointed and reasonably quiet even over spring break. The concierge is the best in Phoenix. They were very helpful and provided excellent recommendations. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: tloneal
Reviews.Content: The rooms were wonderful, but what made the stay so memorable was the service. The staff could not have been more attentive and kind. There was both a wedding and a high school prom there and the staff treated everyone, including the high school students, as valued guests. It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here in September 2009 and had a really relaxing time. Hotel rooms are spacious and very clean. Staff at front desk and in restaurants are very friendly and efficient. There are numerous pools which is great as there is a pool area for adults which is nice and quiet away from the kids. Food in restaurant is good and hotel overall is good value for money. Fitness centre is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Not a good fit for us”
Reviews.Author: JPLboston
Reviews.Content: Was wowed by earlier reviews that this was a great place for families. I guess it all depends what your expectations are. We would have been better off at a more upscale resort in Scottsdale. This was a Hilton, nothing more. Lame water slide, lame lazy river, lame miniature golf. Cannot even imagine how unbearable this place would be if it were crowded. Dark, outdated 2BR casita. $555 was our bill for one night, including breakfast, which happened to be the highlight of our stay - wonderful waitress at Hole in the Wall. They did allow us to check in early. Tiny bedrooms. Thankful we were just there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: YVRfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from April 22nd to April 27th, 2010. The hotel is over 30 years old, but other than a few things it was hard to notice...I am not sure where the $20 million in upgrades were spent, as this is the first time I had stayed there. We decided to not rent a car on this trip, so took a cab from the airport and it was a short 15 minute drive directly north that cost about $34 there and flat fee $30 back. The staff at the Hilton were very accomodating from the moment we arrived, handling all our bags and taking us by electric car to our casita. Our room was two levels and had a kitchen area right in the entrance area, a large dining room and family room. Upstairs were a pair of queen beds and a fairly large tiled patio. On the hottest days, the patio surface was so hot that you must wear shoes or burn your feet. We loved the curtains in the upstairs area as they let us sleep in as late as we wanted, it made our room very dark. The casita that we were in had a terribly uncomfortable pullout queen bed downstairs, but two lush queen beds upstairs. Every time our next door neighbour took a shower the noise downstairs from the piping was loud, and there was not great sound proofing between rooms. The kitchen was not as expected. It contained a coffee maker, microwave and fridge/freezer. There was nothing as far as cutlery, plates, or dishes of any kind...making it very difficult to prepare anything. The fridge was old, the freezer area had a broken plastic door and barely kept the ice cream we purchased frozen. There was no toaster and we had to ask for a bottle opener. My wife decided to go out and purchase some food for lunches/breakfast and the bell hop (Reuben) was fantastic, driving her there in the hotel van (about 5 minutes away was a Fresh and Easy) and picking her up again in 20-30 minutes when she was finished...he drove her back to our casita and even helped her unpack the food. I had to go out to the local Basha's and purchase some mustard and dish washing detergent. It was about a 10 minute walk to both Basha's and Walgreen's. Also a short walk away was a great Italian restaurant (we had dinner there, great service and food), a Chinese restaurant, Gallagher's (a sports bar), Aunt Chilada's (mexican) and a pizza place. The main purpose for our stay was to entertain two boys, 7 and 4, that is why we selected this property. The hotel had lots of smaller pools in quiet areas, and an amazing water complex. This water complex kept our boys busy from early in the day until 5pm every day. They played basketball, mini golf, floated around the lazy river and played in lots of pools. There were lots of other children there of all ages and on the weekend there was quite a contingent of teenagers as well. We met a couple from Phoenix who had come there for a relaxing/romantic weekend to celebrate an anniversary, but that is not the way I would spend my anniversary. I think this hotel caters to kids and teenagers perfectly, but after 8pm when the pool area shuts down, the hotel becomes a bit of a ghost town. The hotel has started to charge for mini gold by instituting a $2.25 daily per room fee for using the mini golf, fitness center and a few other things. The lazy river is very lazy and it was hot, so it was a good way to stay cool. The hotel was totally packed on Saturday and Sunday and fairly quiet the other days, but at no time did we have any lineups. We also found chairs and loungers at all times of the day in contrast to some other reviews saying that people lined up at 8am and that there were never any chairs to sit on. The waterslide was good, but our 4 yr old missed being able to ride on it by about one inch in height. We did not bring a laptop, but the hotel did charge for high-speed internet (what a ripoff) and the business centre was well equipped but charged a steep fee for use. We dined at the Hole in the Wall restaurant for our first lunch and it was good but not outstanding. We dined at Lantana Grill for dinner twice and breakfast once. The breakfast was excellent, and the dinners were good....both dinners the place was almost deserted, one night because they had a free hoe-down (food included with your hotel stay). We also had dinner at Aunt Chiladas one night, it was busy and food was plentiful and affordable. We had a blown fuse incident one night, but the maintenance staff showed up very quickly and had it fixed just as fast. Every time we came across the staff they were always smiling and saying hello. We ordered a slush drink for the boys at Slim Pickins (poolside cafe), and were a little shocked to pay $6.50 ($7.50 after tip). Overall we loved the place and would go back again. It is great for families, and we saw many families there with parents and grandparents and groups of families too. Teens would love it there too, many of them in the lazy river, and sunning and chatting with friends and checking out the bikinis/bathing suits. We look forward to Hilton upgrading their kitchens from containing a fridge to a full on place with stove and dishes/cutlery - ot would be so much better with that one change.

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets”
Reviews.Author: mk2006_10
Reviews.Content: Brad and Taylor at the front desk were both very nice. Taylor was in training, however was already acting like a pro. As a Hilton honor Memeber they did not have an upgrade for me, however promised i would receive on on the third night in of my 7 night stay. Which they delivered. I received an upgrade to a Casita, also received additional breakfast coupons, which worked wonders at the Lantana Grill. My full Buffet breakfast average aprox $24 for 6 people each morning. (4 adults, 2 kids). Plenty of activities for everyone. The Kids loved the Lazy River, Waterslide, basketball, Tennis, Golf. I even found time to visit the Gym. I was concern it would be too crowded due to it being Spring Week vacation, however it was not, just enough crowd for the kids to enjoy playing with others and the others dont feel overwhelmed. Planning on making the Trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the water park”
Reviews.Author: momzilla66
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, girls 7 and 10 years old. My girls loved the water park, the water slide, (which was monitored by 2 staff members), the lazy river, and the main pool with the waterfalls. There are plenty of towels and lounge chairs. My girls loved the smoothies from the pool bar. The water park is clean and pretty nicely landscaped. They also enjoyed the northpointe pool, next to our room. We never had a bad meal at any of the restaurants. Reasonably priced meals, the breakfast buffet at Lantana grill (short walk from northpointe)was very good and the kids enjoyed ordering their own pancakes and special omelettes. The menus stayed the same but were consistently good everytime. The rooms were cleaned daily. The service was excellent. We wanted 2 full beds instead of a king bed, after one call the room was changed in 5 minutes and the staff moved all our bags and our refrig. was replaced after it broke within minutes of a phone call. The suite with 2 beds was plenty roomy for us, we had a sitting area for watching tv and eating snacks and also a balcony with table/chairs. However, if you want to do anything off of the resort you will need to drive, as there is nothing within walking distance. Scottsdale is a twenty miunte drive away, and is clean and fun, with pleny of shopping, art galleries, and places to eat, Some of the Phoenix neighborhoods close to the resort are questionable,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, small room...”
Reviews.Author: rfgolfer
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak during spring break with our small children. The resort is beautiful with eye-catching moutain views. The main pool was nice and it had a fun waterslide and a seemingly endless lazy river. There is plenty to do at the resort during the day. If you are looking for anything to do at night, you will have to leave the grounds. The pool closed every night at 8 PM (the hours are probably seasonal). This pretty much turned the resort into a ghost town at 8 PM. The room itself was pretty small. We had a standard suite which consisted of a sitting area with a sofa bed, bathroom, and bedroom. The space between the foot of the bed and the dresser was very small which made it seem like there was no room to even walk through the bedroom. The golf course is located at the sister facility (Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort) which is also in Phoenix. It was only about a 10 minute drive to get to the other resort. The course was nice and challenging. While we played golf, we put our little ones in the day camp offered at Squaw Peak. The staff was wonderful and the kids really enjoyed the camp. We were apprehensive because we have never utilized a camp at a hotel before. If you have similar feelings about doing this, put your mind at ease, the counselors there were great and trustworthy. As for the value, I cannot comment on the price of the room. We used Hilton Honors points for our stay so the room was free. All of the incidental costs that you incur during a stay like this (dining, snacks, etc.) seemed to be in line with a resort like this. Overall, I would say this was a nice place to stay and I would recommend it. Just be aware that the rooms are not spacious and the resort at this time of year, shuts down at around 8 PM. Other than that, we had absolutely no complaints about the resort or the service we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy for 3rd visit!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Squaw Peak. We are fairly picky travelers and don't have a single problem to report with this resort. I will say If you don't have kids I'd pick another place. Yes, the River Ranch was packed for Spring Break but what do you expect? Kids everywhere were very happy. Lots of activities to be a part of if your kids want. We'd arrive around 11 with no chairs available until about 4 but it was fine as we were in the water or golfing anyhow. We did go to the small pool by our Casita a couple times where there were chairs and no one else there. Very quiet if the Ranch is too busy for you. The staff was so friendly and helpful, we kept commenting about how nice they all were. We had lunch everyday at the pool and were really happy with the food. Actually better than the last time we were there. They had a movie night at the pool on Friday night that was fun for kids. Also a Family Fiesta night that had crafts, etc by the Coyote Camp. We stayed in a Casita for the first time and really liked it. Very quiet with the condo feel instead of a hotel room. It was very clean, we have no complaints. Dinner one night at the Hole in the wall restaurant by the pool. Just ok. Walked down to Aunt Chiladas which is consistently decent. We did get a ride from the hotel van which is really convenient just for a tip to the grocery store near by ( food is cheap in Phoenix, and grocery stores sell hard liquor that was also less), we had dinner one night at the Phoenix Grille which was delicious with great service, also pizza that was awesome at Spinatos.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Returning Guests...This Place Used to Be Much Better!”
Reviews.Author: GoingtoPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I certainly agree with many of the reviews below about the disapointment to our stay. We were here for 6 nights during Easter Week as well, and it was a mad house!! We have been coming for Spring Break to Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak for about 6 years, and it used to be terrific. That's why we keep coming back. Not this time! In order to get a lounge chair at the pool, you had to go down and get in line 45 minutes before it opened at 8 am. Then if you wanted to get morning coffee in the coffee shop, you got into another 30 minute line. Just forget about trying to get into the restaurants. Parking was next to impossible sometimes. The entire resort seemed to be understaffed, over-occupied and just in a state of complete chaos. (Although the front desk was always manned pretty well and friendly.) They advertise that they are "newly remodeled". Well, take it from folks that have been coming here for years...the rooms were not as spacious or clean as they used to be. They weren't horrible...they just used to be a lot better. They certainly are not up to par with what one expects from a Hilton resort. They remind me more of the quality you get at a Red Roof Inn. The bed we had was uneven, so we felt as though we were going to roll off to the right all night. That took some getting used to. The room next to us had a family of 8 people + a dog packed into it. The dog barked so much we ahd to call the front desk and have security sent. Overall, this was not the relaxing vacation we expected. It is now only an "OK" resort, and a bit like Disney where everything requires you to get in a line. We love visiting the Phoenix area in the Spring from our cold Upstate NY home, but our family discussed it, and we don't think we will be returning to the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak next year. We'll keep our eyse open for better reviews of other places here on Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “ok here goes!!”
Reviews.Author: toptotty66
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back. The hotel is located about 20 mins from phx Sky Harbour airport. Check in was very smooth and quick, staff very friendly. We stayed in a queen bed suite 2306 which was very clean and very comfortable. The living room area had a double pull out sofa bed which was very comfortable, then you walked through to the bathroom and a seperate wash basin area. The Queen bed was fab. The belcony overlooked a courtyard which held a wedding during our stay. the room had an empty fridge, a coffee machine (tea/coffee topped up daily) also 2 tvs which was handy The front of the room overlooked 1 of the smaller pools but it was 3/4ft-6ft and a little deep for my son. The Lazy river..... it was about a 5/10 min walk and if you did not queue up to get in from around 0730 then the chances of getting a sun lounger were very slim!! i was amazed to see a long queue at 0740 one morning. I had no problems taking in drinks and snacks, my son has lots of allergies so always take my own things. Food on the site was expensive and the portions were not huge. $3 for a small box cereal, $3 for 4 thin slices of bacon, £6 for an ice cream $4 for pancakes and they were the cheap items. soft drinks were £3 each. crazy golf was free and was fun. The lazy river was nice to go around but when it was busy it was busy!!! We hired a car from ALamo which was a lifesaver. we went shopping, to get food etc and did 345 miles in 8 days. there is a walgreens and bashers about a 5 min DRIVE from the hotel which sells everything from food to drinks/pharmacy/swimming stuff etc. there is also a subway /nail bar /mcdonalds. went to fashion square to the mall there but it was expensive so i found a good outlet mall called ARIZONA MILLS its about 25 min drive. The concierge team in the hotel are great and full of knowledge, wherever you want to go they wiull know about it and have directions for you, trust me the team are the best i have met. Also visited a cowboy themed restaurant rustlers rooste, sawdust on the floors cowboy band playing, huge ribs rattle snake is a must steaks etc... was about $78 for 2 adults 1 child. the beef ribs were eat as much as you want. walmart is open 24hours one on both ends of bethany home road, this was handy to stock up on breakfast bits and cold drinks, for the fridge in the room. The fridge did seem to freeze things it was a little tempremental at times. i would recommend taking plastic bowls for cereal. our stay was from the 04th-13th April and it was busy! i dont think i would stay during this period again. All of the hotel staff were very courtious and happy to help The hole in the wall needs to lower its prices. A car is a must really unless you like walking in the extreme heat. The shops are located on lots of little retail parks so you need to drive from 1 to the other. There is a cheescake factory about 20 mins away $6.95 for a slice. cigarettes were $5.99 for malboro light but dont forget to add tax. everything has tax added to it at the end of your bill, so dont forget that. Banks will not exchange currency unless you bank with them, we went to an amex travel center on 22nd street but the rate was $1.41 per £1 plus a $6 service charge. The hotel to my suprise offered us $1.52 per £1, the hotel gets its rate from XE which is a good convertor to use. Well i hope this review helps, feel free to contact me. enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “It went downhill from day one...”
Reviews.Author: ERSocialworker
Reviews.Content: My husband, two boys (ages 2 & 4) and I drove into Phoenix from L.A. to meet up with my in-laws from back east over their spring break. We were intending on staying only two nights. After a 7-hour drive to get to the hotel, I was told at check-in that they did not have any rooms left on the property & that we would have to stay at their sister property 10 minutes away. This is at 8:00 PM with two small children. Simultaneously, a woman was checking into the hotel next to me & they had her room - I don't get it. What I will say is they comped that night at the other hotel. But, honestly, I didn't care because we were there to hang out with family & the process of unloading everything out of the car, setting up the pack & play, then packing everything back into the car & driving back to the Squaw Peak the next morning was pure torture! When we checked back in the next morning, we were provided with two breakfast buffet vouchers, which was very nice & our room was ready early on. Unfortunately, the breakfast buffet was super greasy & not even my kids would eat the bacon. As other posters pointed out, the River Ranch was very, very crowded, although with two active boys, I didn't get to spend any time sitting down. I hate to say this because my best friend works for Hilton, but we have had nothing but negative experiences at the last two Hiltons we have stayed at. It's disappointing. My husband & I agreed that our Hilton days are over.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids But Not Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: pirk
Reviews.Content: This was our second spring break stay at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak and I have to say our first trip seemed perfect so expectations were high. I'll start with what was great... The room set up is IDEAL for a family of four with kids that are able to share the pull-out sofa (which by the way was the most comfortable pull-out bed I've EVER laid on!). We bought breakfast basics and utilized the mini-fridge. I recommend bringing a few plastic bowls, a cutting board and small knife from home and you're all set. The River Ranch water park is so fun for the kids. The activities they have scheduled for the kids happen every few hours and our kids loved it. The mini-golf course was super fun as well. The overall set-up and location of this hotel is pretty ideal if you ask me. You're close to so many things and we even did a great hike right from the resort. Here's what brought some disappointment... the front desk staff was less than stellar every time we dealt with them. After trying to get into our room for five minutes (no keys worked) I went down to the front desk to ask for help, which wasn't close by, and was informed that we were told the wrong room number. Oops. No apology. No "I'm sorry for the inconvenience" or anything. I wasn't looking for any sort of freebie but just a general recognition for the inconvenience this caused... not to mention the people we totally freaked out by trying over and over again to get into their room! The River Ranch, as fun as it is, was so crowded it was hard to relax. Come prepared to play "the game" if you come for spring break.... i.e. get up EARLY to get chairs. The RR opened at 8:00 a.m. and I went over at 7:30 a.m. (after hearing that you had to get their early to get chairs). I was the 50th person in line. Seriously. It was ridiculous but the alternative was to not have chairs there. There are signs that say you "must have someone stay with your reserved chairs at all times" but that was absolutely NOT the case. It also said "no outside food or drink allowed" and yet everyone had snacks. This totally wasn't a problem for me but it became a problem when my 11 year old daughter, who went back to the room to get a box of crackers to bring back to snack on, was turned away at the entrance. Someone told her she couldn't bring in outside food and she had to walk all the way back to the room to return the crackers. This made us pretty upset considering everywhere you look there are people eating "outside" snacks, making PB & J's, drinking coffees from Starbucks, etc. Really? You're going to pick on a little kid who doesn't know to "hide" her outside food when she walks in? Ridiculous. The food we did purchase that same day for lunch from the poolside menu was borderline unedible. We are not usually picky people. We're generally just so happy to be on vacation that not much bothers us but there was enough issues on this trip that I doubt we'll return to this location. We possibly could have had a random experience but service is everything these days. It doesn't go unnoticed by our family. Still... this is a great place to go with kids but have your expectations low as far as crowds go at Spring Break.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life. Avoid hotel at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: familyguyDetroit_MI
Reviews.Content: Just needed a quick night in a hotel after a week in Tucson. The website looked fine. I read some reviews on Trip advisor and they were fine. I got a 2 bedroom casita. It was fine too. Here is the problem. At 1:00 a.m. two security guards start banging on our door. Scared the you know what out of us. They said they didn't see us in the system and didn't know who was staying there. What was wrong with calling us? Or waiting until the morning? They got our name, called the front desk and found us in the system. No apologies or anything. My wife and I could not go back to sleep. We were scared and rattled by the experience. I had 3 kids in the room all woken by these guards. I found the manager the next morning and told him it was the worst experience I had ever had in a hotel. He offered me 50% off my room. I laughed and said I was not paying a dime for that experience. He said it was out of his hands and I had to talk to his manager. Whatever. The place is a joke and I would never stay there again. Oh yea, my kids tried out the pool and lazy river for an hour. They hated the slide and the lazy river for whatever that is worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: besttate
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the two bedroom villas. Perfect for us with two teenagers. We had plenty of room yet were together. The Hilton facilities were great, the teens loved the water park, mini golf, breakfast buffets and the workout facilities. The front desk was very helpful when we needed a doctor. Convenient to hiking and spring training parks. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but crowded”
Reviews.Author: DLH1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in early April during Spring break. Our room was a 1 bedroom suite in the North Pointe section on the 1st floor. The rooms have outside entries, so guests can see into your room if you have the curtains open. The bedroom had 2 queen-sized beds, and it was a tight fit. Also, the shower/tub/toilet room was also a tight fit. Otherwise, the room was fine -- enclosed patio, 2 tvs, mini fridge, coffee maker. We ate breakfast 2 times at the Starbucks/gift shop in the hotel lobby. The hotel should have designed separate entries for Starbucks and the gift shop because it was chaos. One morning we ate at the River Ranch and the food/service was fine except when I found out they offered a buffet but wasn't told about it and it wasn't listed on the menu. We ate dinner at both the Lantana Grille and River Ranch and didn't have to make reservations either night (Friday/Saturday). I guess everyone went into Phoenix to eat!? Because of spring break, it appeared that the hotel was full. It was very difficult to find chairs at the River Ranch at around 11 am. The lazy river was VERY lazy. The mini golf was an extra expense. On the 2nd afternoon we were tired of the noise and crowds and went to the North Pointe pool. Except for the limited spaces in the sun, it was a more pleasant afternoon than the River Ranch. They offer limited food choices, but we were served quickly; as opposed to the food service at the River Ranch. There was daytime and nightly enterainment (for kids) offered af the River Ranch. Also, because it was Easter weekend, they provided free activities for the kids (picture with Easter bunny, sand art, cookie decorating). It's a nice place, but doesn't appear able to handle crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sagnam
Reviews.Content: My family spend 4 days of our Spring Break at the Squaw Peak Resort. We really enjoyed the Resort. The Water Park opened at 8am which is good for those of us that are early risers. It was well maintained and the staff was courteous. I enjoyed playing Lookout Mountain and my sons played the Miniature Golf Course 20+ times. The Hole in the Wall staff was nice enough to change their TV's so we could watch the NCAA games on Saturday night; Aunt Chilada's did the same on Monday. My only complaint would be that we checked in extremely late and were given a Single King Suite instead of a Double Queen Suite. I was told there were no more available but that I would be contacted the next day about changing rooms. I never got a call although when I called the Lobby late in the afternoon they did make the room change. I never really got a call to apologize from anyone. We liked the location as well for hiking Squaw Peak and Camelback, dinner in Carefree, and quick access to the interstate. We did stay at the Arizona Grand the remaining part of the week. VERY similar set up but I would give the Hilton the slight edge despite the rooms being slightly smaller. The Water Park opened 2 hours earlier, enjoyed the resort restaurants more, and the grounds were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A Tad Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: seanandshawn
Reviews.Content: We went to the Pointe for spring break and it was at full capacity, which is great for the hotel, but we felt that there just wasn't enough staff. It seemed as though we were always waiting in line, and there were just too many people for us. We waited at check in, breakfast at the hole in the wall, breakfast at Lantana, to get into the pool, to speak with the (wonderful) concierge, it seemed everywhere on the premises! Our check in was less than stellar and I think that started the vacation off in a bad way. My husband is a diamond member, yet we still waited over 30 minutes to check in. It was so busy. With his status we were not upgraded, which was fine it was spring break, but the desk worker was rude, and gave my husband major attitude when he asked if they had any openings during our visit if he could be called. We weren't given the proper # of meal ticket (gets with his upgraded status) and the list goes on... We only found one nice person at the front desk late one evening. The hotel makes the extra perks that diamond status gives very difficult. If you want your free bottles of water hike out to the gift shop near river ranch. Your free breakfast vouchers can be redeemed only at the gift shop in the main lobby which had a slim selection of crummy pastries. But for an extra $7 you can again hike to the Lantana grill wait in line for the overpriced buffet then miss out on getting a sun lounger unless you are up super early which isn't fun on vacation. We were in a standard room in the south tower which was adequate and clean. It reminded me of a upgraded Embassy Suites. The room was very humid and hot whenever we re-entered... Beds and linens were clean and comfortable and my son said the pull out was comfortable. The bathroom layout is a little funky with the toilet/bathtub area being super small, but it wasn't a problem. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained, and the cleaning staff were friendly, but most days our room wasn't cleaned till after 4:00. The river ranch was fun, but way too crowded! I had to see 3-4 verbal fights over saved lounge chairs. People were getting up super early to reserve seats, and by 930 you couldn't find a seat. The spa and pools were crowded with so many people and by the end of the day the water was green with half of inch of sunscreen, yuck! The lazy river was super busy as and many times I felt it was like bumper boats. River ranch food was overpriced for what you got, and I saw many families bringing in outside food (supposedly not allowed.) The children's activities for spring break were fun and my son enjoyed those. My son attended Coyote kids club for one day and truly LOVED it. It was the highlight of his trip! Although the cost was slightly steep the teachers were fantastic, and he made amazing art projects and had alot of fun. I highly recommend it! To sum it up my son had a fun trip, but the crowds, wait times, and service weren't my cup of tea, and we won't likely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for families!”
Reviews.Author: Megalematt
Reviews.Content: Just completed a Spring Break stay with our four children in one of the Squaw Peak casitas and it was terrific! Good assortment of activities within the resort itself, and an easy highway pickup for trips to the golf course, shopping, downtown etc. Piestewa Peak was a good sunset hike and the trail head was readily accessible near the resort. Pool staff kept the kids hopping with fun events. House staff took care of any requests swiftly. Our casita was maintained daily to a high standard. Nice stay and a good value when compared to other 'resorts' in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area.

Reviews.Title: “Great to see the refurbishments....Wonderful Staff.....”
Reviews.Author: ConnieFrance
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip to The Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak which is one of Phoenix’s most iconic hotels and Hilton's have done a wonderful job in restoring the resort. I stayed for a few nights with the kids and our experience could not have been more enchanted. The location has always been beyond perfect, but the refurbishment that has been brought to the garden spaces, River Ranch and rooms is a great success. I very much enjoyed the classic yet contemporary feel in the rooms and was impressed with how the bathrooms had been reconfigured. The lobby atmosphere is lovely and only improved by the very charming staff that you come across throughout the hotel. A particular mention must go to the best concierge ever! Eric Sofield, Chef Concierge made our stay dreamy. His knowledge of the resort, the area and the southwest is expansive. Nothing was too tall for him fill and his professionalism is an asset to the Pointe. I also shouldn't forget to say that the Lantana Grill and the Hole in the Wall were pleasant and a good value. Overall, I hope Pointe Hilton maintains the impressive efforts currently in place; if so the Pointe Hilton will be my only choice in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Dessert paradise”
Reviews.Author: Sunbum11
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay at this Hilton and we loved it! This is a family resort with plenty of children so it was somewhat loud but to me that makes for an electric atmosphere. Very active, great pools, great food, great bars! We were extremely satisfied. The staff was excellent. Me and my girlfriend got engaged on our trip, it was wonderful. I wanted to propose on top of a mountain which I did, she said yes! With the advice from the concierge we climbed Squaw Peak, it was beautiful. She was completely surprised, a moment we'll remember the rest of our lives. The only disappointment would be is that I hoped the hotel would have surprised us with a bottle of champagne or some flowers back at our room. That would have been a nice touch! I must say all the employees were awesome thats why I'm surprised that we didn't receive a small but romantic gift. We would stay at this resort again, perhaps on our anniversary, maybe they'll remember a bottle this time. Almost forgot, no service on cell phones at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: MemorySaver
Reviews.Content: We spent the week at the end of March. What a great experience. We got a one bedroom suite at the South Pointe complex. We were able to check in early and had an excellent location. While the River Ranch water park was lots of fun for the kids (age 6 and 10), we all did enjoy the hotel pool as well. The River Ranch was busy, but we enjoyed the Lazy River, the mini-golf, the water slide and the waterfall. When we got tired of the noise and bustle of the water park, we hung out at the hotel pool. Very nice. Rooms were older, but clean and slept 3 adults and 2 kids easily. Had a problem with our air conditioning the first night, and they sent a technician to repair it in 15 minutes. Terrific service throughout the resort - everyone was friendly and helpful. Only downside was the expensive food. The restaurants were mediocre, but pricey. Made sense to leave the resort to eat especially with the picky eater kids. Would definitely go back. We all had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel we better work on the food”
Reviews.Author: 7and8
Reviews.Content: The hotels was great from the room to the attraction for the kids. But fo the Price the food was not up to par at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: mertle1257
Reviews.Content: My wife and I cannot express how helpful Carol Dixon the concierge was in making our 25th anniversary a success. Thanks to Carol's advice on restaurant selections we were able to have delicious and different types of meals every night we stayed in Phoenix. She also helped us deal with the rain (it never rains in Phoenix, except when we were there) by suggesting quite a few indoor attractions and all were interesting and enlightening. The accommodations were clean, spacious and well thought out. We chose the breakfast plan and the breakfast buffet had a chef that would make eggs and omelets to order and also fresh pancakes, french toast and waffles. There were some regional choices from the buffet line and also fresh fruit, etc. My wife and I both had different spa treatments and the staff was very courteous and professional. The exercise facility was clean and served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break Family Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: CubsFann44
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for the 2nd year in a row over Spring Break. If you kids love swimming, this is the place. There is a variety of things to do including the lazy river, several pool and a sports pool. We upgraded this year to a 1 bedroom Casita and it was totally worth it! With the extra space, semi private pool, full size fridge you will save the difference in your meals alone (provided you eat meal leftovers and a breakfast or two in your room). Location of the resort is ok (not great). Staff is excellent and the grounds are nice. Our biggest gripe is that we felt nickled and dimed to death in meals/drinks (they were expensive and no deals). Pool side meals were pricey and ice cream was like $5 for a big cone. The $2 per day for Spa and Mini golf is a good deal, internet room charges were a joke and should be free. Overall, a very good choice for a family vacation! I recommend checking out Cracker Jacks for the kids, Don and Charlies restaurant, and Aunt Chiladas Mexican...also Latana Grill in Squaw Peak.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: slkn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week in the middle of March. The grounds were very pretty and the pool activities were wonderful. The pool is heated (including the lazy river) so that area can be used even if the weather is a little cooler. The staff was very friendly, from check in to the staff in the pool area. The concierge staff is the best and top notch. David Richardson , chef concierge, is probably the best concierge I have ever met. He is very helpful, diligent, knowledgeable, and always has a smile on his face. My kids still ask about him and he has made our trip very memorable. I am going to use him even for my other trips!! Thanks for a wonderful and unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “What an odd place”
Reviews.Author: MFLetou
Reviews.Content: Really a strange place. Almost like a condo complex that was converted. Rather spread out, with fairly old buildings. Broken into "casitas" and suites--everything is a suite. Geared toward families, with a waterpark that apparently you have to pay for. I was here on business for one night--so I didn't explore many of the resort amenities. The room itself was of average quality but was quite large. A sitting room up front, then the bathroom, then the bedroom. Wallpaper was really old. Standard CRT tvs. LOTS of work space, a comfy couch and sitting area. Relatively clean. Somewhat noisy--and for some reason, they decided to CLEAN the room next to me...at 1 AM. Beats me. Several restaurants on the property but I walked to a strip mall next door and got a snack there as the hotel restaurants were about to close (rather early, for a resort at least.) Oddly situated in Phoenix...not on a Peak, that's for sure, but rather in a commercialish area. Not a bad area--just north of the Biltmore, but not centrally located at all. I suppose if you need to go to Phoenix and want a kid friendly place, this would be an excellent choice, and rather affordable, at least off-season. Once again with Hilton--they charge for internet access at the business center. Lame.

Reviews.Title: “A very happy and relaxing vacation.”
Reviews.Author: CP_H_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite which was very clean and comfortable. My sister and her family had an adjoining suite (arranged by the hotel in advance) and together our families had a lot of space. The hotel staff were very friendly, and the hotel layout and facilities were much better than I had expected. The Resort facilities were fantastic and a real pleasure to use. We used the tennis, mini-golf, lazy river and regular pool - all good! The 'casita village' looked like a lovely place to stay, that's something to try on another trip. In summary, we all had a brilliant vacation and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spring Break Yet”
Reviews.Author: COOMomKansasCity
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton at Squaw Peak proved to be a great destination for spring break. Fabulous location in Phoenix with an array of onsite activities - waterpark, mini golf, hiking trails, kids camp and much more. Short drive to most spring training ball parks and a wonderful concierge who was spot on with restaurant recommendations nearby the hotel. We'll definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and resort”
Reviews.Author: Delta111
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Hotel with lots to do. Clean rooms, spacious, quiet and great pool and activity resort. If you like you would not need to leave the resort, it has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break Family Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: DMDKansasCity
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent place to stay with a family. The River Ranch, on property restaurants, sightseeing tours that departed from resort and proximity to Baseball Spring Training ball parks made for a very enjoyable vacation. Carol and David at the concierge desk were so helpful and kind. The cleaning staff were also just full of smiles and warm greetings throughout our stay. The only area of improvement would be organization. A couple times at on property restaurtants and then the front desk (using Hilton Honors Points for part of our stay) things didn't go as smoothly as they could have but that won't keep us from returning! We are already talking about a return to this same resort for our Spring Break next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but everything at the resort is expensive”
Reviews.Author: ShazamDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with wife and 4 kids. All facilities were clean and the staff was very friendly. The pool near our room was nice and not too crowded. The main pool near the silde and lazy river was a bit crowded, as was the lazy river. The Phoenix mountains park is very close, can jog there easily and there are good trails for running. Had a problem with the air conditioner in our suite - called for service and no one showed up. Called again the next day and it was fixed, but it would not automatically regulate the temperature even with a 75 degree setting. So it was too hot or too cold - but you can just turn off the air conditioner when it gets too cold. Prices at the resort are pretty expensive so you may want to go "off campus" for food and drink. A few examples: One domestic beer: $6 Frozen margarita in plastic cup: $7 Ice cream cone with one scoop: $6 Half rack of ribs: $24 Business Center: $12 for a 10-page B&W printout Off campus, I would highly recommend The (Pizza) Parlor; San Gabriel mexican restaurant (just down 16th street), and the Streets of New York (delivery pizza). There is also a McDonalds close by. I will say the food at the resort was vey good, especially the breakfast buffet. All in all, a great resort, but watch those hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: luv2_teachMissouri
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak is a great place to vacation with kids. We were there for a spring break week, and were pleasantly surprised that even in a resort filled with kids, it was a very relaxing trip for the adults too. Everyone who works there was very friendly and accommodating, and there are lots of different activities to choose from to keep kids busy. When we arrived on a Friday night, we had a delicious dinner at the Lantana Grille and then walked over to the River Ranch where a kids' movie was being shown. We enjoyed playing the 18-hole miniature golf course that lined the banks of the lazy river, and the kids' activities at the pool every hour during the afternoons were well done. There are so many lounge chairs around the various pools that there was never a problem finding a couple of chairs together no matter what time you ventured to the pool area. The pools at the North Pointe and South Pointe buildings were a quiet respite when wanting a change from the River Ranch's active environment. One thing I really liked was that the resort fee was optional and really very small (less than $3 a day) and you could add it on any day during your stay if you decided to take advantage of things like golf, tennis, or the fitness center (which was very well equipped). The breakfast buffet at the Hole in the Wall was delicious and a good deal, as was the weekend barbecue buffet at the pool. Menu items at the Slim Pickens poolside bar were very good, with generous portions, and the poolside waiters were friendly and prompt. The bar and grille across the street (Gallagher's) was nice for a relaxed dinner, and had so may flatscreen TVs it would be impossible to miss any of your favorite sports. The mexican restaurant just off the property (Aunt Chilada's) had excellent food - loved the unusual chips and salsa. We only ate at the Lantana breakfast buffet once, and although it was good, the line was too long to wait for the one cook who was doing all the made-to-order food. The concierge staff was quite helpful; we enjoyed a great horseback ride at Cave Creek thanks to their suggestion. Even the bellman gave us tips on things to do while there at the hotel. The property is clearly older, but well maintained. It has the feel of an apartment or condo complex more than a hotel. We stayed in a standard suite with a king bed and a queen sleeper sofa. There was plenty of room for clothes in the large dresser and big closet (with plenty of hangers, which is a nice change from the usual hotel stay.) A refrigerator was available to hold all sorts of drinks and leftovers. And having two TVs was really a plus. Overall, this was a wonderful family place to stay, and I'd definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: bostock22
Reviews.Content: Overall the resort is great. All the staff we encountered were very very nice and accommodating and went above and beyond. They definitely have the "kid friendly" thing down. The family pool is fabulous, especially the shallow end that starts @ 2' and goes to 3.5'. Pool-side food/drink service is prompt and very friendly and the hotel restaurants are fairly good deals, considering they are at a resort. The grounds are nicely maintained and clean. Our only complaint would be the accommodations. We were in a casita and we found it to be very dark ,depressing and outdated, with only one window that opened. The couches in the living room are incredibly uncomfortable and for our taste, the bed was too soft. The bathroom could also use a little TLC as the paint was peeling and there were the beginnings of mildew. Probably the biggest disappointment was the kitchenette. There was a decent size fridge, but it barely kept anything cold, much less frozen. There is also only a microwave, no toaster etc. One last suggestion for management, if you want people to re-use their towels, you need to provide hooks where they can be hung to dry. One hook for a casita that sleeps 4 won't cut it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly family hotel”
Reviews.Author: beentheretoo70
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. Everything was excellent from the warm welcome that we recieved, (on a very stormy night), at reception to the service from all the staff at both restuarants and the 'guys' at River Ranch, nothing seemed to much trouble. David (chief concierge) was extra friendly and helpful with ideas of what to see and do everyday and how to get there. The rooms were great for a family with 2, very comfortable, queen sized beds, a dressing area & bathroom (not a full sized bath), and a spacious living area. 2 TV's, so no arguing over kids tv or grown ups tv!! The food in both restuarants was surprisingly good, not your usual mega plates full of meat and fries that I have often found in the U.S. The portions were more than ample but not HUGE. The kids (aged 7 & 8) loved the pool and could safely go round the lazy river and down the waterslide. The crazy golf was fun and ice creams delicious! Overall an excellent hotel, and we would deffinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would have no problem with recommending this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prairie_Pete
Reviews.Content: Went out to Phoenix to catch a bit of winter sun with British Airways holidays. After reading a few negative reviews I didn't really know what to expect, but as it turned out I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel and facilities were well maintained and clean. The staff were pleasant and helpful. It was great to have a choice of pools - the quiet ones to chill and read, or the 'River Ranch' to have some fun. Our deal included breakfast so most mornings we strolled along to the 'Hole in the wall' which served a selection of mainly egg based dishes or alternatively, a continental option - special thanks to 'Arizona Slim' who made us feel welcome, looked after us and gave us information about local attractions. The resort has a well equipped gym and we were allowed to use the business center to 'check-in' our flights the night before our departure. There are nice flowerbeds around the hotel where we saw hummingbirds getting nectar from the blossoms ! I would say the rooms were a bit better than the average American hotel room in a hotel of this age - nothing super special, but adequately equipped, comfortable and clean. It is so nice to look back now at our stay, and have no 'yeah-buts' or annoyances to ruin our memories. A perfect break.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: sevensisters1
Reviews.Content: I wish to recognize the efforts of resort staff, particularly David Richardson in making our trip a memorable one. No matter what we asked they were there to assist and make our visit "the very best" ! We are a group of sisters including their mother who is quite easy to please, but we were highly impressed with the resort and its surroundings. The service was exemplary. Thanks to you all. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Relaxing vacation--exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: seekingcom4t
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this resort February 13-21, 2010. Absolutely loved it. We were greeted by David Richardson at check in. Cannot say enough about his outstanding customer service. David placed us in room 2333 a "purified" room. Few more words about David--Awesome, friendly, tuned in to the customer seeking a great stay. Hilton folks: this guy is a jewel ! This room was a king suite. It was the best. Centrally located with easy access to everything at the resort. The layout was excellent. Impeccably clean, (Maria does a great job). There was a spacious living area which included a comfy sofa, oversized side chair, office desk/chair area, TV and wet bar area. The wet bar area had a mini fridge and granite counter tops which held the coffee maker etc. There is a central area between the living space and bedroom which houses the bath and sink/dressing area. This room is separated by double doors--nice touch. The king bedroom is off the bath area separated by a pocket door--love that feature and here's why: I could have privacy later in the evening with full access to the bed and bath area while my husband visited with a family member/guest out in the living area. Hilton thought of everything!! The king bead was comfy, lined with pillows. The room had it's own TV as well. Off the King room was a lovely private balcony. My husband & I brewed hot tea and sat on the balcony every morning with the USA Today paper that was delivered to our doorstep.--Great way to start a day--relaxing. There were waterfalls outside our balcony both in the front and in the back. In the evenings we would leave our bedroom patio door open using only the screen and the sound of the falls really adds to the relaxed mood even more--sweet touch. Highly recommend this room :) Brad Wills in Shipping Dept is one other person to mention. Brad is fantastic. He will help you with any shipping needs during your stay. He is very friendly and goes out of his way to ensure excellent quality service. He has soome great stories too :) The resort: the lazy river is the best thing this resort has going for it. Absolutely LOVED it. The river winds around the water park area and a leisurely pace. Water temp is just perfect. You can stay on it as long as you like. The blue tubes are the most comfy. One thing is for sure--you will NEVER have a problem finding a lounger chair. Tons of them everywhere and nicely placed--not too crowded. The quality of the outdoor furnishings exceeded my expectations. Beautiful designs/textures. They provided extra thick lounge cushions making it very easy to fall asleep while sunning--again, relaxing. Pool towels were provided in abundance--as many as you needed or liked. I like extra so that was sweet. They have servers from the bar/restaurant area should you desire refreshments delivered right to your chair--Hi Jessie!--she was great. This resort has very nice landscaping, lots of greenery, sort of surprising and again exceeded my expectations. Restaurant called "Hole in the Wall" has a daily happy hour 4-6. Order the veggie sandwich and sweet potato fries--awesome. They also have Blue Moon beer on tap served with the signature orange slice and it goes great with the sandwich. The Hole in the Wall has a fabulous outdoor patio with a fireside pit area--very nice. We tried the other restaurant and ordered salads--just okay. Walk outside the front of the resort turn left and follow the chili peppers painted on the side walk about 1-2 blocks. This leads you to the GREATEST Mexican food restaurant called "Aunt Chiladas". This is an old historical structure and has a fantastic outdoor patio seating area. The food is great and reasonably priced. Please go--trust me, you will not regret it. I wish we had found it sooner because we would have been frequent visitors :) We have stayed at many 4-5 star resorts and this one ranks right there with them. We will definitely return again. If you go, be sure to say "hi" to David Richardson at the front desk and Brad Wills in Shipping, they are a couple of great employees and will add to your stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: dglbltrvlr
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond HH member and was upgraded to an Ambassdor suite. Room was spacious but carpeting was threadbare and ripping in places. Pool area was nice and lazy river is great for relaxation. We like to play tennis but tennis courts here are ful of bumps and cracks. After a multi-million dollar renovation, I would have expected much better in these areas!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: Fischerpa
Reviews.Content: We booked here because they have "kitchenettes " but that only means a microwave and fridge. The rooms are spacious andclean if a little worn out. Also they allow dogs in the mini pools on the property which was a big turn off for my family...especially since my son is allergic.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LizaK1
Reviews.Content: this trip was actually a few yrs back. The service was impeccible, first class all the way! Pool everywhere. Bars, people to help you wherever you are!

Reviews.Title: “In one word....FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: dtcunni
Reviews.Content: This trip started well and ended even better! I traveled with my girlfriend and we were never bored at the resort! The pool is awesome, the hot tub was perfece, and the lazy river was really fun! As it was almost the end of February and still a lilttle chilly, the water war heated and the staff was really personable to EVERYONE! If you have a chance and the means to do so, I recommend reserving of the the two story casitas...you"ll be glad you did! Furthermore, I forgot his name, but he is the Chief Concierge and what a great fit for someone in the hospitality industry! I will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: cacosta
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay in a "casita" at Squaw Peak and I would recommend it to everyone. The location was convenient to Phoenix and Scottsdale. The grounds were beautiful, the hotel staff was very gracious. Rooms were bright and clean. Most importantly (to me) the hotel is pet friendly. Wish I could have spent more time exploring everything the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “CONCIERGE DAVID RICHARDSON HELPS TO SET THIS RESORT APART FROM THE REST!”
Reviews.Author: GuestChicago_IL
