Reviews.Content: We visited Phoenix with our two young children, and stayed at this property for the first time. Everything about it was great for kids - from the roomy accomodations to the fantastic waterpark to the state-of-the-art fitness center to the kid-friendly dining choices. However there was one thing that really made our stay exceptional: the head concierge David Richardson. I travel for business and have stayed in over 150 Hilton properties and dozens of other 5-Star Hotels around the world. I have never come across a person that could single-handedly help to make a stay so perfect. His "can-do" approach to his genuine concern that your stay is exceptional will make you want to extend your reservation. I have never written a tripadvisor review before, and I was compelled to due to the OUTSTANDING service from a very special concierge.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional (outstanding actually) customer service”
Reviews.Author: JSMass
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 3141 (a Casita). It was very tiny, but nicely outfitted. Great bed, sheets and pillows. The bathroom was poorly constructed (nothing to do with the hotel or overall stay - they just got ripped off by the contractors apparently, sloppy grout work, old tub - not very upscale) but functional. The BEST part of our stay was the staff. Extremely helpful. On one of the rainy days we had we had a limo provided (no charge!) to take us shopping in Scottsdale. I left my prescription sun glasses in another limo taking us to dinner - the hotel put them in a UPS package after I left them behind. Everyone was always waving, saying hi (without being in your face or insincere about it) - just making us feel good about staying on the property. The food - lacking - greatly. Although once again, everyone was willing to try to work with the kitchen to get us something we liked.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for kids and hiking.”
Reviews.Author: mcadoug
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. I stayed there for February break with my husband and two young boys. The pool and slide are great - the lazy river is very lazy (slow moving) and while we were on it, there was a group of rowdy teens in it. More supervision was needed. Our biggest disappointment was that the swim up pool bar in North Pointe was closed, although the pool in North Pointe was gorgeous. We requested a centrally located room due to my son's disability and thats what we got. The breakfast buffet at the Lantana was wonderful as were all the servers. The concierge David was very accomodating. He set us up with a desert hummer tour with roadrunner and Steve was excellent. A little pricey but well worth it for the experience of a lifetime. My favorite part of this resort had to be the fact that you could access the South Mountain preserve on foot from the resort. We hiked every morning and it was beautiful. We were also able to walk to Aunt chelada's restaurant down the block for a great affordable dinner. Scottsdale is nearby and well worth the trip to shop at Old Scottsdale. The Heard Museum was amazing. This hotel has a close proximity to everything, even the Botanical gardens which should not be missed. We also took advantage of the hiking near to the gardens at papago park. Breathtaking scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Why go anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Sunshine9
Reviews.Content: Our family recently visited the Phoenix area and spent 3 nights at the Pointe Hilton- Squaw Peak. We have stayed here many times over the years and continue to come back to this wonderful and relaxing resort. The staff and the accommodations were terrific. The River Ranch is a great place to hang out with the family while relaxing by the pool side and the lazy river. We were especially pleased with the new and improved river ranch. We love the new decking on the upper lazy river terrace and the padded cushion lounges added a nice touch. Why spend all the money to travel to a tropical island resort ? You can experience that true resort feeling under the warm skies and palm trees of Arizona at the base of these beautiful desert mountains of Squaw Peak. While the rest of the country was experiencing cold temps and snow...we were basking in 75 degree temps under bright sunny skies during mid February. It was awesome! It should be noted...you can't beat the central location to downtown either...particularly if you love sports like we do and want to catch an Arizona Diamondbacks or Phoenix Suns game. We had a wonderful time once again...and look forward already to our next visit. You will not regret your visit to Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak. Why go anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Fun Resort for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: DBacks_Girl
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been visiting the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort at various times of the year for the past 10 years. We have always found the hotel staff to be professional and very helpful with all of our needs. The accommodations are suberb whether we are staying in a standard suite, ambassador suite or a casita. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. We love spending time at the River Ranch, floating down the Lazy River or just laying on a lounge chair enjoying one of Slim Pickens many tropical drinks. The pools and water slide at the River Ranch provide kids with so much enjoyment and entertainment. The feeling of relaxation we get when visiting Point Hilton Squaw Peak Resort is second to none. We love the views of the mountains and the property is beautiful at night all lit up. We have eaten at the Hole in the Wall and Lantana Grill many times and find both to offer good menus. It doesn’t seem to matter what time of year we visit Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort, we always enjoy the atmosphere and service. We hope to visit Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort many more times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: daoco11
Reviews.Content: The place is just so accommodating. Great rooms , great weather , great service. Ask for David he is the King of service!

Reviews.Title: “quaint, warm and very comfortable...and so is the staff!”
Reviews.Author: SakeTravels
Reviews.Content: very nicely laid out. teh staff were very accomodating. it is also conveniently located close to freeways without being near enough for the noise. it is a great place for business adn vacations. also, it is near by to some world-reknown hiking trails. Camel back for one.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: augmar02
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been spending a week at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort for the last 6 years. We like to go in December or January to escape the winter in Colorado. We love the pools, lazy river,miniature golf, and restaurants. We always begin our trip by contacting David Richardson the Chef Concierge at the property. David helps us locate the best type of room for our family of four and always presents us with a list of activities on the property during our stay. The moment we arrive we are treated like VIPs. David provides a list of area restaurants and community activities in addition to the activity list on the property. He knows our family enjoys hiking, and always picks out a new trail with directions for us to explore. Visiting the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort is always the highlight of our winter.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OhioCH47
Reviews.Content: A full service hotel/resort. All employees were very nice and helpful. Good restaurants within walking distance. Starbucks on location that opened up at 0600 was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasure to stay in a hotel where staff treat each other with the same courtesy and respect as guests.”
Reviews.Author: desimport
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively, for business purposes, and attending conferences and seminars in facilities that provided good food, nice rooms and business service support, it is easy to take it for granted. When you combine that with polite, responsive, courteous employees that enjoy working with each other, the long days, the hassles of travel, and all the effort that goes into working at the same time just disappears, as you feel you are among friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: famof5Manitoba
Reviews.Content: A great place to take a young family as there is lots to do to keep them occupied - although they could have stayed in the River Ranch all day everyday of our holiday! Great mini golf course that surrounds the lazy river. The staff is very friendly- especially the waitresses in the Hole in the Wall. The food was very good as well - we would recommend the Hole in the Wall for their wings and Aunt Chiladas for Mexican. The beds are very comfy, although a 2 Queen bed Suite is a little small for a family of 5, i would go with a Casita on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, close downtown loction but beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: DenverH2oski
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location many times. Both for business and pleasure. Staff has always been super helpful often taking extra time and efforts to make sure I am comfortable. The location is close to downtown for business and still has a resort feel. I can stay at any location in Phoenix that I want but I chose this even if it means I have to travel a bit further for business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service that went way beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: CarryonBaggage
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay for 2 nights at the Point Hilton Squaw Peak Resort. I was relocated to another Hilton hotel due to maintenance issues with some of the rooms. There are several reasons why the service was extraordinary. First thing was that I was contacted by David Richardson (chief concierge) before I left for my trip. He explained the situation so I would not be surprised when I arrived. He gave me instructions of who to call when I arrived since the hotel was going to take care of my taxi ride from the airport to the hotel. This was all coordinated beautifully and I did not have to explain anything. Then I was given vouchers for 2 free breakfasts to compensate for the inconvenience of the change in hotels. There was also shuttle service between the two hotels since I needed to be at meetings at the hotel that I originally booked so the inconvenience was minimal. The most extraordinary thing was when I got my bill and my 2 nights were paid for by the Squaw Peak Resort. I never expected this and it is a credit to David Richardson and the Squaw Peak Resort since the best judge of extraordinary service is when things go wrong and they are taken care of so promptly and thoroughly. I am a frequent business traveler and never have experienced this level of fantastic service and attention.

Reviews.Title: “The highs! The lows! The drama! The coyote!”
Reviews.Author: AZMooshie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night w. friends visiting from Chicago, during--literally--worst storm in 100 years of Phoenix's history. Hotel overbooked; we were upgraded from reserved 2-bdrm casita to the Palacio, a "secret" 3-bdrm/2-bath guest house on the resort (but way up a mountain) that's owned by developer. True house--big place, 2-car garage, gorgeous sweeping views of city/mountains on one side, but the house is cut into mountain so no view on one other side plus the rain just poured in there. Kitchen flooded. Ditto super-cheesy sunken firepit area in family room. Still, lots of space, private hot tub, fab views. Decor is early '90s bare-bones corporate hotel (think Oakwood apts). Shower head is 4 feet ground, so anybody over 5'2 has a not so fun time in the shower. As an upgrade, the place was amazing, but to rent? At $2k-$3k per night? Ridiculous. No way. However, entire resort staff could not have been more gracious or accommodating, even when we accidentally locked ourselves out of the house and trudged (through pouring rain and 70-mph-winds) to the restaurant (about 1/4 mile away) to be saved. Narrow road up mountain to house; staff takes you there in a golf cart or van. Awoke in a.m. to find bedraggled, water-soaked coyote trying to make his way up the mountain from our patio. Somehow grand, yet pathetic/sad at the same time. Kind of the perfect metaphor for the whole stay. Dinner at Hole in the Wall; decent appetizers (potato skins; deep-fried Southwest "spring rolls") but entrees (filet mignon; ribeye; chicken-fried elk) were pretty bad, as in "probably frozen/microwaved." Margarita seemed watered-down, but kicked my butt. Brunch at Lantana--your basic "business hotel" buffet, ugh. This place is perhaps best known for its water park, which we clearly did not take advantage of on accounta, you know, the tornado warning and all, so no comments about that. Staff was super gracious, but I really don't think I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Squaw Peak is a very nice resort, with exciting things for the kids and relaxing for adults.”
Reviews.Author: familylovestogo
Reviews.Content: The room was nice for a family of four. It had 2 comfortable beds and a pull out couch. The location was easy to find from the airport and easy to get around the city. We all loved the amenities with the lazy river, pools, restaurants, gift shop (we utilized for breakfast, great selection) and business center.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: I was recently at this Hilton resort property where not only was the front desk staff inept and rude, but the housekeeping staff seems asleep as well. I had booked/requested a non-smoking king and was provided with a smoking room after a nice long hike to the room (resort property and all). After phoning to the front desk I was told there was no non-smoking kings available which begs the question, why not tell me that as I am checking in. A non smoker will always take a different bed/room option that stay in the stench of a smoking room. After almost an hour of waiting for the new room keys, I entered the new queen bed room to find the shower moldy and filthy (attached picture) and worrying about what would be ending up on my body. Bottom line - I feel a Hilton property, let alone a resort would have better accommodations and service than their "lower end" chains (i.e Hampton, Garden Inn, etc.), but that is not the case. I won't even mention the 1995 television in the room. Won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Travelingworks
Reviews.Content: The Point offers wonderful service as well as excellent accommodations and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dvo4
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I was not sure about staying there, but I am glad we did! The resort was nice and a great value for the money spent. Very friendly staff, great pool area, and clean rooms. I have traveled alot and stayed in phoenix on other business trips and I would definately stay at this hotel again. This trip was with families and a great place for children of all ages. This hotel is set in a very quiet area and overall a great hotel! Aurora, NE

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is fun, comfortable, and convenient for couples and for families with young kids or teens.”
Reviews.Author: ddbastian
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel many times over the last twelve years. When our children were younger, the Hole in the Wall River Ranch, with its miniature golf, water slides, lazy river, and waterfall, was always entertaining. Coyote Camp was my son's favorite! Now that the kids are teens, they enjoy the sports pool and tennis courts as well. For adults, there are quiet pools, pool service for lunch and drinks, and tennis activities. The hotel also offers family activities each day. The Hole in the Wall restaurant is cute, with its Western Theme. The hotel's location is a few blocks from the Dreamy Draw recreation area, which is great for hikers and bikers. We also appreciate the 10-minute trip from the airport and the proximity to great shopping, fantastic restaurants, and Old Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with excellent service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kluzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom casita and the rooms were beautiful and very clean. The pool area (River Ranch) was extensive and a lot of fun. The Hole in the Wall restaurant had friendly staff and excellent food Highly recommend this resort for family vacations

Reviews.Title: “Very nice facility, staff very attentive”
Reviews.Author: escobrown
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort, rooms are nicely done, the grounds are well maintained, pool(s) well maintained and the staff was very freindly and attentive, we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort was the perfect place for our family to stay at!!!”
Reviews.Author: RLUVS2TRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Going anywhere with teenagers is always a challenge; there needs to be enough area within our quarters to give them their 'space', as well as nice surroundings and selection of activities to keep the 'peace'. Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak provided all that and a little more. Their staff (from the person that delivered us additional towels to the person that waved us good-bye at departure time) was courteous, their concierge was knowledgeable, and their ground-keepers were friendly. Plus, the resort's Fitness Center is the best one that we have been to, comparing anywhere from cruise lines to hotels to resorts, the grounds were beautiful, and the amenities were plenty. ...But above all that, we as a family believe that what made the biggest impact during our stay was the personal touch from our Chef Concierge, Dave Richardson. Dave directed us to restaurants and points of interest. He went out of his way to make reservations for us. He advised us on activities that fit our interests. Dave took care of us with passion, while projecting individualize love and dedication for both his job and his customers.

Reviews.Title: “best value in Arizona, be a hero to your kids and book here”
Reviews.Author: PeakValentine
Reviews.Content: Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort has been the favorite Thanksgiving wee destination for my family the past ten years. There is so much good about this property. 1 - The main pool / River Ranch The weather in AZ during this time of year is phenomenal, allowing us Coloradoans to enjoy the River Ranch's ample pool, lazy river, and mega slide. The River Ranch staff is overly accommodating with the games they host throughout the day. My kids always seem to win a smoothie or a cheeseburger. They even set up a movie projector on Friday nights - last time showing Pocahontas. 2- The semi private pools: After the day of swimming, my wife and I relax in the over-sized room while the kids swim in the semi-private pool that is shared by only a few guest rooms. 3 - The staff and clean rooms: The housekeeping and maintenance staff are invisible, but the room and property is always clean. I have to wonder if Disney doesn't secretly send their staff to the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort for training. 4- The restaurant. We are always impressed with the quantify and quality of food served at Hole in the Wall restaurant, and the friendliness of the staff there. 5 - The gym and spa First rate with ample exercise equipment. Being adjacent to the nicest neighborhoods in Phoenix, I can tell the regular members are fit, in mind, body and financially. My wife enjoys the spa each time we come, and says this is her favorite place to get a massage. 6- Proximity to hiking and climbing. We clime Squaw Peak each time we stay at the property. A relatively short hike from the room, about 2 1/2 hours round trip. Amazing we can be so close to the mountains ans so convenient to all the good shopping Phoenix has to offer. 7 - and most important, the HERO factor. My five kids insist we stay at this resort each and every year. The management and staff give me every reason to come back; I am super-dad because of the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort! The best value in Arizona, maybe in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: JdyJdyJdy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online and loved it!!! The staff here could give lessons on great service! They were all awesome! This hotel is very pretty, clean and there is so much to do right on site. The pools are clean and the water park is tons of fun. I would stay at this hotel again for sure! I want to take my son next time. I know he would love this hotel! There are also some great restuarants within walking distance. This hotel is a true Gem!!

Reviews.Title: “The kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: NY10028
Reviews.Content: Despite a slightly run-down feel and fairly skimpy amenities, this hotel scored a home run with my kids, age 9 and 10. What do they care if the only restaurant in the place is reminiscent of an overpriced TGI Friday's? When would they notice the slightly stained upholstery and fraying carpet in our very large and otherwise comfortable, clean suite? Those acres of heated pools, hot tubs, water slides and the "lazy river" kept them entertained for hours. The kid's spa treatments got them out of the pool at least once a day for a reasonable price. They made friends with other kids. And the resort is conveniently located near a Cheesecake Factory and a bunch of other sort of corporate, suburban, fun places, which the girls were just thrilled with. The staff was super-nice and helpful as well. One morning, one of my kids had an asthma attack, and the front desk guy literally piloted me to the nearest emergency room via cell phone, like an air traffic controller (she was totally fine). If you want high-end luxury, go somewhere else (we hear the Phoenician is nice that way). But if you want a totally reasonably priced place in a warm climate, that is decent and that your kids will LOVE, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NorthOaks
Reviews.Content: We had a FANTASTIC time staying at this hotel. First, the location is the best. We like to be outdoors and active. The hotel is situated on a bike/running path which connects to Dreamy Draw Recreation Park. Dreamy Draw Park has many miles of running/walking, biking paths which are both paved, or natural mountain trails. We preferred the paved trails, but many prefer the natural so you never fee like the trails are crowded. Next, the hotel is located just a mile or so from Squaw Peak. If you like to hike, this is perfect. You are there in minutes by car. Squaw peak is a good work out - I think the summit is about 1.2 miles. The path up is a good work out (we climbed 3 times) and you are always in the sun so even if it's cool out (50 degrees for us) you're plenty warm. The climb is moderate to difficult, but most people can handle it if you are careful. Definitly do it - the scenery of the entire valley is gorgeous! We also climbed Camelback Mountain during our stay which is about 3 miles from Squaw Peak. Camelback Mountain is much more difficult and challenging to climb. We saw people of all ages and conditions climbing both, but if you are not in good shape Camelback Mountain may not be much fun, and instead it will be a stressor for you. More about the hotel - we do not have small kids, so the lazy river water area was not a draw for us. However, we met many people with young kids and talked to them. Everyone said they had a great time. The water was kept warm, so even with 50 and 60 degree weather the kids and parents used it and had fun. The hotel pools were warm water too, and the hot tubs were really warm. You could see steam rising from the water during the cool mornings and evenings. Also, there are so many different pools and hot tubs that we neveer felt it was crowded, or we didn't want to use them because of too many people. The hotel rooms are big, with good TVs and room sizes. The staff does a great job of keeping the rooms and grounds spotless. As a matter of fact - the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. My wife and I travel quite a bit, and you usually run into a person or two who does not understand custumer service at hotels. Squaw Peak Hilton - every staff member was friendly, helpful, smiles and a hello, ready to help anyway they can. My wife and I also like to exercise. The hotel Spa and Fitness center was the best. This fitness center also has local members who use it. It is the best, most up to date, state of the art facility I have ever used at a hotel. If you pay the extra $2.50 a day charge, you can use the fitness center, and tennis courts for no additional charge. This is a bargain, make sure you do it. It has free weights, machine weights, many top notch treadmills with built in TVs, stationary bikes and stair masters, exercise classes, steam room, full showers and lockers. The fitness center is a short walk (1 minute) from the hotel lobby - truly outstanding facility. It is big enough that again, even though many people were using it, we felt like we had it to ourselves. Never had to wait for a machine etc.. I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone who is visiting the Phoenix area!!

Reviews.Title: “Memory Book,s..pictures my memory took.”
Reviews.Author: dinamercille
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our son and daughter to Arizona for 2 reasons. #1 to purchase our new home and # 2 to fullfill a" Bucket List" for my husband who has been given 9 months to live due to liver cancer. I chose the Pointe , because when I lived in Az 25 years ago it was my absolute favourite place to go to.I was not dissapointed when we arrived. This resort is so lush and rich in natural beauty, you have to experience the awe of getting up in the morning to the beautiful scenery all around you with Squaw Mountains around you and the incredible landscaping.The water parks are so much fun. We made memories on this trip for my entire family to remember. Thank you for helping us to do this.Your staff was awesome, your food was very good. My husband ate rattlesnake for the 1st time in his life. Our children had the time of their lives.And me , I made a choice that added more memories to my past stays. Thank You!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not luxury resort, but good for fun vacation”
Reviews.Author: leebids
Reviews.Content: As everyone has noted, its a very family oriented place thanks to each room being a suite and the great pool. Our thanksgiving stay was fine- not too crowded by the pool, room and staff were just as they should be. Room is typical suite layout- two smaller than normal rooms with bathroom in between. Note that there is only a sink/small fridge. No microwave or freezer (at least not in basic rooms), so don't expect to cook anything. We got a very good deal on this place and they seem to run specials fairly frequently. I would suggest it for families or for folks looking for a bargain higher end place. But you can will find much more romantic and luxurious hotels elsewhere in Phoenix/Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly attentive service”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaGuy2009
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am in the Phoenix area, I either stay at the Hilton Squaw Peak Resort or the Arizona Biltmore. I receive the same incredibly attentive service at both properties. The Casitas are wonderful and as are the luxury suite.. Stay and you will enjoy it. Jake

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for our family”
Reviews.Author: rocketSilverdale
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our daughter recently spent four days staying at the Pointe Hilton (Squaw Peak) in Phoenix. They certainly went out of their way to make our stay wonderful and comfortable. We are from Washington state and not familiar with the Phoenix area. They guided us to several great restaurants for both breakfast and dinners. Rooms are spacious and quiet and we were impressed by the detail to make our stay enjoyable. Prices were very reasonable and we will definitely return on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wlamike
Reviews.Content: The suite was quiet and plush. Walking around the well landscaped grounds was very romantic. The pool area has a waterfall, slide and tubes to float in the lazy river. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service, beautiful property, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: imisshomealot
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of hotels with work, mostly in the Hilton family. When I have the rare chance to travel with my family, I have high expectations. I must say, this is the first time I've written a review and am doing so because I thought that the service was absolutely exceptional. When we first checked in, concierge extraordinaire David Richardson checked us in like we were the only guests in the hotel. He remembered my name throughout our stay. Excellent service. We also had a maintenance issue with our car. Jim in property operations provided awesome service and gave us great advice. He couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. His service actually prompted me writing this. In addition to the service, the pool was awesome. My son (5 yrs old) and I spent 3 hours playing in the waterfall, water slide (super fast) and lazy river. Amazing time. Pool side food was really good too. I rank the hotel 10/10 and recommend this for a family looking for a getaway. Probably would be a great place for a conference too.

Reviews.Title: “Most magnificently wonderful trip of my entire life.”
Reviews.Author: reddogsmom
Reviews.Content: Will never be able to say enough about the gacious and friendly staff and the accomodations were more that excellant

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, average room”
Reviews.Author: VikingRuler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this resort, and it is a really big resort. It was winter time, certainly off-season, and it was very quiet, and the big attraction, the pool, was really not in play with temps in the 60's. Gym was better than expected. I like that it is very easy to get to, right off HWY 51, only minutes from the airport, and Hwy 51 offers great access to all the major freeways and highways in the area, and it was really easy to get around from there. The area around the resort is VERY quiet, we had a hard time fiding places to eat after 9pm, and there is no room service after 10pm. What saves you is a very cute 24-hour diner south on 16th about two miles, with great food and great staff, but this is your only late night option, even on a Friday or Saturday night. The rooms are a little dated, nice, but nothing special, had a little bit of motel feel to it, but the price was good, about $120/night because it is off-season. I would probably give this place another chance in the summer, when their fantastic pool is in play.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Concierge David Richardson makes this Hotel tick!”
Reviews.Author: Bill630
Reviews.Content: I work in Tempe 15 times a year but always stay at Pointe Hilton because the concierge makes sure I have a great Casita which is like your own little home. He always insures that I have a quick check out and if i need anything printed or reservations he is there to assist. I always suggest my fellow employees from my company stay here as well and they also love the location. 10 minutes to airport, lots of restaurant options in area. The only negative is that the restaurants could use better management since it takes a long time to get served when it is not even crowded. They are always short of servers but I think it is because of the recession that they can't keep people employed... For those considering this Hotel, introduce yourself to David and I am certain he will insure your stay is a positive one...Great Athletic center...A real club

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with lots to do...”
Reviews.Author: aemorris
Reviews.Content: Decided we needed a vacation and headed to the warm climate. As soon as we arrived we saw that the kids were going to love it. Big pools and a huge water park. The rooms were spotless and spacious. The service was amazing and the staff was terrific. The BBQ restaurant on site was delicious. We played tennis at night and played in the water all day. They have a lazy river to relax on and a mini golf course as well. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Old and worn out”
Reviews.Author: 328Traveller
Reviews.Content: Very old. My room was a "suite" and had all the drapings of an old-style Embassy suites. Cell phones would not work in the rooms and we all had to walk into the parking lot to talk on our phones. Also, the room was very dark ... bad lighting and depressing, even with all the curtains open. The internet service in-room was very slow and frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Needs attention”
Reviews.Author: metricmike
Reviews.Content: Hotel internet will not work with Vista or Windows 7, severe drawback if on business, appears to be a hotel hardware issue, hotel has no plans to update equipment from what I could find out. They do not have WiFi except in the lobby. Still the same compatibility issue. I only ate breakfast at the one restaurant, the Hole in the wall, it was mediocre and the service poor. I avoided the hotel restaurants for the rest of my 3 night stay. We checked out early due to the lack of Internet coverage.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money off season”
Reviews.Author: SuperPags
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the off season rates and it was well worth it. We had a blast in the pool area and found lots to keep our 7 year old occupied and happy from the lazy river to miniature golf. Lots of places at the resort to grab a bite to eat and plenty close by if you want to leave. The suite was ok. There was nothing amazing about but it was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “kids' wonderland”
Reviews.Author: agentrand1
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak is a good value for the whole family. Being a Hilton Hhonors Gold member was a help in upgrading to a Casita for extra room and easier access to additional pools. Everyone had a good time in the pools, the Lazy River, tennis, mini golf. The breakfast options were very good at the Lantana Grill. Everyone is excited to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but charges need to be reviewed”
Reviews.Author: travelling20
Reviews.Content: First of all if you have kids the waterfall/pools will keep them busy all day, they are great the rooms are clean and fresh but are average by todays standards. the on site food/stores as is the norm are very exspensive as are the evening resturants,bars and breakfasts What I feel is unreasonable is that they charge for breakfast and for wifi in your room. With an everage of $11 per person per breakfast and $12 per day on wifi on a familly of 4 this adds $56 per day for an everage family. Add this cost to the already high cost to stay and suddenly it becomes a very exspensive resort for a familly in a resort that already needs to look to offer more. The pools are the only reason to stay there Overall a good stop over but with holiday inn's and the like offering better bang for your buck the squaw peak needs to take a look at offering a more family friendly price structure

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Babymoon”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSistah
Reviews.Content: I read numerous reviews of this hotel before booking and even after booking to ensure that I made the right decision. It turns out that I did. The purpose of the trip was a romantic getaway for me and my husband before we have our second child that I'm expecting in less than 3 months. Many folks who reviewed said that this was not a good romantic choice. I think that depends on when you choose to go. I chose to stay on a Sunday night in September because I figured that all of the kids would be in school and so there would be very few families left in the hotel. I found this to be true. However, I can imagine that this place is a zoo during the summer, but any place with a water park is going to be like that during the hot summer months in AZ. I chose this hotel because of all of the amenities and the ability to stay in a Casita. The thought of being in our own "little house" really appealed to me. Although I had been warned by others that the Casitas were actually a couple of apartment-like structures put together, it still felt like we were in our own little world. It wasn't like being in a regular hotel room where you can hear every toilet flush and coming and going of your next door neighbors. The covered parking right behind each Casita makes your car drivable after being in the sun. There was also a small private pool right next to our one-bedroom King (bed) Casita. The inside was very nicely decorated. The large refrigerator, microwave and sink/bar area were perfect for quick snacks and it was fun to have the bedroom area on a separate floor from the kitchen table, desk area and couch/TV area downstairs. Upstairs was nice as well with a place to lounge as well as a bed and another bathroom. Other reviewers were correct about the door to the toilet area being nearly impossible to close due to its proximity to the toilet itself, but with a 2 yr old at home I'm used to not having privacy in the bathroom! I had hoped to spend time walking the grounds, but we got too busy. Fortunately we had a great view from our small balcony and from the first floor of our Casita. I didn't visit the Spa at the Squaw Peak resort as I had planned, but instead the spa at the sister property at Tapatio Cliffs (they had a Spa Week discount on a particular treatment). I had an aromatherapy/maternity massage. I haven't had many spa treatments so I don't have much to compare it to, but the staff seemed very professional and it was an overall positive experience. There is a free shuttle between the two properties but it only leaves on the hour from one hotel and half hour from another so it may not work if you don't want to wait or arrive early. So overall I was very happy with my stay. Next time I'll book at least 2 nights so I can experience the water park, mini golf, and restaurant. Other positive notes: friendly staff, discounted rate by booking 21 days in advance (non-refundable), ability to check-in 2 hours early simply by calling, close proximity to a mall (Desert Ridge Marketplace - 15 min) and my husband was thrilled at the number and variety of channels on TV.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel - best for relaxing. Avoid weekends - way too many kids!”
Reviews.Author: Leeds1978
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Pointe Hilton Squaw resort earlier this month (Sept 2009). Staff we great on arrival - given choice of queen or king bed, and bell boy took us to our room on a golf buggy which was good as it was very hot. Our room was nice and roomy, very clean and had everything we could want. Only downside was that the balcony was very small and was on the back of the hotel so was very dark and had trees overhanging it so we weren't able to sit out. Hole in the Wall restaurant was very nice to eat breakfast - amazing choice for $15 dollars and yes there were busy times but nothing too bad. HitW also served lunch and dinner overlooking the main pool which was nice. The one thing that spoilt the first couple of days for us was the children at the resort..... we did go over Labor Day so did expect it to be busy, but the amount of unsupervised children was ridiculous. We stayed away from the main pool with the lazy river and stayed in the North Pointe pool, but that was just as bad with the kids (and the parents in some cases!!). Once the weekend was over and a lot of the families left the hotel was lovely and peaceful and the North Pointe pool was lovely and relaxing. Small pool with jacuzzi (not working whilst we were there but nice to use as hot tub) and swim up bar. For those wanting bigger pool there was the main one with the slide and lazy river but the small quiet one suited us. As we didn't have a car, there wasn't much we could do as the hotel is quite isolated but the hotel were great at helping us sort out an evening in downtown Pheonix to see the D-Backs baseball team (excellent evening, highly recommend this, even to non sports lovers. Great experience, amazing venue). Hotel helped with transport etc. Would recommend anyone staying at this hotel to use the shuttle bus to go to the Fashion Mall at Scottsdale - only $15 dollars for a round trip - well worth it. Also recomment Gallaghers sports bar just over the road from the hotel - very nice staff and lovely food. Especially the steaks and baked potatoes!! Overall nice hotel, shame about the kids! Hotel was a nice place to relax and unwind....

Reviews.Title: “Casita Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: phxgirl1
Reviews.Content: Rented a Casita's for a 1 night stay. Got there and it was NOTHING like what the pictures showed. It was small, the kitchen had a microwave, sink and frig but, nothing else. There was no kitchen stuff. No linens, soap, nothing. Just a few paper plates and plastic utencils in a drawer. We had to go out and buy paper towels and a sponge just to clean up the counters. The room had no DVD player, the cable was nothing more than local channels. I had a room of teenagers with absolutely nothing to do at night. The pictures showed a huge balcony on the 2nd floor, the actual balcony was more of a miniture patio, big enough for two people to stand on with about an inch or so to move around. Very, Very small. Not a good value for the money at all. The only enjoyment we got was at the lazy river and pool the next day but, even that got boring after a couple hours. They need more stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice water park”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were upgraded to a Casita. The room was spacious and clean with a frig and microwave. We came here b/c of the mini water park and it did not disappoint. The pool was grea, as was the lazy river, and water slide. The also had mini-golf as an option as well. The workout area was well equiped and spacious. The staff was very professional and attentive throughout the resort . Our $89 package came with breakfast, which was average at best. The only thing I would warn anyone on is the prices by the pool for food and drink, but than again that's to be expected. This hotel was a great value during the hot summer and we will be back as my children loved the water park.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have kids”
Reviews.Author: bdr2835
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel in August. here are the good and the bad points; Good- Room was clean (but the balcony was too small to sit out on). Hotel was within walking distance of a few good restaurants and bars. The hotel bar/pub was decent for drinks (the food was a bit hit and miss). All the staff were friendly. Bad- The water park was smaller than we thought and very busy (this was mid week). The other pool areas (which we had asssumed would be quieter) were also likely to be filled with families with children so not that good for reading/relaxing. We had a $100 resort credit which the hotel forgot to deduct and had to be reminded. The in room internet access is very expensive and the internet in the business center (which you still had to pay for) is so slow as to be useless Overall I would say if you have young children then this hotel could be great but be warned that the facilities didn't seem as big as we expected. If you want a a relaxing holiday then this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in casitas”
Reviews.Author: prim_rose_01
Reviews.Content: We had booked a casita for our one-night stay here because we wanted a location with 2 separate bedrooms. I was told by the reservation agent that this hotel had a "full" kitchen w/stove and dishwasher, which is what we were looking for. We got to the room and were extremely disappointed - not only was there no stove nor a dishwasher, the fridge was tiny with a very small freezer section, and there was only a microwave in addition. The casita itself was fairly clean, the carpet was heavily stained. The casitas do come with 8 waterpark passes, and we did try out the waterpark. It wasn't too crowded for a weekend, but it really isn't very spectacular - there is a lazy river, a water slide and various other play pools. The minimum water depth was 4 feet, which was pretty deep for my 8 yr old. Also, internet access costs an additional $15 per night here. There is no wi-fi available in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but avoid it during week-ends!”
Reviews.Author: LePope
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice 2 nights at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak this August. We booked 2 rooms (1 kingsize and 1 two queensize beds) thru internet. Everything went fine and we got the requested rooms. Rooms (sorry: “suites”) are rather large with a living room, a separate bath/toilet and sink bathroom and a sleeping room. Be aware that kingsize bed suites are smaller than regular 2 queensize beds. Cleanliness of rooms is OK, but you could expect better from Hilton. Value is very good if you can get summer deal prices. On our second stay, we requested extended check-out time (3 pm) for an extra charge of 35$. We were told at check in that it was OK and that we just had to call the front desk the morning of our departure. When I called, I was told that it was not possible because the hotel was full! Pretty strange as the official check-in time is 4 pm. After discussion, we were eventually able to stay until 3 pm. Breakfast by the pool at the « Hole in the Wall » restaurant is nice, providing you come very early (7 am) to avoid the crowds of people who consider that a buffet is a all-you-can-eat-contest and leave you with the leftovers and stained napkins. The buffet is good, but rather pricey ($15+tip+tax). There was a convention going on while we were there the second time, and unfortunately the attendees were noisy. They stayed in the inner pool area for hours, shouting & laughing. I asked them to quiet down several times, but without success. But the real downturn of that resort is the crowd that gathers on weekends. The beautiful and quiet pools suddenly turns into a real mess. There were always tons of unsupervised children and teens in the lazy river, swimming (though forbidden), shouting and disrupting everybody. We also found disgusting that food and drinks seems to be allowed around (and even within) the pool. My advice: go there during the week providing there is no convention going on. Avoid it on week-ends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: AARVacations
Reviews.Content: This is truly a wonderful place to stay. Very close and conveniently located to the airport. We traveled with a 12 and 8 year old and they loved this place. The water park was great. The kids found the slides very amusing and entertaining and gave us time to relax in the lazy river. We would have loved to have stayed longer. Definately a plus-plus.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every part of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: looking4sun09
Reviews.Content: Water park is excellent! Gorgeous pools and we couldn't get enough of the lazy river! The room was clean and cozy! All the staff were so friendly and willing to help whenever we needed anything. The food at the poolside restaurants was excellent! Staff seemed to really be on top of things! Would stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Lesson Learned: Images and Info on Internet don't always match reality”
Reviews.Author: LookingForQuality33
Reviews.Content: We selected this resort for various reasons including the four star designation, the water park and the slides (plural) that were written up and shown in the description because our 12 and 15 year olds wanted to go someplace to have fun. We also liked the "newly renovated" description as well as the many photos shown. When we got there, we found that what we got did not look like the photos. Don't get me wrong, this hotel is ok and nice, and if you didn't have anything to compare it to, it would be fine, but it doesn't seem to be what you normally find with Hilton Hotels. The buildings seem to be spread out and confusing. We arrived very late, and though we had a map AND directions, had a difficult time finding our room. Directions that are second nature for hotel staff take awhile for guests to figure out. A trip to the main lobby for coffee was a "field trip" from our room. One time, while coming from a different direction, I really got lost and it took some time to figure out where I was because buildings tend to look the same. The suites/rooms were described as "spacious," but as a family of four, we found ourselves tripping over each other because the room was much smaller than presented in the photos, and the one bed extended into the doorway between the living and sleeping area. The bathroom was also very small. When we called the front desk upon arrival, they were very nice, but we were told that all the room and bathroom sizes were this size. In addition, the room we had did not look at all newly renovated, and in fact it looked worn and not quite as spotless as I would like. (i.e. dust on door crevices, some spots on rug, floor, etc.) The front desk confirmed that all the rooms were newly renovated. There was a convention going on while we were there. Our room was near an elevator, (doors go to the outside not hallways) and needless to say the conventioneers were noisey. My husband had to ask them to quiet down several times, because there seemed to be no soundproofing, & noise carried right into the room. Again, they weren't doing anything wrong, just talking, but the nights were late ---and the noise definitely carried. The description of the slides at the water park says "slides." There was only one slide, (if there were two we never found the second one) and they were probably not as fun of a slide as anticipated. Several times down the slide and we had our fill. The lazy river and pool area was nice, but not as fresh and new looking as the photos. There were always tons of small and what appeared to be unsupervised children in the lazy river. Many weren't following the rules of using inner tubes, and no staff person said anything about this at all. One other note is there seemed to be a lot of staired walkways to go from point A to point B. If someone has difficulty with stairs, they would find it hard to get around the pool/ waterpark area. The staff overall was very nice. A very pleasant surprise was "Slim Pickens" --the pool restaurant/ food service. The food there was absolutely out of this world outstanding---hands down better than the other restaurants on the premises. I would go back there anytime to eat. It was expensive, like the other restaurants, but well worth it. The spa was also and excellent experience. While in Phoenix, we checked out other hotels that showed up as options when we were booking this hotel, and though their photos looked worse online, the hotels in the same star or price range were much more outstanding. This hotel is ok, but honestly, we probably wouldn't choose it again if we take another vacation in Phoenix or recommend it to a friend. My daughter summed it up when she said, "Compared to the other hotels we looked at with the same star rating while there,(key word compare) this one really shouldn't have the same number of stars. " If you don't have anything to compare this to, or previous experience with Hilton Hotels, you would probably say the hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: Rebekahj0
Reviews.Content: We were only here for one night, but if we could have stayed longer we would have! We called the hotel in the morning as we were expecting to get to Phoenix earlier than check-in time and they told us they would try to have a room ready when we arrived. At just after 1:00 we showed up and the room was ready! Sam at the front desk was very helpful and kind as was Joseph at the Bell Hop desk! The grounds were beautiful and my kids had a great time at the pools and going down the slide and going around the lazy river. . . I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !!”
Reviews.Author: speedy316
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to take the family to Hilton’s Squaw Peak. I can tell you, without hesitation, that this property aims to please. There were plenty of activities for the younger kids, as well as our teen- pool volley ball, poolside service for food/drinks, water slides, lazy river, mini-golf (which surrounds the pool area), and great dining! My wife loved the spacious rooms, balcony, and red-carpet service. Terrific Resort! Luxurious. Tropical. We barely left the property whole time we were there. Bravo!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: tvieira
Reviews.Content: the rooms were great - 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen - gave everyone their space. We loved the pools and water slide. had poolside bars and cafe's with great staff. Elevators were not air conditioned nor had fans so were like ovens. But the rooms were great. Spacious clean and good shape. Limited restaraunt choices on site but concierge was very helpful in finding us other resteraunts near by. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Secret Unvailed - - Great for Families with Kids, Only.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegianOnVacation
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, this is a resort for families with children only. If you don't have kids, then you have no business staying here. Yes, the hotel is beautiful, but kids pour out of every crack. If you are like me, that's really cool because I have a 5-year-old and a 3-year-old. The resort is a really good place to bring kids. The facility caters to kids' every need. My kids loved it. The lazy river and main pool were very, very cool. The water is as warm as bathwater. Very nice, since I get tired of jumping into freezing cold pools. The other pools also had kids. As for the rooms, they are top notch. They recently finished a total remodel. The rooms are very, very nice. My wife and I kept wondering how this resort makes any money ($97 a night for a great suite) seeing how much money they have put into the rooms. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and am fairly picky about nice hotel rooms. These rooms were every bit as nice as most hotels that I have stayed in. You will have no qualms with them. The grounds were very clean and very nice. The only thing that prevented this from being a perfect 10 was the 190 degree heat outside. I am from San Diego and have low tolerance for heat. However, even I acclimated and enjoyed myself. We spent three nights and had a great, great time. If you are intimidated by the heat, don't be. It was kind of cool for such a drastic weather change. As for the staff, they were totally cool. No problems whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Always a fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DesertDweller32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pointe Squaw Peak from Monday, July 13 to Wednesday, July 15. We enjoyed ourselves ~ we had stayed at the resort a few years ago and were pleased to see the updating that had been done! The room was quite comfortable, the front desk staff extraordinarily kind and pleasant, and the housekeeping and maintenance staffs never failed to stop and move out of the way for guests ~ as well as share a pleasant greeting. Used the workout facility (treadmill only) and was pleased with it ~ it's a short walk across the parking lot. The River Ranch water park was great ~ loved the water slide and lazy river. Since we were there during the weekdays, there weren't any problems with too many people or rowdy people at all! (The lazy river is DEFINITELY lazy ~ get ready for a long, meandering tube ride!!!) The water is warm, but, hey folks, this is Phoenix in July and the air temp is 110 degrees at 8 p.m.!!! The Hole in the Wall restaurant was fine ~ not impressed with the waitstaff whatsoever, though! Try Aunt Chilada's, a Mexican Restaurant a short walk from the main lobby (5 minutes?). Also, if you're not interested in a daily newspaper, call over to the front desk and get the 75 cent/day charge removed from your account ~ every little bit helps!!! All in all, a fun experience for the family ~ you have to try really hard not to have a good time!!!

Reviews.Title: “No return for me and not recommended for others”
Reviews.Author: Bankage
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to get away for the weekend. I chose the cheapest room because I thought we'd be there only to sleep. The room was the best part, as it was fairly quiet and clean. We did a "couples massage" and the woman who did mine was a troll. She acted like we were an inconvenience to her and she was rude to my wife. My wife's masseur was pleasant, but stifled by his partner, the troll. We left a tip for my wife's masseur, but I think it was probably unknowingly split between the two. We then went to the water park and tried to enjoy the lazy river, but all the unsupervised kids there, were like the impatient motorists in rush hour traffic, trying to zip past you and there's no room to go. It's actually called the "Lazy River" for a reason, right? We tried the slide and found out that flip flops and glasses aweren't allowed, but the ground was so hot, it was impossible not to ascend without something on your feet. We then went into the main swimming area, but we were repulsed by the cloudy and warm water. The rules allowed for beverages to come into the pool, but it seemed as though the crowd had spilled many of their drinks in and around the pool, as it smelled like beer. We then went to the Hole in the Wall restaurant, which should have been called the "Hole in the Wallet" restaurant. We ordered long islands, but I think they were just a mix of lemonade and iced tea. We also ordered the rattlesnake, which came out in a small cereal bowl. For $33, we were expecting something more than stale, breaded, fried, clumps. If you've ever had popcorn chicken, it was similar to that, except it tasted more like calamari and you could have fit it all in an 8 oz styrofoam coffee cup. I ordered the half-rack of ribs and my wife ordered the blackened chicken breast. The meat on both of ours was very dry and my wife's chicken was flavorless. The veggies were barely cooked and the fry bread was almost literally, fried bread (not typical of fry bread or funnel cake). The BBQ sauce was something you'd find on the bottom shelf at a supermarket. The total cost of the meal came up to $115 and we left the restaurant very unimpressed. We were going to try the mini golf, but decided against it and didn't want to get any more frustrated with the whole experience. The "On Demand" channel went out and we decided to just watch something on regular TV. We were able to check-in early and leave one hour later upon request. However, you had to read up on these little tidbits to take advantage of them, along with $2.25 "all access" daily fee. The "all access" charge could be applied to your bill upon request, which allows you to avoid the al a cart pricing for the pool, mini golf, gym, and other amenities. We felt that the bellhop was very helpful and wasn't holding out his hand for tips the way the others (massage place & restaurant) did. The general theme seemed to be that the quality was extremely low and service was terrible, but the prices remained at the resort level. My wife enjoyed the pillows, bedding, and the clock-radio. In my opinion, this is a horrible deal for anyone. I've stayed in cheaper places that provided more courteous service and better quality than this place. I would recommend finding a cheaper room, going to a water park, scheduling a massage, and picking a restaurant separately. I was expecting to have a more impressive experience with Hilton, but this was so significantly unimpressive, I thought I'd take the time to write about it.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back”
Reviews.Author: AATucson
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to this Hilton was an unpleasant start to our 4th of July holiday. At check-in it took 3 different room assignments before they got it right (1st time they wrote down the wrong room number, 2nd room was on the wrong floor & the 3rd room was only partially cleaned). The front desk kindly comped us a $50 food credit for our troubles. We headed off to the River Ranch for some R & R - what a surprise! It was literally a sea of people - there were large groups of young, drunk, cursing kids who were sneaking in their own booze, the lazy river was a traffic jam, as well as littered with assorted trash & the line for the slide was 25 people deep. We were not aware that non-resort guests were allowed into the River Ranch - bad policy! One of the 2 elevators was out of order for the evening & all the ice machines were empty until Saturday AM. We woke up early Saturday morning to enjoy a cup of coffee on our balcony, when down below at the pool we spotted a group enjoying a 12 pack of Bud - at 7AM! Needless to say, we packed it up & headed to another resort. Guess we're just too old for this "Spring Break" atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Not the people you expect at a hilton”
Reviews.Author: rolfv
Reviews.Content: The hotel has some nice pool areas because we were on the eve of 4th of july there were a lot of families bus also couples who were more party people. You have a main pool near your room and a water park. In the main pool it filled with beer drinking loud people. Not my cup of thea so I would avoid this hotel during holiday weekends. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. The water park has a long lazy river, sport pools and a general ppo but no area were you can really swim. Breakfastbuffet is avaible for $ 15 and the reception has a list of nereby restaurants avaible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel except for lobby”
Reviews.Author: sext9652
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Squaw Peak resort from 6/20 through 6/27. The Conceige, David, is the BEST thing this hotel has going for them. He upgraded us from a standard suite to a Ambassador suite (no charge) it was my husband's birthday. He was extremely helpful throughout our stay. The lobby is very slow and needs a lot of improvement. The hotel itself is a little confusing at first but once you get your bearings its set up nicely. If you are arriving on a weekend plan on hunting for a place to park, unless you have a Casista. The pool area is open to the locals and the parking is scarce. The beds were extremely comfortable and rooms were clean. The food at the Hole in Wall is typical resort pricing but very good. The waitstaff is friendly and remembered us each time we came in. The large pool does have a lot of kids but the smaller pools between the buidings are quieter. We saw the pool but never went (average temp was 110 while we were there).

Reviews.Title: “Great mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: cckc1968
Reviews.Content: Was in Arizona for a wedding in Flagstaff, and decided to take the kids on a mini vacation to Phoenix. A friend had told me about Squaw Peak many years ago. Our room was beautiful, it was a King Suite, my 21 yo son slept on the sofa sleeper in the LR and had his own TV. My 17 and 2 yo daughters shared the king bed with me and we had a TV in the BR too. Our balcony hung right over the very loud central AC units, which threw out even more heat...thankfully it was only 100 degrees that weekend. The River Ranch was very crowded (as it is open to the public not just guests), but we enjoyed it...it is open from 5 am to 11 pm, which was nice for my older kids who can go go go. The pools and the lazy river were clean and the staff was around to make sure kids were not getting out of hand. There was a wasp nest somewhere close to the lazy river and there was a child that got stung. Our room came with 4 passes to the River Ranch and my little one didn't need one so my nephew (who was at another hotel came and hung out). Also, you can get the resort value pack for 2.25 cents more per day and that gives you an extra pass, so my brother came along too. The value pack was so worth it, we got passes to the fitness center, tennis courts, and the miniture golf course (which we didn't use).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: r5458
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in a king castia. The beds are wonderful, the cleaning staff the best I have ever seen. River ranch had a lot to do and the lazy river in a lot longer than it looks. The staff was very helpful. Only complaint is they charge for internet even in their buisness center. Would stay again !!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: rcaruana
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself and our two boys (13 & 14) decided to go on three extended weekend "stay-cations" this summer rather than one long vacation and this was our first stop. First, The Room, we booked the two bedroom bi-level casita so we would have some room to stretch out. All in all it was great. The furnishings were modern, comfortable and seemed fairly new. The downstairs came with a kitchenette that had a microwave, refrigerator and coffeemaker. Also downstairs are the living room and dining room complete with leather furnishings, T.V., etc & a half bath. The two bedrooms upstairs had a king in one and two queens in the other and a full bathroom for each. Granite counter-tops throughout. Robes for everybody and very nice bath sundries. The only drawback for me were the mattresses. I can't sleep on anything firmer than a hammock it seems so I had some back pain, but my wife and boys loved it. The Grounds, they are actually quite beautiful. Lots of trees overhanging the roads that lead to the casitas (which is unusual in Arizona) it made my wife and I wish we could live on streets like that. The whole area is very lush with flora and fauna. You have to tip your hat to the landscapers for keeping up with it. The pool areas are very nice for what they were intended for, which is family play. Anyone coming here with the intention of a romantic getaway needs to do more homework, because this isn't it. All in all I highly recommend The Pointe at Squaw Peak for family fun, from the excellent staff (Ashlee at reception) to the food at Hole in The Wall Restaurant (very good by the way) it was a great time. I think we are going to head to the Arizona Grand for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite A Resort Experience ... Somewhat Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: ccollman
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak. The first time was last year and the experience was not quite up to the hype. Unfortunately, things have not gotten much better, and I will probably never return again. Decided to take my wife the first night to celebrate our anniversary, then have our children join us the second night and go to the River Ranch (the waterpark). I had made arrangements for an early check-in at 1:00pm. Upon our arrival at 1:00pm, only the King bedroom part of the two-bedroom, two-story casita was ready, and I was told that we could check-in to that part, then when the rest of it was ready, the hotel would bring over the new room keys. We waited until 4:00pm with no word and no keys. I then walked back over to the front desk, only to be told by another front desk clerk that she didn't know if the rest of our casita was ready yet or not, and she would have to call and find out. I waited in the lobby nearly fifteen minutes while someone went to the casita and checked. Apparently, it had been done earlier and nobody told us or brought us the new keys. Strike One. While waiting in the lobby, I called room service and ordered dinner to be delivered to the room as a nice suprise for my wife. I ordered one filet, one salmon and a bottle of Pinot Grigio. After returning to the room, I received a call from room service stating that they were out of salmon and would I like to make another choice. Out of Salmon at 4:00pm on a Thursday??? Whatever. So I ordered two filets. Delivery was scheduled for 7:45pm. My wife and I had a 6:00pm appointment for a couples massage at the Tocasierra Spa. Upon our arrival, we were greeted with signs that said that the air conditioning was broken (late-May in Phoenix ... 102 degrees for a high that day) and they apologized for any inconvenience. We asked to see the actual therapy room first, and while it was a bit warm and the fans were very noisy, which drowned out the background music, the massages were very good. 50 minute couples massage ... $200 plus gratuity. The men's locker room was a mess, though, with old wet towels all over the floor and trash overflowing in the waste paper cans. Upon returning to the room, room service called and said they were out of the Pinot Grigio, and would I like some other wine instead. So I ordered a Chardonnay. Then I added a cheesecake and an order of chocolate-covered stawberries. At 7:50pm, room service called and said the food was on its way. It arrived moments later. To be honest, the filets were outstanding! Hot, juicy and tender. The mashed potatos and asparagus spears were good as well. The cheesecake was okay ... a bit dry and crumbly. The chocolate-covered strawberries were really good! All of this came to $175 plus gratuity. What??? Apparently, this hotel has one price for its food, and another price, approximately 25% to 45% higher depending, for the same food if delivered as room service (the filet mignon is $32 each on the regular restaurant menu but was charged to us at $45 each as part of room service). AND, they charge a $3 room service fee AND a 22% Room Service Gratuity. The food was good but ... Strike Two! I went and picked up the kids the next day and we spent the better part of the day at the River Ranch in the water. The pools, slide and lazy river are all a lot of fun. However, I did learn that the River Ranch is open to the general public, and that anyone who pays $15 each can get in. I guess there is a certain part of me that resents the fact that I just paid $179 per night for a casita and access to the River Ranch, yet someone can drive in off the streets and get into the waterpark for $15 and take all of the chairs and umbrellas. That evening, my wife and I went to the gift shop to get a deck of cards and a cup of coffee. You got it ... they don't serve coffee after 7:30pm. Went to check-out this morning. Noticed a charge of $157 from Slim Pickins, the food service at the pool. All we had at the pool was one drink, a daquiri, for $9.50. I questioned the charge, and was told that since the accounting departmenht wasn't in on Saturdays, there wasn't much that could be done. I had to demand that the charge be removed, which it eventually was. Strike Three! The casita itself was lovely. We had a two-bedroom, two-story casita. Downstairs was a living room, half-bathroom, dining room and small kitchenette with a 3/4 size fridge and microwave. There is no stove and no stovetop burners, so all cooking has to be done in the microwave. Upstairs are the two bedrooms, each with its own full bath, and a patio. Having a private parking space was nice. The grounds are well-kept and well-manicured. The River Ranch, however, is a mess. I saw empty beer bottles, plastic drink cups and food trays laying around for hours after people had finished them and left. "Ranch Crew", as the staff is called, is quick to get you something in hopes of a tip, but it seems nobody wants to clean-up after the messes. They call this place a resort, but in my book, there has to be a level of service and a certain expectation to be considered a resort, and this place just doesn't meet that expectation in my mind. For future trips to a water park, I will look into the Arizona Grand Resort, the Scottsdale Princess Resort and others.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I would have saved my money”
Reviews.Author: TRIXIE0880
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Pointe HIlton for a much needed vacation and was truly disappointed. Had a better experience at Holiday Inn Express in Flagstaff. The rooms were overpriced and my balcony faced out to what appeared to look like an alley way. The fridge was locked shut since I did not order the mini bar (but needed it for my water and soda that I brought). The bathroom door needs to be rethought because it hits the toliet every time you open or close the door. I picked this place for the spa and was very disappointed with the facility (great esthetician), would never send some back to this resort. I enjoyed the bed (had to be the only thing that was ok)

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: biggBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Well maintained. Service was good. Lots for kids to do. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Family fun in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: madkapl
Reviews.Content: Staff were pleasant, hotel is very pleasant... walking distance to the Phoenix Mtn Preserve and our kids loved the "water park." When we checked in we were offered choice of being near the water park, which we chose. In retrospect, it's all near... a room on an inside courtyard would have been nicer and given us a nicer view of the interior pools. Our kids slept on the pull-out sofa in the suite's living room and I must say, it was the most comfortable sofa-bed I've ever encountered! I would buy one for my house next time we are in the market for such. For $159 per night, this was a great deal - clean, comfortable, spacious, entertainment all around for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay at Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort”
Reviews.Author: 1stFour
Reviews.Content: Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort was just what we needed for relaxation by the pool. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and lounge chairs in the main area around the lazy river, main pool, sport pool and water slide are plentiful with umbrellas and little places to tuck yourself away if you get there early to claim the spot you want. We had wonderful breakfasts each morning at the Hole in the Wall Grille. We recommend the Chorizo with scrambled eggs if you like spicy food at all. The American breakfast was also good especially if you have a big appetite. We were pleasantly surprised because we had read negative reviews about the food but we found it delicious. The service was friendly and accommodating. Tasty Indian Fry bread is included too-- each morning we ordered from the menu so we didn't try the buffet but other people commented that it was good as well. It's definitely a resort set up for families but it was relaxing for us to watch when we weren't floating in the lazy river which gently propels the inner tubes along an interesting route which includes an in-pool fountain. Bottom line-- we would go back. The only real negative was lack of internet service in our building AND our cell phones got no reception. More bars -- there were Not. We met other guests who like us had to go out into the parking lot to get any reception at all-- we laughed about it-- but it was annoying and for emergencies one would be out of luck. Also if you wanted to go cashless you could charge everything to your room at this resort which is handy when staying at the pool area most of the day. We went to a Coyotes Ice Hockey game and what a great family event that was!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Eiregirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Squaw Peak while we were in town for a kid's competition. While it wasn't a terrible hotel by any measure, 'disappointing' pretty much summed it up in a couple of ways: I have to agree with the reviews below...the food is really, really expensive for what you get; and I don't just mean your standard, $5 additional hotel mark-up either. While the answer to this was simply to head out to one of the many near-by restaurants, the hotel food was SO overpriced that it was offensive. We stayed in one of the condos with our pack of kids. The condo itself is nothing remarkable, but although it was clean enough there was definitely a wet funk lurking somewhere in the rooms. Never did figure out what it was, but my guess was that it might have been partially due to the... ...CONSTANT irrigation outside. The irrigation seemed to be on 24/7, and everywhere you went you'd see big pools of water on the roads, sidewalks and puddled in the grass. For those of you who don't live in Arizona, you probably won't be as put off by this as we were. Phoenix, however, lies smack in the middle of the desert and water is a serious concern in our state. Though I'm sure that the Hilton uses reclaimed water, I have never, ever seen such flagrant waste. It was kind of like being on the verge of starvation because of a food shortage and then seeing your neighbor throw away a big, juicy steak... after having taken just one bite out of it. I don't begrudge a little bit of grass here in AZ, but the Hilton's consumption is unnecessary and pretty obnoxious. A resort in this price range can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Hotel, Except for Food Choices”
Reviews.Author: Coolfallday
Reviews.Content: We ended our spring break vacation at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak, after a busy site seeing trek from Phoenix up to the Grand Canyon and back. This is a perfect way to end a hectic vacation schedule. Squaw Peak is a beautiful, classy resort, built for families. The grounds and rooms were pristine. Our room was very comfortable. Our kids (ages 6 and 9) loved it! We played mini golf and took advantage of the water park and smaller pools. Chairs at the water park filled up very quickly. They do have a policy of no saving chairs, but that policy was largely ignored. We paid $235 per night during spring break (taxes included), which was fair considering the quality of the resort and amenities. Mini golf, tennis, exercise room were all extra, but we discovered that if pay for one activity you were then able to add on other activities or services for a flat $2 fee (i.i. we paid for mini golf, but then were able to use the exercise room for a flat $2 for the remainder of our stay). NEGATIVE: Eating at this resort is very, very expensive. If you are spending the day at the water park, you are basically captive to the pool side offerings, especially if you want to hold your spot at the pool. Kid baskets (hot dog or hamburger, chips and beverage w/ one free refill) were reasonably priced at $6.25, but that certainly did not hold my kids for the entire day. Snow cones, snacks, and adult food and drink were very pricey. We splurged at the pool, but left the grounds for breakfast and dinner to limit spending. We really enjoyed Squaw Peak and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMomof3
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: We came here for our spring break to escape the cold in Michigan. Usually we go to Florida, but my kids had never been out West, so we thought this would be fun...and it was! The best thing about the resort are all the pools. The lazy river is even bigger than I expected ! There is something for all ages at the River Ranch pool area, which is good because my kids range from ages 4-14. Each building also has its own smaller pool too, and that's where we made lots of friends. The weather was beautiful and we ended up just hanging at the resort more than we'd planned. The place was packed with families....kids running EVERYWHERE. No big deal because 3 of them were mine. If I had come for a quiet week with my husband, I would have left. There is a very peaceful adult-only pool at the fitness center that I snuck over to once. The room was good, but not great. Funky smell at first, but I always bring candles. It also seemed dark to me, but maybe it was our location. Since we are a family of five, it was a little tight in the suite after a while. If we were to go back, I would definitely consider upgrading to a casita. There was a little fridge, but it didn't work very well and no microwave.
